text: this report presents the solution and results of our team MSRA_SC in the Commonsense Persona-Grounded Dialogue Challenge (CPDC 2025) we propose a simple yet effective framework that unifies improvements across both GPU Track and API Track . our method centers on two key components: dynamic tool pruning and persona clipping for input compression, combined with post-processing techniques such as parameter normalization and function merging .

text: multimodal large language models (MLLMs) achieve remarkable capabilities . but they fail to achieve benign forgetting because they often degrade the model's general image understanding performance . to address this, we propose the Sculpted Memory Forgetting Adapter (SMFA), which confines forgetting to targeted memory regions while preserving overall capabilities. label: ai

text: Transformer architectures have achieved remarkable success across language, vision, and multimodal tasks . in these tasks, models solve the target problems by inferring compositional rules from context examples . but some of these tasks remain challenging for Transformers, which are not inherently designed to handle compositional tasks and offer limited structural inductive bias . we propose a reformulation of the attention to enhance its capability for compositional task .
label: ai

text: Separation Logic is arguably the most popular framework for reasoning about heap-manipulating programs, as well as reasoning about shared resources and permissions . many theoretical and practical advances have been made in developing automated proof mechanisms for SLID, but these mechanisms are imperfect . in this paper we study these sources of incompleteness and how they relate to failures of proof mechanisms . we present a prototype tool that implements the FOL encoding of WSL and test it on an existing benchmark .

text: video text-based visual question answering task aims to answer questions about videos by leveraging the visual text appearing within the videos . this task poses significant challenges, requiring models to accurately perceive and comprehend scene text that varies in scale, orientation, and clarity across frames . model must identify question-relevant textual cues and filter out redundant or irrelevant information to ensure answering is guided by the most relevant and informative cue .

text: the corresponding structural causal model (SCM) for this task has been overlooked . in practice, two approaches dominate: the first estimates pointwise conditional treatment effects and then fits a tree on those estimates . the second constructs decision trees or rule sets with ad-hoc 'causal' heuristics . supervised learning problem (regression or classification) allows us to adopt any partition-based methods to learn the subgroup .

text: sparse grids offer a powerful solution by mitigating the curse of dimensionality compared to full tensor grids . but they treat all regions of the domain isotropically, which may not be efficient for functions with localized or anisotropic behavior . this work presents a surrogate-informed framework for constructing sparsese grid interpolants, which is guided by an error indicator .

text: Exo2EgoSyn is an adaptation of WAN 2.2 that unlocks cross-view video synthesis . the framework consists of three key modules . exocentric-to-egocentric video conditioning (WAN) enforces latent-space alignment from the given exo view toward the ego view . WAN2.2 is a unified conditioning signal, extending WAN2 beyond its vanilla single-image or text conditioning .

text: the model has 35.9M parameters and uses a custom tokenizer designed for the language's morphological structure . to evaluate performance, we create kyrgyz-sst2, a sentiment analysis benchmark built by translating the Stanford Sentiment Treebank . the model achieves an F1-score of 0.8280, competitive with a fine-tuned mBERT model five times larger .

text: MAILA trained MAILA to predict 1.3 million mental-health self-reports from 20,000 cursor and touchscreen recordings recorded in 9,000 online participants . the dataset includes 2,000 individuals assessed longitudinally, 1,500 diagnosed with depression, and 500 with obsessive-compulsive disorder . MAILA tracks dynamic mental states along three orthogonal dimensions, generalizes across contexts, and achieves near-ceiling accuracy .

text: Sequential Recommendation System(SRS) has become pivotal in modern society . traditional collaborative filtering-based sequential recommendation models often lead to suboptimal performance due to the limited information of their collaborative signals . text: we present the first battery-powered, wearable pupil-center-tracking system with complete on-device integration . we combine event-based sensing and neuromorphic processing on the commercially available Speck2f system-on-chip with lightweight coordinate decoding on a low-power microcontroller . our solution features a novel uncertainty-quantifying spiking neural network with gated temporal decoding .

text: Adaptive Contrastive Approach (AdaCap) combines permutation-based contrastive loss with a Tikhonov-based output mapping . a meta-predictor trained on dataset characteristics accurately anticipates when AdaCap is beneficial . all results and code are publicly available at https://github.com/BrunoBelucci/adacap .

text: multimodal sentiment analysis remains a challenging task due to the inherent heterogeneity across modalities . a factorized multimodal fusion framework disentangles each modality into shared and unique representations and then suppresses task-irrelevant noise within both . this fine-grained decomposition improves representation quality by reducing redundancy, prompting cross-modal complementarity, and isolating task-relevant sentiment cues .

text: MAP-World is a prior-free multi-modal planning framework that couples masked action planning with a path-weighted world model . a compact latent planning state is expanded into multiple trajectory queries with injected noise, yielding diverse, temporally consistent modes without anchor libraries or teacher policies . the planner learns from the full distribution of plausible futures instead of a single selected path .

text: the proposed method consistently outperforms state-of-the-art models in disease status prediction and cognitive score regression . the model exhibits stable performance across varying sequence lengths and missing data rates, indicating strong temporal generalizability . a Riemannian manifold mapping, a Time-aware Neural ordinary differential equation, and an Attention-based riemannian Gated recurrent unit (R-TNAG) framework .

text: Flow matching has emerged as a promising generative approach that addresses the lengthy sampling times associated with state-of-the-art diffusion models . text: node-to-edge (N2E) is a general framework that reduces graph analytical tasks to edge-DP ones . this leads to poor utility when the bound is set conservatively large to accommodate worst-case inputs . we propose a distance-preserving clipping mechanism that bounds edge distance between neighboring graphs after clipping . the framework achieves up to a 2.5x reduction in error for edge counting and 80x reduction for degree distribution estimation .

text: DMs have gained significant interest for their exceptional potential in recommendation tasks . this stems primarily from their prominent capability in distilling, modeling, and generating comprehensive user preferences . previous work fails to examine recommender models through a rigorous lens . we propose a minimalistic diffusion framework that incorporates both factors via the maximization of Helmholtz free energy .

text: Grammatical error correction (GEC) is an important task in Natural Language Processing . this task aims to automatically detect and correct grammatical errors in text . for most Indic languages, GEC remains a challenging task due to limited resources, linguistic diversity and complex morphology . in this work, we explore prompting-based approaches using state-of-the-art large language models (LLMs) and few-shot strategy to adapt them to low-resource settings .

text: this paper addresses hierarchical secure aggregation (HSA) against relay and user collusion in homogeneous networks . each user connects to $n$ relays and each relay serves $m$ users . in the two-phase communication framework, users transmit masked data to relays, which then process and forward compiled messages to the server for exact sum recovery .

text: LungEvaty is a fully transformer-based framework for predicting 1-6 year lung cancer risk from a single LDCT scan . existing approaches either over-rely on pixel-level annotations, limiting scalability, or analyze the lung in fragments, weakening performance . the framework offers a simple, data-efficient, and fully open-source solution that provides an extensible foundation for future research .

text: gross substitutes rewards (a well-studied strict subclass of submodular functions) admit a deterministic poly-time $O(1)$-approximation, using only value queries . we present an FPTAS for additive rewards, demonstrating that arbitrary approximation is tractable under any budget . this constitutes the first FPT AS for multi-agent combinatorial-actions setting, even in the absence of budget constraints.

text: climate science requires automated workflows to transform comprehensive questions into data-driven statements across massive, heterogeneous datasets . climateAgent decomposes user questions into executable sub-tasks coordinated by an Orchestrate-agent and a Plan-Agent; acquires data via specialized Data-Agens that dynamically introspect APIs to synthesize robust download scripts; and completes analysis and reporting .

text: EM2LDL is a novel multilingual speech corpus designed to advance mixed emotion recognition through label distribution learning . the corpus integrates spontaneous emotional expressions from online platforms, annotated with fine-grained emotion distributions across 32 categories . empathetic systems for applications in affective computing, including mental health monitoring and cross-cultural communication are publicly available at https://github.com/xingfengli/EM2.

text: this study investigates the application of the light Gradient Boosting Machine (LGBM) model for both deterministic and probabilistic forecasting of Bitcoin realized volatility . the results demonstrate that LGBM models effectively capture the nonlinear and high-variance characteristics of cryptocurrency markets while providing interpretable insights into the underlying volatility dynamics . econometric and machine learning baselines are used to identify the main drivers of volatility, using gain-based and permutation feature importance techniques .

text: world models aim to capture spatio-temporal correlations between an agent's actions and the evolving environment . but existing approaches often suffer from tight runtime coupling or depend on offline reward signals . we develop a trainable reward model that infuses world knowledge into a teacher policy by aligning candidate trajectories with the future dynamics predicted by the world model .

text: digital ghosts are moving from fiction to commercial reality, reshaping how people mourn and remember . this paper offers a conceptual and ethical analysis of digital afterlives . we define what counts as a digital ghost, trace their rise across personal, commercial, and institutional contexts, and identify core ethical tensions around grief and well-being, truthfulness and deception, consent and posthumous privacy .

text: traditional automatic program repair methods define dedicated search spaces to locate and fix bugs with program synthesis . but they heavily rely on fixed templates and can only deal with limited bugs . to address these challenges, we propose R3A, an LLM-based automatic RTL program repair framework upon the basic model to improve reliability . the algorithm samples search states according to a heuristic function to balance between exploration and exploitation .

text: Visual Anomaly Detection (VAD) has gained significant attention due to its ability to identify anomalous images using only normal images during training . many VAD models work without supervision but are still able to provide visual explanations by highlighting the anomalous regions within an image . concept bottleneck models can provide human-interpretable descriptions of anomalies, offering a novel and more insightful way to explain them .

text: BiasPrompting is a novel inference framework that guides LLMs to generate and critically evaluate reasoning across all plausible answer options . the model is prompted to produce supportive reasonings for each answer option, and then, a reasoning-guided agreement stage, where the generated reasonings are synthesized to select the most plausible answer . our experiments show that BiaSprompting demonstrates significant improvements in five widely used multiple-choice question answering benchmarks .

text: vision-interleaved chain-of-Thought Framework (VICoT) implements explicit multi-round reasoning by dynamically incorporating visual tools into the chain of thought . we propose the Reasoning Stack distillation method to migrate complex Agent behaviors to small, lightweight models, which ensures the reasoning capability while significantly reducing complexity . the current remote sensing image analysis task is increasingly evolving from traditional object recognition to complex intelligence reasoning, which places higher requirements on the model's reasoning ability .

text: the increasing use of Internet-of-Things (IoT) sensors in moving objects has resulted in vast amounts of spatiotemporal streaming data . current stream processing systems designed for IoT environments often lack spatial processing capabilities . integrating MEOS into NebulaStream, we present a scalable data management system for ioT applications .

text: the method exploits the band-sparsity of wireless channels in the delay-beamspace domain by solving a regularized optimization problem in a reproducing kernel Hilbert space . we solve the resulting optimization problem using a forward-backward splitting (FBS)-based algorithm . by exploiting the problem's modulation structure, we achieve a computational complexity per iteration that is quasi-linear in the number of unknown variables .

text: chemical exchange saturation transfer (CEST) MRI enables molecular-level visualization of low-concentration metabolites by leveraging proton exchange dynamics . however, its clinical translation is hindered by inherent challenges: spatially varying noise arising from hardware limitations . traditional denoising methods are not designed for this complex noise and often alter the underlying information that is critical for biomedical analysis .

text: adaptive framework based on large language models aims to personalize therapeutic interaction according to user's psychological state . framework defines three specialized agents, L, M, and H, each linked to a different level of illness acceptance . text: Octilinear graph drawings are a standard paradigm extending the orthogonal graph drawing style by two additional slopes (+1 and -1) we are interested in two constrained drawing problems where the input specifies a so-called representation, that is: a planar embedding; the angles occurring between adjacent edges; the bends along each edge . in Orthogonal Compaction the goal is to find such a drawing using minimum area .

text: 'task' and 'step' descriptions fail to form a robust alignment with the concrete, observable details in visual data . to enforce this structure, we propose a progressive pre-training strategy that unfolds the TSS hierarchy, forcing the model to ground representations in states while associating them with steps and high-level tasks . our method outperforms baseline models on multiple downstream tasks, including task recognition, step recognition, and next step prediction .

text: Personalized Large Language Models (PLLMs) aim to align model outputs with individual user preferences, a crucial capability for user-centric applications . but the prevalent approach of fine-tuning a separate module for each user faces two major limitations: storage costs scale linearly with the number of users, rendering the method unscalable . to address these challenges, we propose a Merge-then-Adapt framework .

text: PRADA (Probability-Ratio-Based Attribution and Detection of Autoregressive-Generated Images) is a simple and interpretable approach that can reliably detect AR-generated images and attribute them to their respective source model . if an image is generated by a particular model, its probability ratio shows unique characteristics which are not present for images generated by other models .
label: ai

text: our dataset covers 42 built-in macOS applications and 1,260 human-labeled tasks across a wide range of scenarios . our framework achieves up to 73 percent accuracy in task success detection and yields an average relative improvement of 27 percent in overall task success when evaluator feedback is applied . we present an autonomous evaluation and feedback framework that uses vision-language models to assess task completion directly from screenshots and task descriptions .

text: we propose Scalable and Optimistic MBRL (SOMBRL) approach based on the principle of optimism in the face of uncertainty . text: balancing compression ratio and reconstruction quality is difficult because low-frequency and high-frequency components contribute differently at the same resolution . we propose a frequency-aware compression model that enables the compression of a full scan with high compression ratios . the method achieves state-of-the-art rate-distortion performance and outperforms the standard codecs by 78% and 94% in BD-rate .

text: self-supervised monocular depth estimation serves as a key task in the development of endoscopic navigation systems . however, performance degradation persists due to uneven illumination inherent in endoscopic images . existing low-light enhancement techniques fail to effectively guide the depth network . solutions from other fields, like autonomous driving, require well-lit images, making them unsuitable and increasing data collection burdens .

text: Personalized Visual Language Models (VLMs) are gaining increasing attention for their formidable ability in user-specific concepts aligned interactions . existing methods typically require the learning of separate embeddings for each new concept, which fails to support real-time adaptation during testing . this limitation becomes particularly pronounced in large-scale scenarios, where efficient retrieval of concept embeddeds is not achievable .

text: in this paper, we present an active exploration framework for high-fidelity 3D reconstruction . we introduce a hybrid implicit-explicit representation that fuses neural fields with Gaussian primitives to jointly capture global structural priors and locally observed details . based on this hybrid state, we derive a hierarchical uncertainty volume that quantifies both implicit global structure quality and explicit local surface confidence .

text: on-device searches, such as k-nearest neighbor (kNN) search and radius search, are commonly used to enable fast analytics and learning technologies . to maintain high search efficiency, a representative approach is to utilize a balanced multi-way KD-tree . however, the index has shown limited gains, mostly due to substantial construction overhead, inflexibility to real-time insertion, and inconsistent query performance .

text: RED-F employs a contrastive forecast that transforms the difficult task of absolute signal detection into a simpler, more robust task of relative trajectory comparison by computing the divergence between these two predictive streams . the REM uses a hybrid time-frequency mechanism to mitigate the precursor, generating a purified baseline and the original sequence which retains the precursor as parallel inputs .

text: in recent years, point-based methods directly generate point clouds without relying on other representations such as latent features, meshes, or voxels . these methods offer low training cost and algorithmic simplicity, but often underperform compared to representation-based approaches . in this paper, we propose MFM-Point, a multi-scale Flow Matching framework for point cloud generation that substantially improves generation quality and scalability .

text: safety-Critical Reasoning is a new task that leverages multi-view inputs to address this challenge . to support this, we introduce WaymoQA, a dataset of 35,000 human-annotated question-answer pairs covering complex, high-risk driving scenarios . existing MLLMs underperform in safety-critical scenarios compared to normal scenes .

text: cross-modal interaction Transformer (ACIT) for pedestrian crossing intention prediction . text: the Cognitive Buffer Hypothesis (CBH) posits that larger brains evolved to enhance survival in changing conditions . however, larger . brains carry higher energy demands, imposing additional metabolic burdens . alongside brain size, brain organization plays a key . role in cognitive ability and, with suitable architectures, may help mitigate energy challenges . results indicate that under energy constraints, increasing seasonality led to smaller ANNs.

text: iRadioDiff is a sampling-free diffusion-based framework for indoor RM construction . it is conditioned on access point (AP) positions, and physics-informed prompt encoded by material reflection and transmission coefficients . the design enables accurate modeling of nonstationary field discontinuities and efficient construction of physically consistent RMs. the code is available at https://github.com/UNIC-Lab/iRadiodiff .

text: in this paper, we propose a multi-context fusion Transformer (MFT) that leverages diverse numerical contextual attributes across four key dimensions . this includes pedestrian behavior context, environmental context, pedestrian localization context and vehicle motion context, to enable accurate pedestrian intention prediction . a progressive fusion strategy is used to facilitate feature sequence fusion and yield a context token as a contextual representation .

text: cross-disciplinary methods rely on overlapping entities between disciplines for knowledge transfer through simple mapping functions . insufficient student interaction data in target discipline prevents effective knowledge state modeling and performance prediction . we propose mixed of experts and Adversarial Generative Network-based Cross-disciplinary Cold-start Knowledge Tracing Framework to overcome these challenges . the method's effectiveness across 20 extreme cross-disciplinary cold-start scenarios .

text: GigaWorld-0 combines 3D generative modeling, 3D Gaussian Splatting reconstruction, physically differentiable system identification, and executable motion planning to ensure geometric consistency and physical realism . the unified world model framework is designed explicitly as a data engine for Vision-Language-Action (VLA) learning . in this work, we present a unified global model framework designed explicitly for embodied AI .

text: vision-Language-Action models built upon Chain-of-Thought (CoT) have achieved remarkable success in advancing general-purpose robotic agents . a highly promising strategy involves leveraging visual priors to guide robotic action generation . to address these challenges, we propose a Vision-Integrated Trajectory Alignment framework that learn a shared discrete latent space for vision and action .
label: ai

text: clinical documentation contains factual, diagnostic, and management errors . but their behavior under different prompting strategies remains unclear . we evaluated nine instruction-tuned LLMs (GPT, Claude, Gemini, and OpenAI o-series models) we measured performance using accuracy, recall, false-positive rate (FPR) and an aggregate score of ROUGE-1, BLEURT, and BERTScore .
label: ai

text: TimeArtist is a temporal-visual conversion framework that pioneers semantic-level alignment between time series fluctuations and visual concepts . it pioneers a "warmup-align" paradigm: first, a dual-autoencoder and shared quantizer are self-supervised trained on large-scale datasets to learn modality-shared representations . a projection is introduced to align temporal and visual samples at the representation level .
label: ai

text: existing methods based on 3D Gaussian Splatting typically bind Gaussians to mesh triangles and model deformations solely via Linear Blend Skinning . they lack specialized strategies to handle frequently occluded regions (e.g., mouth interiors, eyelids) to address these limitations, we propose STAvatar .
label: ai

text: Personalized Large Language Models (LLMs) have been shown to be an effective way to create more engaging and enjoyable user-AI interactions . previous studies have explored using prompts to elicit specific personality traits in LLMs, but they have not optimized them to maximize personality expression . we propose PersonaPulse: Dynamic Profile Optimization for realistic personality expression in lLMs .
label: ai

text: federated learning (FL) and split learning (SL) are effective distributed learning paradigms in wireless networks, enabling collaborative model training across mobile devices without sharing raw data . SL achieves higher accuracy through sequential training but suffers from increased delay . this paper aims to accelerate HSFL by addressing three key questions: 1) How does learning mode selection affect overall learning performance? 3) How does it interact with batch size?
label: ai

text: prevailing methods rely on polylines that struggle to model curvilinear geometry . we introduce the Bézier Graph, a differentiable parametric curve-based representation . the primary obstacle to this representation is to obtain the difficult-to-construct vector ground-truth (GT) we sidestep this bottleneck by reframing the task as a global optimization problem .
label: ai

text: scalar rewards with limited ability to express temporal, conditional, or safety-critical goals can lead to reward hacking . lincoln-based RL algorithm combines $$-regular objectives with explicit constraints . we create a translation to constrained limit-average problems with optimality-preserving guarantees . the licensors are able to use a 'research tool' to solve the problem .
label: ai

text: we propose a batch denoising framework, followed by a joint optimization of content generation and transmission . the STACKING operates independently of any specific form of the content quality function and achieves lower computational complexity . based on the batch solution, we further optimize bandwidth allocation across AIGC services . results demonstrate the superior performance of our algorithm in delivering high-quality, lower-latency AIGC service provisioning in wireless edge networks .
label: ai

text: vision foundation models can perform generalized object classification in zero-shot mode . but fine-tuned models suffer from catastrophic forgetting . we introduce two variants of the interleaved multi-distribution identity curriculum . a gradient-coupled training schedule fines a foundation backbone simultaneously on all four tasks simultaneously . the IMIC method proved effective with three foundation model bases .
label: ai

text: self-explaining geospatial regression tree combines three coupled objectives during recursive splitting . recast local Lipschitz continuity of feature attributions as a network community preservation problem . the framework demonstrates how spatial similarity - extended beyond geometric proximity through GWR-derived local relationships - can be embedded in interpretable models and offering a transferable template for domain-aware explainability .
label: ai

text: we introduce a strategy-robust notion of regret for multi-buyer online environments, capturing worst-case strategic behavior in the spirit of the Price of anarchy . we propose our main construction: the Sparse Update Mechanism (SUM), a simple yet effective sequential mechanism that ensures robustness to all Nash equilibria among buyers .
label: ai

text: the Cisco Time Series Model is the result of a general architectural innovation to a time series model enabling it to accept multiresolution input . the resulting decoder-only model is trained on over 300B unique data points, with more than half coming from the observability domain . resulting model achieves superior performance while retaining very similar performance on a standard general-purpose forecasting benchmark (GIFT-Eval)
label: ai

text: Graph Similarity Computation (GSC) is a fundamental graph related task . GCGSim, a GED-consistent graph similarity learning framework centering on graph-level matching and substructure-level edit costs, achieves state-of-the-art performance . the framework effectively learns disentangled and semantically meaningful substructure representations .
label: ai

text: world models are emerging as a cornerstone of next-generation multimodal intelligence systems . they aim to construct realistic, dynamic, and physically consistent 3D/4D worlds from images, videos, or text . prior benchmarks emphasize different evaluation dimensions and lack a unified assessment of world-realism capability . the 4DWorldBench measures models across four key dimensions: Perceptual Quality, Condition-4D Alignment, Physical Realism and 4D Consistency .
label: ai

text: attention sparsity reduces computational costs by focusing on critical tokens while ignoring non-critical tokens . existing methods suffer from severe performance degradation . to address these issues, we propose Rectified SpaAttn, which rectifies attention allocation with implicit full attention reference, thereby enhancing the alignment between sparse and full attention maps . we propose Gain-Aware Pooling Rectification, which ensures that the rectified gain consistently surpasses the induced error .
label: ai

text: BHD-RAG is a multimodal retrieval-augmented generation framework that integrates DCLD-specific expertise and clinical precedents with MLLMs to improve BHD diagnostic accuracy . BHDRAG employs a specialized agent generating imaging manifestation descriptions of CT images to construct a multiple-modal corpus of DCLDs cases . the framework is based on a dataset involving four types of Diffuse Cystic Lung Diseases (DCLDs)
label: ai

text: workflow scheduling on HPC infrastructures remains challenging due to the prevalence of non-uniform memory access (NUMA) architectures . modern HPC nodes integrate multiple NUMA domains and heterogeneous memory regions, such as high-bandwidth memory (HBM) and DRAM . this design increases the variability of data-access latency and complicates the placement of both tasks and data .
label: ai

text: multi-modal analytical processing has the potential to transform applications in e-commerce, healthcare, entertainment, and beyond . the emergence of foundation models, particularly the large language models, opens up new opportunities to develop flexible, semantic-aware data analytics systems . Nirvana addresses two key challenges: first, it features an agentic logical optimizer that uses natural language-specified transformation rules and random-walk-based search .
label: ai

text: prompt-optimization methods refine a static template, making them ineffective in complex user scenarios . existing query-dependent approaches rely on unstable textual feedback or black-box reward models, providing weak and uninterpretable optimization signals . evaluator then instructs a metric-aware optimizer that diagnoses failure modes and rewrites prompts directly from text .
label: ai

text: a class of "zero-determinant" strategies enables a player to unilaterally enforce linear payoff relationships in repeated games . this is because it can shape the incentives for the opponent in a predetermined way . in infinite-horizon games, extensions to discounted games, nonlinear payoff relations, richer strategic environments, and behaviors with long memory remain incompletely understood . our main result establishes that any such enforceable relationship can actually be implemented using a two-point reactive learning strategy .
label: ai

text: we present a new camera-controlled video retake generation method for dynamically captured variable-length videos . the method generalizes to out-of-distribution camera trajectories and video lengths, yielding improved dynamic object localization and static background preservation . extensive experiments further demonstrate significant improvements in camera controllability, geometric consistency, and video quality across various lengths .
label: ai

text: SMoE architectures have enabled a new frontier in scaling Large Language Models (LLMs), offering superior performance by activating only a fraction of their total parameters during inference . however, their practical deployment is severely hampered by substantial static memory overhead, as all experts must be loaded into memory . a catastrophic performance degradation when the pruned model is applied to other domains necessitating a costly re-pruning for each new domain .
label: ai

text: CropVLM is an external low-cost method for boosting performance . enables VLMs to dynamically 'zoom in' on relevant image regions . model is trained using reinforcement learning, without human-labeled bounding boxes as a supervision signal, and without expensive synthetic evaluations . our approach delivers significant improvements on tasks that require high-resolution image understanding, notably for benchmarks that are out-of-domain .
label: ai

text: Sentiment analysis is a helpful task to automatically analyse opinions and emotions on various topics . many african languages are classified as low-resource languages due to the lack of digital language resources like text labelled with corresponding sentiment classes . automatic and rapid processes are needed to reduce the manual effort making the labelling process as efficient as possible . we present and analyze an automatic language-independent sentiment labelling method that leverages information from sentiment-bearing emojis and words .
label: ai

text: the new NRC VAD Lexicon v2 now has entries for 10k MWEs and 25k words, in addition to the entries in v1 . the lexicon enables a wide variety of research in NLP, Psychology, Public Health, Digital Humanities, and Social Sciences . it is freely available through the project webpage: http://saifmohammad.com/WebPages/nrc-vad.html .
label: ai

text: can decoding of binary sum-rank-metric codes $SR(C_1,C_2)$ with $2times2$ matrix blocks be reduced entirely to decoding the constituent Hamming-metric code $C_1$ and $c_2$ without the additional requirement $d_1getfrac23d_mathrmsr$ that underlies their fast decoder?
label: ai

text: low-diversity models tend to generate repetitive outputs, increasing sampling redundancy and hindering both creative exploration and downstream applications . a primary cause is that generation often collapses toward a strong mode in the learned distribution . existing attempts to improve diversity, such as noise resampling, prompt rewriting, or steering-based guidance, often still collapse to dominant modes .
label: ai

text: LCAQ sensors have been shown to play a critical role in the establishment of dense, expansive air-quality monitoring networks . the calibration of sensors against regulatory-grade monitors is an expensive, laborious and time-consuming process, especially when a large number of sensors are to be deployed in a geographically diverse layout . RESPIRE offers specific advantages over baseline calibration methods popular in literature, such as improved prediction in cross-site, cross-season, and cross-sensor settings.
label: ai

text: new framework conceptualizes noisy label correction as a reinforcement learning problem . RLNLC learns a deep feature representation based policy network to perform label correction through reinforcement learning . the learned policy is subsequently deployed to iteratively correct noisy labels and facilitate the training of the prediction model . it is demonstrated through extensive experiments on multiple benchmark datasets, where it consistently outperforms existing state-of-the-art techniques for learning with noisy labels .
label: ai

text: VLMs are deployed in safety-critical applications . their ability to abstain from answering when uncertain becomes crucial for reliability . existing methods suggest pessimistic answers: they either rely on miscalibrated output probabilities or require semantic agreement unsuitable for OCR tasks . this failure may indicate we are looking in the wrong place: uncertainty signals could be hidden in VLM's internal representations .
label: ai

text: we investigated complex-valued Variational AutoEncoders (CVAE) for radar Out-Of-Distribution detection in complex radar environments . we proposed several detection metrics: the reconstruction error of CVAE-MSE, the latent-based scores (Mahalanobis, Kullback-Leibler divergence) and compared their performance against the classical ANMF-FP detector . the performance of all these detectors is analyzed on synthetic and experimental radar data, showing the advantages
label: ai

text: data attribution seeks to trace model behavior back to the training examples that shaped it, enabling debugging, auditing, and data valuation at scale . classical influence-function methods offer a principled foundation but remain impractical for modern networks because they require expensive backpropagation or Hessian inversion at inference . a method that preserves the same first-order counterfactual target while eliminating per-query backward passes .
label: ai

text: to address this challenge, we developed KOM, a multi-agent system designed to automate KOA evaluation, risk prediction, and treatment prescription . this system assists clinicians in performing essential tasks across the KOA care pathway and supports the generation of tailored management plans based on individual patient profiles, disease status, risk factors, and contraindications . the modular architecture of KOM may also offer valuable insights for developing AI-assisted management systems for other chronic conditions .

text: TVM models the transition between any two diffusion timesteps . it regularizes its behavior at its terminal time rather than at the initial time . a fused attention kernel supports backward passes on Jacobian-Vector Products . TVM achieves 3.29 FID with a single function evaluation (NFE) and 1.99 FID on ImageNet-512x512 .

text: we propose a simple, PC-friendly evaluation protocol based on paired multi-seed runs and bias-corrected and accelerated (BCa) bootstrap confidence intervals . the protocol is intentionally conservative and is meant as a guardrail against over-claiming . single runs and unpaired t-tests often suggest significant gains for 0.6-2.0 point improvements, especially on text .

text: distributed quantum computing (DQC) offers a pathway by coordinating multiple QPUs to execute large-scale circuits . however, its realization depends on advances in hardware-level components such as quantum transducers and high-fidelity entanglement-distribution modules . the software ecosystem lacks a circuit-level simulator that models heterogeneous backends, noisy connections, and distributed execution .

text: in this work, we examine fairness within the domain of emotional theory of mind . we propose and evaluate several debiasing strategies, demonstrating that achieving meaningful reductions in bias requires training based interventions rather than relying solely on inference-time prompt-based approaches such as prompt engineering . if a person is a gender biased person, it's a good idea to be a fair person .
label: ai

text: method leverages retrieval-augmented prompting, logit biasing and optional classification heads to inject symbolic intent structure into both input and output representations . we formalize a new evaluation metric-Semantic Intent Similarity (SIS)-based on hierarchical ontology depth, capturing semantic proximity even when predicted intents differ lexically .

text: cross-resolution phase-Aligned Attention (CRPA) is a training-free drop-in fix that eliminates this failure at its source . text: VISTA-Gym is a scalable training environment for incentivizing tool-integrated visual reasoning capabilities in VLMs . it unifies diverse real-world multimodal reasoning tasks (7 tasks from 13 datasets in total) with a standard interface for visual tools (e.g., grounding, parsing), executable interaction loops, verifiable feedback signals .
label: ai

text: large vision-language models (VLMs) have improved embodied question answering agents by providing strong semantic priors for open-vocabulary reasoning . but when used directly for step-level exploration, VLMs often exhibit frontier oscillations, unstable back-and-forth movements caused by overconfidence and miscalibration . our method prunes implausible frontier choices using a Holm-Bonferroni inspired pruning procedure and then delegates final decisions to a coverage-based planner .
label: ai

text: weakly supervised semantic segmentation (WSSS) must learn dense masks from noisy, under-specified cues . our method, CrispFormer, augments the decoder with: (1) a boundary branch that supervises thin object contours using a lightweight edge head . (2) an uncertainty-guided refiner that predicts per-pixel aleatoric uncertainty and uses it to gate a residual correction of the segmentation logits .
label: ai

text: ADL compilers optimize datapaths and convert software-like control flow constructs into control paths . resulting performance can be difficult to control, requiring guesswork to find and resolve performance problems in the generated hardware . we argue for compiler understanding tools that give ADL programmers insight into how the compiler's decisions affect performance . the compiler was unable to perform automatically, including a reduction by 46.9% of total cycles for one application .
label: ai

text: relative angle computed as the angle between the normal vector and the average normal vector of its parent point cloud . this single-dimensional feature provides directionality information equivalent to normal vectors for concrete surface defect characteristics . by training and testing with PointNet++, models based on the relative angles achieved similar performance to that of models basing on standard vectors while delivering 27.6% storage reduction and 83% input channel compression.
label: ai

text: vision-language models (VLMs) have demonstrated strong generalization and few-shot capabilities across diverse visual domains . text: language understanding entails extracting the surface-level meaning of the linguistic input, but constructing rich mental models of the situation it describes . deep understanding language requires exporting information from the language system to other brain regions that compute perceptual and motor representations, construct mental models, and store our world knowledge and autobiographical memories . we review the existing evidence for this hypothesis and argue that recent progress in cognitive neuroscience provides both the conceptual foundation and the methods to directly test it .
label: ai

text: multimodal neural networks have seen increasing use for identifying species to help automate this task . but they have two major drawbacks: first, their black-box nature prevents the interpretability of their decision making process . second, collecting genetic data is often expensive and requires invasive procedures, often necessitating researchers to capture or kill the target specimen .
label: ai

text: PathFMTools enables efficient execution, analysis, and visualization of pathology foundation models . we use this tool to interface with and evaluate two state-of-the-art vision-language foundation models, CONCH and MUSK, on the task of histological grading in cutaneous squamous cell carcinoma (cSCC), a critical criterion .
label: ai

text: DISCO: an open-source DIStributed COllaborative learning platform accessible to non-technical users . it trains models locally directly in the browser, making our tool cross-platform out-of-the-box . the modular design of disco offers choices between federated and decentralized paradigms, various levels of privacy guarantees and several approaches to weight aggregation strategies .
label: ai

text: traditional human alignment reviews are accurate but slow and labor-intensive . we tested three LLMs across three tasks that mirror real-world challenges . identifying misaligned items, selecting the correct skill from the full set of standards, and narrowing candidate lists prior to classification . in study 1, GPT-4o-mini correctly identified alignment status in approximately 83-94% of cases, including subtle misalignments .

text: the subdivision construction builds on the framework of stable canonical rules . it produces a finite modal algebra (finite modal space) that will yield the fmp . a class of union-splittings in corresponding lattices is identified in $mathsfNExt(mathext)$ with Kripke incompleteness .

text: each handoff between a satellite and ground users introduces additional signaling and power consumption . this work focuses on the optimization of the total transmission rate in a LEO-to-user system . we consider a system where LEO satellites serve users located in remote areas with no terrestrial connectivity, and formulate the power allocation problem as a mixed-integer concave linear program subject to power and association constraints .
label: ai

text: Optimal Transport (OT) offers a powerful framework for finding correspondences between distributions and addressing matching and alignment problems in various areas of computer vision . the computation cost of OT hinders its scalability by leveraging the closed-form solutions of 1D OT problems . these methods optimize a one-dimensional projection to obtain a conditional transport plan that minimizes the transport cost in the ambient space .
label: ai

text: CAMformer reinterprets attention as an associative memory operation and computes attention scores using a voltage-domain Binary Attention Content Addressable Memory (BA-CAM) this enables constant-time similarity search through analog charge sharing, replacing digital arithmetic with physical similarity sensing . the accelerator integrates hierarchical two-stage top-k filtering, pipelined execution, and high-precision contextualization .
label: ai

text: this study evaluates ten transformer-based embedding models adapted for cardiology through low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) fine-tuning on 106,535 cardiology text pairs . results demonstrate that encoder-only architectures achieve superior domain-specific performance (separation score: 0.510) compared to larger decoder-based models, while requiring significantly less computational resources .
label: ai

text: studies using real-world data (RWD) are now recognized to be important . the future of evidence generation will not depend on RCTs versus RWD, or statistics versus AI/ML, but on their principled integration . to this end, a causal roadmap is needed to clarify inferential goals, make assumptions explicit, and ensure transparency about tradeoffs .
label: ai

text: human listening studies remain the gold standard for assessing perceptual quality, but they are time-consuming and impractical . to this end, we conduct a MUSHRA listening test on high-fidelity speech signals and analyze the correlation between subjective scores and widely used objective metrics . our findings provide practical guidance for selecting appropriate evaluation metrics when using neural audio codecs for speech .
label: ai

text: large language models (LLMs) offer a new paradigm by leveraging pretrained knowledge and universal token-based representations to propose experiments directly from text-based descriptions . we introduce an LLM-based active learning framework that operates in an iterative few-shot setting and benchmark it against conventional ML models across four diverse materials science datasets . Across all datasets, lLM-AL could reduce the number of experiments needed to reach top-performing candidates by over 70% .
label: ai

text: small objects often remain difficult to detect from high altitudes due to low object-to-background pixel ratios . we propose an altitude-aware dynamic tiling method that scales and adaptively subdivides the image into tiles for enhanced small object detection . the approach improves Mean Average Precision (mAP) for small objects by 38% compared to a baseline .
label: ai

text: large Language Models (LLMs) remain vulnerable to prompt injection attacks . we present Prompt Fencing, a novel architectural approach that uses cryptographic authentication and data architecture principles to establish explicit security boundaries . current LLMs lack native fence awareness, we demonstrate that simulated awareness through prompt instructions achieved complete prevention of injection attacks in our experiments . the approach is platform-agnostic and can be incrementally deployed as a security layer above existing LLM infrastructure .
label: ai

text: adaptive multi-agent learning framework integrates static versus adaptive agents and fixed versus adaptable system parameters . framework offers domain-neutral architecture for analyzing how learning agents and adaptive controls jointly shape system trajectories, enabling systematic comparison of stability, performance, and interpretability across non-equilibrium, oscillatory, or drifting dynamics .
label: ai

text: we propose a new class of geographical partitioning problems in which the population is heterogeneous . the optimal solution is a novel generalization of the additively weighted Voronoi diagram . we propose an efficient algorithm to compute it, thus resolving an open question dating back to Dvoretzky et al. (1951). the efficacy and potential for practical insight of the approach are demonstrated in a realistic case study involving seven demographic groups and $78$ district offices.
label: ai

text: study evaluates the faithfulness of LLM-generated explanations in the context of emotion classification in low-resource languages . results show that while LLMs achieve strong classification performance, their generated explanations often diverge from faithful reasoning, showing greater agreement with each other than with human judgments . findings highlight the limitations of current explanation methods and metrics, emphasizing the need for more robust approaches to ensure LLM reliability .
label: ai

text: a branch-based structural reparameterization technique works during training phase . the framework reduces the original 12-layer architecture to 6, 4 or as few as 3 layers while maintaining classification accuracy on ImageNet-1K . resulting compressed models achieve inference speedups of up to 37% on mobile CPU platforms . our findings suggest that conventional wisdom favoring extremely deep transformer stacks may be unnecessarily restrictive, and point toward new opportunities for constructing efficient vision transformers .
label: ai

text: RECCS is one such algorithm that takes a network and its clustering as input and generates a synthetic network through a modular pipeline . each generated ground truth cluster preserves key characteristics of the corresponding input cluster, including connectivity, minimum degree, and degree sequence distribution . the output consists of synthetically generated network, and disjoint ground truth labels for all nodes .
label: ai

text: we analyze preconditioned SGD in the geometry induced by a symmetric positive definite matrix $mathbfM$ . we establish a preconditioner-dependent basin-stability guarantee . the probability that the iterates remain in a well-behaved local region admits an explicit lower bound . this perspective is particularly relevant in Scientific Machine Learning (SciML)
label: ai

text: we first design a linearized method of multipliers for the consensus optimization problem . without smoothness or strong convexity, we establish non-ergodic sublinear rates of order O(1/sqrtk) for both the objective optimality and the consensus violation . we then show that the economic dispatch problem admits a dual consensus formulation .
label: ai

text: MPC-based ML allows multiple parties to collaboratively run an ML workload without sharing their private data or model parameters using multi-party computing . popular approximations are often insufficiently accurate or unnecessarily slow, and these issues are hard to identify and fix in existing frameworks . to tackle this issue, we propose a compiler for ML, CrypTorch .

text: a whole-body model predictive control (MPC) framework is implemented using open software frameworks (Pinocchio and CasADi), along with the state-of-the-art interior-point solver Fatrop . in real-world experiments on a Unitree B2 quadruped equipped with a unitree Z1 manipulator arm, our MPC formulation achieves real-time performance at 80 Hz .

text: selective disk bispectrum is a fast, rotation-invariant representation for image shape analysis . this representation must be computationally efficient for large datasets and invertible . to this end, we present a selective disk bifispectrum: a rapid, rotation . invariance on images has been hindered by the absence of an inverse and its cubic complexity .
label: ai

text: post-training quantization is an effective method for reducing the serving cost of large language models . the standard approach is to use a round-to-nearest quantization level scheme . however, this often introduces large errors due to outliers in the weights . reliance on calibration data can be severely limiting in some real-world scenarios .
label: ai

text: open-vocabulary semantic segmentation (OVSS) underpins many vision and robotics tasks that require generalizable semantic understanding . existing approaches either rely on limited segmentation training data, which hinders generalization, or apply zero-shot heuristics to vision-language models . RADSeg-base (105M) outperforms previous combinations of huge vision models (850-1350M) in mIoU .

text: we study neurovarieties for polynomial neural networks and fully characterize when they attain the expected dimension in the single-output case . we establish non-defectiveness and global identifiability for multi-put architectures .  Less than a quarter of a century ago, we were able to find a way to solve the problem .

text: the "Internet of Agents" represents the communication stack that enables agents to scale by distributing computation across collaborating entities . current network architectural stacks were designed for data delivery between hosts and processes, not for agent collaboration with semantic understanding . l8 formalizes the textitmeaning of communication, enabling agents to discover, negotiate, and lock a "Shared Context"

text: foundation models capable of in-context learning (ICL) offer a powerful solution, adapting to new tasks with minimal examples and reducing the need for extensive retraining . prior work on large-scale time series models has predominantly focused on forecasting, leaving a critical gap for versatile, fine-tuning-free classification . to address this, we introduce TiCT (Time-series in-Context Transformer), a transformer-based model pre-trained exclusively on synthetic data .
label: ai

text: TREASURE is a multipurpose transformer-based foundation model specifically designed for transaction data . it captures both consumer behavior and payment network signals . the model also captures response codes and system flags . treasURE features three key capabilities: an input module with dedicated sub-modules for static and dynamic attributes, enabling more efficient training and inference .
label: ai

text: multi-agent gatekeeper provides provable safety guarantees for leader-follower formation control in cluttered 3D environments . online planners and controllers lack formal safety guarantees, while offline planners lack adaptability to changes in the number of agents or desired formation . we propose a hybrid architecture where a single leader tracks a pre-computed, safe trajectory, which serves as a shared trajectory backup set for all follower agents .

text: in an online fashion, workloads arrive on some of the $n$ processors . conflicts are represented by a graph, where vertices correspond to processors and edges indicate conflicting pairs . an online algorithm must decide which processors are run at a time; so provide a valid schedule respecting the conflict constraints . the objective is to minimize the maximum workload observed across all processors during the schedule .
label: ai

text: the program trains undergraduates through structured peer mentorship and real client projects . students tackle data problems of increasing complexity-from basic data analysis to software development-while learning FAIR data principles and open science practices . the model's core components (peer mentorship structure, project-based learning, and communication training) make it adaptable to other institutions . text: a novel method for interpretable cell counting via density map estimation . the learned prototypes were evaluated through a survey of biologists . our method provides a clear understanding of how the model identifies and counts cells . this work provides researchers and clinicians with a transparent and reliable tool for cell counting, potentially increasing trust and accelerating the adoption of deep learning in critical biomedical applications.

text: the dataset contains 3,460 egocentric recordings (approximately 197 hours), along with 1,092 exocentric recordings . a key focus of the dataset is collaborative work, where two workers jointly perform cognitively and physically intensive tasks . we provide detailed annotations (actions, summaries, mistake annotations, narrations), and benchmarks on procedural and non-procedural task understanding .

text: existing layer pruning methods lead to significant performance drop when applied to VLMs . instead, we analyze triplets of consecutive layers to identify local redundancy . by finetuning only a subset of layers on just 1% of the FineVision dataset for one epoch, Interlace achieves 88.9% average performance retention after dropping 25% of the network, achieving SOTA performance .

text: the method is derived from a continuous-time dynamical system whose vector field is obtained by solving a convex QCQP that enforces monotonic descent of the objective and forward invariance of the feasible set . we then propose a safeguarded Euler discretization with adaptive step-size selection that preserve this convergence rate while maintaining both descent and feasibility in discrete time .

text: we propose a modular framework for generating synthetic data tailored to financial fact-checking . miniCheck-FISCAL outperforms its baseline, surpasses GPT-3.5 Turbo and other open-source peers of similar size . it approaches the accuracy of much larger systems (20x), such as Mixtral-8x22B and Command R+ . the dataset and scripts are available in the project repository (link provided in the paper).

text: cyber-Physical Systems have played an essential role in our daily lives . it is crucial for system control where reliability is critical . but it is also commonly susceptible to vulnerabilities, particularly buffer overflows . traditional vulnerability discovery techniques struggle with scalability and precision when applied directly to the binary code of C programs . the approach constructs a Memory State Space -- MemStaCe -- from the binary program's control flow graph .

text: the work proposes HeaRT, a foundational reasoning engine for automation loops and a first step toward intelligent, adaptive, human-style design optimization . heaRT consistently demonstrates reasoning accuracy >97% and Pass@1 performance >98% across our 40-circuit benchmark repository, even as circuit complexity increases, while operating at 0.5x real-time token budget of SOTA baselines .

text: oncoVision is a multimodal AI pipeline that combines mammography images and clinical data for better breast cancer diagnosis . it combines an attention-based encoder-decoder backbone to segment four ROIs with state-of-the-art accuracy and robustly predicts ten structured clinical features . late fusion strategies improve diagnostic precision and reduce inter-observer variability by using complementary multimodal data .

text: the method is based on constructing a cascade of time-dependent variational lower bounds on the data log-likelihood . it provably improves upon the standard evidence lower bound and results in reduced data-model KL-divergences . results also provide a theoretical justification for the simple weighting scheme widely used in masked image models .

text: faraGen is a novel synthetic data generation system for multi-step web tasks . it can propose diverse tasks from frequently used websites, generate multiple solution attempts, and filter successful trajectories using multiple verifiers . we find that Fara-7B outperforms other CUA models of comparable size on benchmarks like WebVoyager, Online-Mind2Web, and WebTailBench .

text: visual agents achieve high final-answer accuracy but exhibit low rates of faithful tool-use on visual search benchmarks . codeV is a code-based visual agent trained with tool-aware policy optimization (TAPO) codeV achieves competitive or superior accuracy while substantially increasing faithful tool use rates on related visual searches benchmarks, suggesting explicit supervising intermediate tool behavior is crucial for building trustworthy, agentic visual reasoning systems .

text: a forecast-blur-denoise framework improves temporal fidelity through structured noise modeling . the approach incorporates a learnable Gaussian Process module that generates smooth, correlated perturbations . a dedicated refinement model restores high-resolution temporal detail . experiments across electricity, traffic, and solar datasets show consistent gains in multi-horizon accuracy and stability .

text: upper bound guarantees for bilevel optimization have been widely studied, but progress on lower bounds has been limited due to the complexity of the bilevel structure . in the stochastic case, we show that at least $(5/2-4)$ oracle calls are necessary, again strengthening the best known bounds in related settings . the results expose substantial gaps between current upper and lower bound . and suggest even simplified regimes, such as those with quadratic lower-level objectives .

text: most of the standard vehicles follow the Ackermann style steering mechanism . this has become to de facto standard for large and long faring vehicles . the local planner of an autonomous vehicle controls the low-level vehicle movement upon which the vehicle will perform its motor actuation . a novel method that combines lane identification with Model Predictive Control (MPC) is presented .

text: low-Rank Adaptation (LoRA) fine-tuned Large Language Models (LLMs) can approximate the performance . results indicate that full fine-touning achieves the highest overall scores, with BLEU and ROUGE improvements of up to 10% over LoRA variants . but mid-range LoRA models deliver competitive performance exceeding full fine tuning on two metrics while reducing model size by approximately 81% .

text: we use unlabeled homogenous quadcopters (UAVs) to demonstrate the use of a flow network to create complete (inter-UAV) collision-free paths . this procedure has three main parts: 1) Creating a graph from physical GPS coordinates, 2) Finding a path of minimum cost (least distance) and 3) Implementing the Ford-Fulkerson Method to find the paths with the maximum flow (no collision)

text: general-purpose large multimodal models (LMMs) have shown poor or inconclusive performance in medical image interpretation . but prior studies have used either low-resolution thumbnails or random patches, which likely underestimated model performance . in this study, we introduce Gigapixel Image Agent for Navigating Tissue (GIANT), the first framework that allows LMMs to iteratively navigate whole-slide images like a pathologist .

text: control barrier functions (CBFs) are an effective model-based tool to formally certify the safety of a system . this is owing to their provable guarantees . but success in transferring these guarantees to real-world systems is critically tied to model accuracy . in this work, we propose an efficient yet flexible online learning-enhanced high-order adaptive control barrier function using Neural ODEs .

text: Embedding-Guided Neural Search eliminates LLM calls entirely by fusing text and graph embeddings through a lightweight 6.7M-parameter edge scorer, achieving over 100 times speedup with competitive accuracy . results show grounded reasoning consistently outperforms ungrounded generation, with structured planning proving more transferable than direct answer generation .

text: Rashomon Concept Bottleneck Models learns multiple neural networks which are all accurate yet reason through distinct human-understandable concepts . the resulting networks provide fundamentally different reasoning processes for the same predictions, revealing how concept reliance and decision making vary across equally performing solutions . our framework enables systematic exploration of data-driven reasoning diversity in deep models, offering a new mechanism for auditing, comparison, and alignment across equally accurate solutions.

text: neural models have shown promise in solving NP-hard graph combinatorial optimization problems . they offer fast inference and reasonably high-quality solutions for in-distribution testing instances . but they generally fall short in terms of absolute solution quality compared to classical search-based algorithms that are admittedly slower but offer optimality guarantee once search finishes . we propose a novel framework that combines the inference efficiency and exploratory power of neural models with the solution quality guarantee .

text: stochastic geometry offers a rigorous framework by treating base station locations as a Poisson point process . but its expressions often involve nested integrals and special functions that limit general applicability . this work introduce a hybrid approximation framework that addresses these challenges by combining Monte Carlo sampling of a small set of dominant interferers with a Laplace functional representation of the residual far-field interference .

text: modifying such models for tasks such as pruning or unlearning constrained by this unavailability . existing techniques typically require gradients or ground-truth labels, rendering them infeasible in settings with limited computational resources . we theoretically demonstrate that the global reconstruction error is linearly bounded by local reconstruction errors for Lipschitz-continuous networks such as CNNs and well-trained Transformers . modHiFi-U achieves complete unlearning on CIFAR-10 without fine-tuning

text: one-shot information theory addresses scenarios in source coding and channel coding where the signal blocklength is assumed to be 1 . each source and channel can be used only once, and the sources and channels are arbitrary and not required to be memoryless or ergodic . the aim of this thesis is to extend the applicability of Poisson functional representation to various more complicated scenarios .

text: this paper proposes a novel semiotic framework for analyzing Large Language Models . we formalize the trade-off between expressive richness (semiotic breadth) and interpretive stability (decipherability) using information-theoretic tools . breadth is quantified as source entropy, and decipherable as the mutual information between messages and human interpretation .

text: Object handover is a common form of interaction that is widely present in collaborative tasks . but achieving it efficiently remains a challenge . we propose the use of virtual model control to create an interaction layer that controls the robot and adapts to the dynamic changes in the handover process . augmented reality to facilitate bidirectional communication between humans and robots during handovers .

label: ai

text: mapRF is a weakly supervised framework that learns to construct 3D maps using only 2D image labels . to generate high-quality pseudo labels, we introduce a novel Neural Radiance Fields module conditioned on map predictions, which reconstructs view-consistent 3D geometry and semantics . this module is then iteratively used to refine the map network in a self-training manner, enabling progressive improvement without additional supervision .

text: perceptual taxonomy is a structured process of scene understanding that first recognizes objects and their spatial configurations . then infers task-relevant properties such as material, affordance, function, and physical attributes to support goal-directed reasoning . current vision-language benchmarks lack comprehensive evaluation of this ability and instead focus on surface-level recognition or image-text alignment .

text: multi-agent frameworks are driving progress in video understanding . but most of them adopt static and non-learnable tool invocation mechanisms . they limit the discovery of clues essential for robust perception and reasoning regarding temporally or spatially complex videos . videoChat-M1 adopts a distinct Collaborative policy planning paradigm with multiple policy agents, which comprises three key processes .

text: large language models (LLMs) are highly effective for cybersecurity question answering (QA) but are difficult to deploy on edge devices due to their size . text: semantic typing has become a powerful tool for program verification . text: Visual grounding plays a pivotal role in vision-language integration . existing methods typically rely on extensive task-specific annotations . groundingAgent employs a structured, iterative reasoning mechanism . a novel agentic visual grounding framework operates without any task . specific fine-tuning, limiting their ability to generalize effectively to novel or out-of-distribution scenarios .

text: large language models (LLMs) require substantial computational resources, making model compression essential for efficient deployment in constrained environments . knowledge distillation, structured pruning, and low-bit quantization are well studied, but their interactions and optimal sequencing remain unclear . quantization provides the greatest standalone compression, while pruning introduces moderate quality degradation . the order of techniques significantly affects the final model quality, achieving a 3.68x compression ratio while preserving strong instruction-following and language understanding capabilities .

text: meTR's time horizon metric has grown exponentially since 2019, along with compute . but it is unclear whether compute scaling will persist at current rates through 2030, raising the question of how possible compute slowdowns might impact AI agent capability forecasts . we provide additional, albeit limited, experimental evidence consistent with this theory, finding substantial projected delays in some cases . for example, 1-monthtime horizons at $80%$ reliability occur $7$ years later than simple trend extrapolation suggests .

text: proposed model offers novel learning classes in an open and continuous learning environment . it consists of two different but connected tasks . first, it discovers unknown classes in the data and creates novel classes . next, it learns how to perform class incrementally for each new class . the proposed model also outperformed existing approaches in open-world learning . also demonstrated strong performance in continuous learning, achieving highest average accuracy of 82.54% over four iterations and a minimum accuracy of 65.87% .

text: OmniTFT is a deep learning framework that learns and forecasts high-frequency vital signs and sparsely sampled laboratory results based on the Temporal Fusion Transformer (TFT) it implements four novel strategies to enhance performance: sliding window equalized sampling to balance physiological states, frequency-aware embedding shrinkage to stabilize rare-class representations, and influence-aligned attention calibration to enhance robustness during abrupt physiological changes .

text: stable-pretraining is a modular, extensible, and performance-optimized library built on top of PyTorch, Lightning, Hugging Face, and TorchMetrics . a central design principle is logging everything, enabling fine-grained visibility into training dynamics that makes debugging, monitoring, and reproducibility seamless . we validate the library by demonstrating its ability to generate new research insights with minimal overhead .

text: models can break through knowledge and timeliness limitations by invoking external tools within the Model Context Protocol framework to achieve automated execution of complex tasks . existing approaches generally rely on full-prompt injection or static semantic retrieval, facing issues including semantic disconnection between user queries and tool descriptions, context inflation in LLM input, and high inference latency . to address these challenges, this paper proposes Z-Space, a multi-agent collaborative tool invocation framework .

text: four STEAM specialists assessed Generative AI-generated lesson plans . compared them to standardized lesson plans from the Ghana National Council for Curriculum and Assessment (NaCCA) experts rated GenAI-assisted lessons as more culturally grounded and pedagogically responsive than NaCCA plans, integrating Indigenous knowledge, bilingual elements, and locally relevant examples . results highlight the need for continued teacher mediation, community involvement, and culturally attuned refinement of AI outputs .

text: retrieval enhanced generation technology has been widely used due to its ability to integrate external knowledge to improve output accuracy . but the performance of the system is highly dependent on the quality of the retrieval module . if retrieval results have low relevance to user needs or contain noisy information, it will directly lead to distortion of the generated content . this paper proposes an XGBoost machine learning regression model based on feature engineering and particle swarm optimization.

text: systematically study the prunability of MoE-LLMs under task-specific usage . we first develop an expert attribution framework that identifies the subset of experts most responsible for a given task . findings reveal a critical knowledge loss--recovery trade-off . some experts can be isolated to retain task accuracy, but significant degradation occurs without targeted re-alignment .

text: the combination of high-performance computing (HPC) and cloud infrastructure offers vast computing power but introduces new complexities . in this work, we present a federated learning framework built to run efficiently across mixed HPC and cloud environments . our system addresses key challenges such as system heterogeneity, communication overhead, and resource scheduling, while maintaining model accuracy and data privacy .

text: pathological examination is the gold standard, but the invasive biopsy has notable limitations: the highly vascular pediatric liver and fragile tumor tissue raise complication risks . young children with poor compliance require anesthesia for biopsy, increasing medical costs or psychological trauma . to establish a non-invasive examination procedure, we developed a multi-stage deep learning (DL) framework for automated pediatric liver tumor diagnosis using multi-phase contrast-enhanced CT .

text: analysis of real-world incidents reveals prompt injection attacks make general-purpose autonomous operation fundamentally unsafe . argues against developing general browsing intelligence in favor of specialized tools with programmatic constraints, where safety boundaries are enforced through code instead of large language model (LLM) reasoning . the agent achieved approximately 85% success rate across 53 diverse challenges compared to approximately 50% reported for prior browser agents .

text: this research introduces a novel uncertainty-aware deep learning framework . the framework learns aleatoric uncertainty directly through probabilistic modeling . this is an approach unexplored in existing CMAPSS literature . a new framework enables the model to learn data-inherent uncertainty . it provides well-calibrated 95 percent confidence intervals with coverage ranging from 93.5 percent to 95.2 percent .

text: simple chat is an open-source, research-focused chat interface that streamlines LLM integration for platforms such as Qualtrics, oTree, and LimeSurvey . integrating LLMs into established survey platforms remains technically demanding, particularly when aiming for ecologically valid, real-time conversational experiences with strong experimental control . simple Chat connects to both commercial providers and open-weights models, supports streaming responses to preserve conversational flow .

text: aspect category sentiment analysis (ACSA) has achieved remarkable progress with large language models . existing approaches primarily emphasize sentiment polarity while overlooking the underlying emotional dimensions that shape sentiment expressions . this limitation hinders the model's ability to capture fine-grained affective signals toward specific aspect categories . we introduce an emotion refinement mechanism based on the Valence-Arousal-Dominance (VAD) dimensional framework .

text: the structure of naming systems in natural languages hinges on a trade-off between high informativeness and low complexity . prior work capitalizes on information theory to formalize these notions . however, these studies generally rely on two simplifications: (i) optimal listeners, and (ii) universal communicative need across languages . here, we use it to prove that an optimal exchange-off is achievable if and only if the listener's decoder is equivalent to the Bayesian decode
label: ai

text: existing research primarily focuses on indoor environments and typically relies on multi-view observations . text: our model is based on algorithms that we have previously used to analyze sentences in Nawatl, and on the corpus called $$-yalli . our automatic unification algorithm implements linguistic rules in symbolic regular expressions . we present a manual evaluation protocol to assess the quality of the unified sentences generated by our algorithm, by testing in a sentence semantic task .

text: thermal super-resolution (SR) methods can be grouped into single-image and RGB-guided approaches . the latter relies on accurate and laborious cross-camera calibration . 3M-TI integrates a cross-modal self-attention module into the diffusion UNet . it enables the diffusion network to leverage its generative prior to enhance spatial resolution, structural fidelity, and texture detail .
