text: the existential risk denotes the hypothetical threat posed by an artificial system that would possess both the capability and the objective, either directly or indirectly, to eradicate humanity . this issue is gaining prominence in scientific debate due to recent technical advancements and increased media coverage . in parallel, AI progress has sparked speculation and studies about the potential emergence of artificial consciousness .

text: fast and accurate solvers become increasingly critical in magnetic confinement nuclear fusion . text: rapid advances in large language models and agentic AI are driving the emergence of the Internet of Agents (IoA) a key prerequisite for such large-scale collaboration is agent capability discovery, where agents identify, advertise, and match one another's capabilities under dynamic tasks . this paper introduces a novel two-stage capability discovery framework . the first stage, autonomous capability announcement, allows agents to credibly publish machine-interpretable descriptions of their abilities .

text: existing AIGC detection benchmarks focus on classifying entire images, overlooking the localization of diffusion-based edits . text: HABIT integrates real-world human motion, sourced from mocap and videos, into CARLA (Car Learning to Act, a full autonomous driving simulator) from an initial pool of approximately 30,000 retargeted motions, we curate 4,730 traffic-compatible pedestrian motions . our safety metrics, including Abbreviated Injury Scale (AIS) and False Positive Braking Rate (FPBR), reveal critical failure modes in state-of-the-art AD agents missed by prior evaluations

text: we study core stability in non-centroid clustering under the max-loss objective . each agent's loss is the maximum distance to other members of their cluster . no clustering lies in the $$-core for any $2frac15sim 1.148$ . we also identify a two-dimensional Euclidean point set whose associated lower bound is slightly smaller than the general construction .

text: GraphPose-Fi is a graph-based framework that explicitly models skeletal topology for WiFi-based 3D HPE . the framework includes a CNN encoder shared across antennas for subcarrier-time feature extraction, a lightweight attention module that adaptively reweights features over time . our proposed method significantly outperforms existing methods on MM-Fi in various settings .

text: the rapid growth of IoT devices has led to an enormous amount of sensor data that requires transmission to cloud servers for processing . this is particularly problematic in resource-constrained and remote environments where bandwidth is limited, and battery-dependent devices further emphasize the problem . the proposed solution uses a predictive filter at the network edge that forecasts the next sensor data point and triggers data transmission only when the deviation from the predicted value exceeds a predefined tolerance .

text: deterministic register automata (DRAs) extend finite automata with registers that store and compare numeric values . our main contribution is a framework for robust DRA extraction from black-box models . we develop a polynomial-time robustness checker for DRAs with a fixed number of registers, and combine it with passive and active automata learning algorithms .
label: ai

text: existing reinforcement learning methods for chain-of-Thought reasoning suffer from two critical limitations . first, they operate as monolithic black boxes that provide undifferentiated reward signals, obscuring individual step contributions and hindering error diagnosis . second, sequential decoding has O(n) time complexity . this makes real-time deployment impractical for complex reasoning tasks .

text: human-robot-safety framework aims at a dynamical adaptation of robot velocities depending on the separation distance between human and robot while respecting maximum biomechanical force and pressure limits . the framework was investigated for four different deep learning approaches that can be used for human body extraction: human body recognition, human body segmentation, human pose estimation, and human body part segmentation .

text: collective vigilance describes how animals in groups benefit from predator detection efforts of others . many-eyes strategy with all (or many) group members maintain a low level of individual vigils . sentinel strategy with one (or a few) individual maintaining a high level . a similar dichotomy emerges whether individuals act selfishly to optimise their own fitness .

text: the advent of financial technology has witnessed a surge in the utilization of deep learning models to anticipate consumer conduct . we present a hybrid sequence model that combines multi-scale temporal convolutions, a gated recurrent module, and time-aware self-attention . the model is trained with standard regression losses and evaluated under MAE, RMSE, sMAPE, MASE .

text: inversion vectors (also called Lehmer codes) are an alternative representation of the permutation space $S_n$ compared to the classical encoding as a vector of $n$ unique entries . using rigorous mathematical runtime analyses, we compare the efficiency of inversion- vectors to the classic representation and give theory-guided advice on their choice . we link the effect of local changes in the inversion code space to classical measures on permutations .
label: ai

text: kinetic path energy (KPE) quantifies the total kinetic effort along each generation path of ODE-based samplers . results suggest trajectory-level analysis offers a physics-inspired and interpretable framework for understanding generation difficulty and sample characteristics . i higher KPE predicts stronger semantic quality, indicating that semantically richer samples require greater kinetic efforts, and (ii) lower KPE correlates with data density .

text: connected clustering denotes a family of constrained clustering problems . the aim is to partition the $n$ vertices into a given number $k$ of clusters such that every cluster forms a connected subgraph of $G$ . this means the constraint that the clusters are connected has applications in many different fields, like community detection and geodesy .

text: existing ICL-based NER methods suffer from three key limitations: reliance on dynamic retrieval of annotated examples . text: the widespread application of AIGC contents has brought not only unprecedented opportunities, but also potential security concerns, e.g., audio-visual deepfakes . in this paper, we reformulate the correlation learning with variational Bayesian estimation . we use various difference convolutions and a high-pass filter to discern local and global forgery traces from both modalities .

text: large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive capabilities in natural language understanding and generation . existing approaches often lack an explicit and dynamic mechanism to structurally represent and evolve intermediate reasoning states . our method models the reasoning process as a heterogeneous evolving graph, where nodes represent conditions, theorems, and conclusions, while edges capture logical dependencies between nodes .

text: unbalanced optimal transport provides a flexible way to match or compare nonnegative finite Radon measures . however, UOT requires a predefined ground transport cost, which may misrepresent the data's underlying geometry . to address this challenge, we introduce cost-regularized . text: zero-drift first Arrival position (FAP) channel is rigorously known to be Cauchy-distributed, but practical molecular communication systems typically operate with non-zero drift . the channel effectively behaves as a 'Truncated Cauchy'' model . numerical results show that Gaussian approximations severely underestimate capacity at low drift, while the zerodrift case provides the appropriate performance lower bound for systems where drift assists particle transport .

text: the Segment Anything Model (SAM) has demonstrated significant potential in medical image segmentation . however, the pseudo 3D processing used to adapt SAM results in spatial feature loss, limiting its performance . we propose a Feature Enhanced Decoder that fuses the original image features with rich and detailed spatial information to enhance spatial features . a dual Attention Prompter automatically obtain prompt information through Spatial Attention and Channel Attention .

text: the simplest representation of a pangenome is a set of individual genome sequences . this has the advantage that efficient exact search via indexes based on the Burrows-Wheeler Transform (BWT) is possible . such an index may report a match in thousands of positions even if these all correspond to the same locus, making downstream analysis unnecessarily expensive .

text: DynaMix combines manually labeled multi-camera and large-scale pseudo-labeled single . compared to previous works, it dynamically adapts to the structure and noise of the training data through three core components: a Relabeling Module that refines pseudo-labels of single-camer identities on-the-fly; a Efficient Centroids Module that maintain robust identity representations under a large identity space .

text: clients perform local training on different model versions, causing information staleness (delay) in federated environments with non-IID local data distributions, this asynchronous pattern amplifies the adverse effect of client heterogeneity . text: MeanFlow combines instantaneous and average velocity fields . but the underlying training dynamics remain unclear . the method reaches an impressive FID of 2.87 on 1-NFE ImageNet 256x256, compared to 3.43 for the conventional MeanFlow baseline with 2.5x shorter training time, or with a smaller DiT-L backbone . if you have a generative model, you'll be able to create a new model .

text: "effect of Contradictory Structure" can be overlapped with each other . a broader "Structure" is set up . "montage" is a proxy or window for emotional states . the process is demonstrated using the example of proceeding to the next level of education, we propose a alternative form that complements natural language, acting as a window for emotions .

text: Prompt-free image segmentation aims to generate accurate masks without manual guidance . this approach has two limitations: 1) Localizability, lacking mechanisms for autonomous region localization; 2) Scalability, limited fine-grained modeling at high resolution . the fine stage adaptively extracts high-response regions from features to achieve precise foreground localization and reduce reliance on external prompts .

text: application users and regulators increasingly ask critical questions such as: does the application incorporate AI capabilities? existing approaches mainly rely on manual inspection and rule-based heuristics . text: LAA3D contains 15,000 real images and 600,000 synthetic frames . it covers multiple aerial objects categories, including electric vertical take-off and landing aircraft . each instance is annotated with 3D bounding box, class label, and instance identity . we propose MonoLAA, a monocular 3D detection baseline, achieving robust 3D localization from zoom cameras with different focal lengths .

text: the potential benefits of EV charging assignment remain under-explored in infrastructure planning . this paper proposes an integrated approach that jointly optimizes investment decisions and charging assignments while accounting for spatial-temporal demand dynamics and their interdependencies . we propose a distributed optimization algorithm based on the Alternating Direction Method of Multipliers (ADMM) to address computational complexity in high-dimensional scenarios .

text: Direct Preference Optimization (PG-DPO) has shown promising results in aligning generative outputs with human preferences by distinguishing between chosen and rejected samples . however, a critical limitation of DPO is likelihood displacement, where the probabilities of chosen samples paradoxically decrease during training . this gap leads to suboptimal performance in tasks involving video generation . a novel solution called Policy-Guided DPO (PG - DPO) combines Adaptive Rejection Scaling (ARS) and Implicit Preference
label: ai

text: embodied agents remain suboptimal in exploring new environments . they rely on profound but stale pre-trained knowledge, training-based approaches such as imitation learning are expensive for long-horizon tasks with sparse outcome rewards . frontier-based exploration yields a large, visually nuanced action space that is difficult for MLLMs to make reliable decisions .

text: existing evaluation paradigms exhibit two major limitations: 1) dominance of low-discriminative samples in current datasets masks the real robustness gap between models; and 2) conventional accuracy-based metric fail to capture the degradation of the underlying prediction structure . we propose the Robustness Alignment Score (RAS), a unified metric that measures degradation in logit-level prediction structure by considering shifts in prediction uncertainty and calibration alignment .

text: MASt3R-SLAM aims to estimate a robot's pose while simultaneously reconstructing an unknown 3D scene using a single camera . existing monocular SLAM systems generate detailed 3D geometry through dense scene representations, but they are computationally expensive due to the need for iterative optimization . mst3r-SLam is limited to single-agent operation .

text: Opportunistic Networks (OppNets) employ the Store-Carry-Forward paradigm to maintain communication during intermittent connectivity . however, routing performance suffers due to dynamic topology changes, unpredictable contact patterns, and resource constraints . these challenges compromise delivery reliability, increase latency, and reduce node longevity in highly dynamic environments . text: blind image quality assessment (BIQA) plays a crucial role in evaluating and optimizing visual experience . most existing BIQA approaches fuse shallow and deep features extracted from backbone networks, while overlooking the unequal contributions to quality prediction . a moE-based feature decoupling module is proposed to decouple fused representations though different experts specialized for specific distortion types or quality dimensions .

text: existing approaches predominantly rely on external human-annotated preference data . text: vision Transformers (ViTs) have demonstrated strong capabilities in capturing global dependencies but often struggle to represent fine-grained local details . existing multi-scale approaches alleviate this issue by integrating hierarchical or hybrid features; however, they rely on fixed patch sizes and introduce redundant computation . a dynamic coarse-to-fine framework that adaptively adjusts visual granularity based on image complexity .

text: orthogonal Frequency-Division Multiplexing (OFDM) is widely used in modern wireless communication systems due to its robustness against time-dispersive channels . the proposed method is more general than existing approaches in the literature, as it can detect an arbitrary number of subcarriers with high probability even at low SNR . in this work, we consider a non-cooperative scenario where the receiver does not have prior knowledge of the OFDM parameters .

text: low-altitude wireless networks are rapidly expanding due to the deployment of unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) for logistics, surveillance, and emergency response . the transmit power of base stations fluctuates dynamically according to user locations and traffic demands, leading to a highly non-stationary 3D radio environment . but most existing works construct static or offline RMs, overlooking real-time power variations and spatio-temporal dependencies in multi-UAV networks .

text: algorithm generates $k$-edge connected graphs for arbitrarily large values of $k geq 2$ . the proposed algorithm is within a factor strictly less than $2$ of the optimal value (i.e., the number of edges in the generated graph) the algorithm is based on a random variable $S_k$, which is a union of edges of the joined trees .

text: per-record Differential Privacy (DP) addresses this by defining the privacy budget as a function of each record, offering better alignment with real-world needs . existing solutions either handle specific privacy functions or adopt relaxed PrDP definitions . a simple workaround is to use the global minimum of the privacy function, but this severely degrades utility . we introduce a core technique called privacy-specified domain partitioning, which ensures accurate estimation without compromising privacy .

text: vehicle platooning is a promising solution to address these issues by improving road capacity and reducing fuel consumption . existing systems face challenges such as reliance on lane markings and expensive high-precision sensors . this is achieved through our new end-to-end method, which improves overall driving performance . a complete real-world vehicle experiment is available at https://youtu.be/zL1bcVb9kqQ .

text: large language models demonstrate powerful capabilities across various natural language processing tasks . however, improvements in model safety often come at the cost of severe over-refusal, failing to strike a good balance between safety and usability . in this paper, we propose MOSR, which measures the erasure weight for malicious samples by quantifying their similarity to pseudo-malicious samples in the representation space .

text: top-k diversified methods focus on maximizing vertex coverage . but often return results in the same region, limiting topological diversity . to address its computational challenges, we introduce the Partition-based Distance Diversity framework, which partitions the graph and retrieves diverse matches from distant regions . we develop two optimizations: embedding-driven partition filtering and densest-based partition selection over a Partition Adjacency Graph .

text: the current KM3NeT/ORCA neutrino telescope is still under construction . no explicit information about the physics or the detector is provided . this study leverages the strengths of transformers by incorporating attention masks inspired by physics and detector design, making the model understand both the telescope design and the neutrinos measured on it . the study also shows the efficacy on retaining valuable information between detectors when doing fine-tuning from one configuration to another .

text: the rapid proliferation of short videos presents unique challenges and opportunities for recommendation systems . existing uplift models face limitations in handling heterogeneous multi-treatment scenarios of short-video recommendations . text: the mixture model is one of the greatest contributions to clustering . for continuous data, Gaussian models are often used . the Expectation-Maximization algorithm is particularly suitable for estimating parameters from which clustering is inferred . however, the Classification EM (CEM) algorithm offers a fast convergence solution while dimensionality reduction still remains a challenge .

text: new advances in deep learning have enabled significant progress in plant disease classification using leaf images . the plantVillage dataset consists of well-centered plant images captured against uniform, uncluttered backgrounds . models trained on this dataset achieve high accuracy but often fail to generalize to real-world field images, such as those submitted by farmers to plant diagnostic systems . this has created a significant gap between published studies and practical application requirements, highlighting the necessity of investigating and addressing this issue .

text: the challenge of building neural networks is central to the fields of continual learning (CL) and reinforcement learning (RL) this lifelong learning problem is often framed in terms of the plasticity-stability dilemma, focusing on issues like loss of plasticity and catastrophic forgetting . previous solutions often lack parameter efficiency or depend on explicit task indices, but Mixture-of-Experts offers a promising alternative by specializing experts for distinct distributions .

label: ai

text: the task of translating natural language questions into query languages has long been a central focus in semantic parsing . existing studies typically focus on a single query language . we identify query skeletons as a shared optimization target of Text-to-Query tasks, and propose a general dynamic data augmentation framework that explicitly diagnose model-specific weaknesses in handling them to synthesize targeted training data . our method achieves state-of-the-art performance using only a small amount of synthesized data, highlighting the
label: ai

text: a Prompt-Level Defense Framework detects and neutralizes adversarial inputs through sanitization, paraphrasing, and adaptive system guarding . a Domain-Specific Agent Defense employs the MetaGPT framework to enforce structured, role-based collaboration and domain adherence . experiments on benchmark datasets show substantial reductions in attack success rate, achieving full mitigation under the agent-based defense .
label: ai

text: static split of 783 temporally anchored questions answerable from pre-cutoff knowledge . dynamic split of 288 post-cut off queries designed to test whether models recognise when search is required . both models frequently invoke search but remain below 70 percent accuracy due to weak query formulation . internal web search works better as a good low-latency verification layer than a reliable analytical tool .
label: ai

text: MCNO makes no spectral or translation-invariance assumptions . the kernel is represented as a learnable tensor over a fixed set of randomly sampled points . this design enables generalization across multiple grid resolutions without relying on fixed global basis functions or repeated sampling during training . it achieves competitive accuracy with low computational cost .
label: ai

text: a key challenge remains underexplored: how can we advance LMMs to discover tasks that directly assist humans in open-future scenarios . to facilitate this study, we propose an HOTD-Bench, which features over 2K real-world videos, a semi-automated annotation pipeline, and a simulation-based protocol for open-set future evaluation .
label: ai

text: fine-grained textual control signals describe specific body parts movements over time . fineXtrol achieves strong performance in controllable motion generation . qualitative analysis demonstrates its flexibility in directing specific body part movements . the latter often introduces misaligned details and lacks explicit temporal cues, and the latter incurs significant computational cost when converting coordinates to standard motion representations .
label: ai

text: the field lacks clear definitions and systematic evaluation standards for ECDs . we design and implement the first ECD evaluation benchmark - MoodBench 1.0 . the results reveal current models' shortcomings in deep emotional companionship, guiding future technological optimization and significantly aiding developers in enhancing users' user experience . mrs. edwards, a u.s.-based model, is a new generation of dialogue systems that provide personalized emotional support .
label: ai

text: test-time adaptation (TTA) enables models to adapt to distribution shifts at inference time . entropy minimization over output distribution has proven effective for TTA . but transformers offer an additional unsupervised learning signal through their attention mechanisms . we propose minimizing the etropy of attention distributions from the CLS token to image patches as a novel TTA objective .
label: ai

text: DRIVEBENCH, an executable corpus of kernel$rightarrow$driver co-evolution cases, and AUTODRIVER, a closed-loop, LLM-driven system for automating driver maintenance . the system integrates prompt engineering, multi-agent collaboration, static analysis, and iterative validation to ensure that generated patches are functionally and semantically consistent with kernel conventions .
label: ai

text: one4D is a unified framework for 4D generation and reconstruction . it produces dynamic 4D content as synchronized RGB frames and pointmaps . the framework adapts a powerful video generation model for joint . RGB, pointmap generation, with carefully designed network architectures, . to address this challenge, we introduce Decoupled LoRA Control (DLC), which employs two modality-specific LoRA adapters .
label: ai

text: backdoor attacks undermine reliability and trustworthiness of machine learning systems by injecting hidden behaviors that can be maliciously activated at inference time . backdoors involving the textual modality remain highly potent, with poisoning rates as low as 1% yielding over 90% success across most tasks . textbfBackdoorVLM is the first comprehensive benchmark for systematically evaluating backdoor threats across a broad range of settings .
label: ai

text: event-guided, training-free framework for efficient spatio-temporal understanding, named EventSTU . in the temporal domain, we design an adaptive token pruning algorithm that leverages the visual saliency of events as a zero-cost prior to guide spatial reduction . eventBench is the first event-inclusive, human-annotated multimodal benchmark that covers diverse real-world scenarios .
label: ai

text: group relative policy optimization (GRPO) has emerged as an effective and lightweight framework for post-training visual generative models . but its performance is fundamentally limited by the ambiguity of textual visual correspondence . a single prompt may validly describe diverse visual outputs, and a . single image or video may support multiple equally correct interpretations . this many to many relationship leads reward models to generate uncertain and weakly discriminative signals, causing GRPO to overfit noisy ones .
label: ai

text: DL compilers have been widely used to optimize DL models for efficient deployment across various hardware . existing approaches have limitations in testing optimization stages due to the difficulty in generating optimization-aware tests . the approach combines patterns extracted from documented tests for optimization and incorporates them into seed computational graphs . to solve the validity challenge for generated graphs, OATest employs auxiliary layers addition strategy to resolve broken constraints .
label: ai

text: a closed-form initialization method recovers the full visual-inertial state without nonlinear optimization . our method builds on small-rotation and constant-velocity approximations . observability-driven, two-stage initialization scheme balances accuracy with initialization latency . the method achieves 10-20% lower initialization error than optimization-based approaches, while using 4x shorter initialization windows .
label: ai

text: NVIDIA's Multi-Instance GPU (MIG) stands out by partitioning GPUs at hardware level into isolated slices with dedicated compute and memory . despite these advantages, MIG's fixed partitioning introduces scheduling rigidity, leading to severe GPU fragmentation in multi-tenant environments . we propose a novel scheduling framework for MIG-based clouds that maximizes workload acceptance while mitigating fragmentation .
label: ai

text: curriculum-based pretraining is a natural approach to leverage high-quality data . the model is trained on data sorted in ascending order of quality . prior studies have reported limited improvements from such pretraining strategies . this work identifies a critical factor constraining these methods: the incompatibility between the ascending data quality order and the decaying learning rate (LR) schedule .
label: ai

text: filtering-based methods generate rollouts broadly and retroactively filter out uninformative groups, leading to substantial computational overhead . the framework integrates three key components: online sample-level difficulty estimation using Beta distributions, a Thompson sampler that maximizes information gain through the estimated correctness probability . a two-scale prior decay mechanism that maintains robust estimation under policy evolution enables VADE to dynamically select the most informative samples .
label: ai

text: in this paper, we propose ttt, a new material reconstruction framework for 3D objects, offering the following advantages . the proposed view-material cross-attention (VMCA) enables reconstruction from an arbitrary number of input images, demonstrating strong scalability and flexibility . a single diffusion model, without relying on additional pre-trained models, shows enhanced stability across various types of objects .
label: ai

text: existing methods typically rely on global noise assumptions or confidence-based sample selection, which inadequately mitigate performance degradation caused by annotation noise . we propose MetaDCSeg, a robust framework that dynamically learns optimal pixel-wise weights to suppress the influence of noisy ground-truth labels while preserving reliable annotations . this approach uses weighted feature distances for foreground, background, and boundary centers, directing the model's attention toward hard-to-segment pixels near ambiguous boundaries
label: ai

text: LLAMBO's discriminative surrogate is weaker than GP or SMAC as a pure single task regressor, yet benefits from cross task semantic priors induced by the language model . results broadly confirm the main claims of llAMBO . llama 3.1 70B model used for all text encoding components .
label: ai

text: the work aims to identify the key determinants of SLMs' real-device latency . the latter is crucial for small-batch-size latency, while the latter affects both latency and large-batt-size throughput . we explore emerging efficient attention alternatives to evaluate their potential as candidate building operators . a new family of hybrid SLM models, called Nemotron-Flash, significantly advances the accuracy-efficiency frontier of state-of-the-arts .
label: ai

text: data contamination poses a significant challenge to the fairness of LLM evaluations in natural language processing tasks . current studies attempt to mitigate this issue by modifying existing datasets or generating new ones from freshly collected information . however, these methods fall short of ensuring contamination-resilient evaluation, as they fail to fully eliminate pre-existing knowledge from models or preserve the semantic complexity of the original datasets .
label: ai

text: remote sensing images are becoming increasingly widespread in military, earth resource exploration . because of the limitation of a single sensor, we can obtain high spatial resolution grayscale panchromatic (PAN) images and low spatial resolution color multispectral (MS) images . the existing methods improve spatial resolution using super-resolution (SR) technology and colorization technology . however, the colorization technique cannot improve the spatial resolution .
label: ai

text: existing secure aggregation techniques are either incompatible with sign-based methods or incur prohibitive overhead . a lightweight and cryptographically secure framework is proposed to address these limitations . we propose a subgrouping strategy that ensures constant multiplicative depth and bounded per-user complexity, independent of the number of users n.  Less than a quarter of a century ago, we were able to create a framework for aggregating .
label: ai

text: interactive video world model methods generate scene evolution conditioned on user instructions . first, they fail to fully exploit correspondence between instruction-driven scene motion and the underlying 3D geometry, which results in structural instability under viewpoint changes . second, they easily forget historical information during multi-step interaction, resulting in error accumulation and progressive drift in scene semantics and structure . to address these issues, we propose MagicWorld, an interactive model that integrates 3D geometric priors and historical retrieval .
label: ai

text: robust nonlinear transform coding (Robust-NTC) is a generalizable digital joint source-channel coding framework that couples variational latent modeling with channel adaptive transmission . the framework explicitly models element-wise latent distributions via a variational objective with a Gaussian proxy for quantization and channel noise . to support practical deployment, the framework is integrated into an orthogonal frequency-division multiplexing (OFDM) system .
label: ai

text: the proposed pipeline fine-tunes SegFormer-B5 on the CMP Facades dataset . it converts semantic predictions into facade-level PV suitability masks and PV panel layouts considering module sizes and clearances . a dataset of 373 facades with known dimensions from ten cities showed that installable BIPV potential is significantly lower than theoretical potential, thus providing valuable insights for reliable urban energy planning .
label: ai

text: neural feedback accelerates reinforcement learning and can yield task success rates that at times exceed those of sparse-reward baselines . results demonstrate that reinforcement learning can scale beyond locomotion tasks and provide a viable pathway for human-aligned manipulation skill acquisition . the proposed framework remains robust despite the intrinsic inter-individual variability in EEG decodability .
label: ai

text: introduced a century ago by K. Mahler to study the transcendence of certain complex numbers, they have been the subject of several works establishing a deep connection between such transcendence properties and the nature of their solutions . existing algorithms can only compute them in specific rings: rational functions, power series, Puiseux series, or Hahn series . along the way, we describe an algorithm that computes a fundamental matrix of solutions for any Mahler system .
label: ai

text: a postprocessing algorithm, called DP2DP, enforces demographic parity and differential privacy . the proposed algorithm achieves state-of-the-art accuracy/fairness/privacy trade-offs . a number of studies suggest that strong privacy notions inevitably compromise fairness . we propose a method that enforces both demographic and differential data .
label: ai

text: multimodal large language models (MLLMs) deliver impressive vision-language reasoning but suffer steep inference latency . indiscriminate removal can strip away contextual cues essential for background or fine-grained questions, undermining accuracy . parVTS (Parallel Vision Token Scheduling) is a training-free scheduling framework that partitions visual tokens into subject and non-subject groups .
label: ai

text: multimodal trajectory prediction generates multiple plausible future trajectories to address vehicle motion uncertainty from intention ambiguity and execution variability . map-free approaches lack global context, with pairwise attention over-amplifying straight patterns while suppressing transitional patterns, resulting in motion-intention misalignment . this paper proposes GContextFormer, a plug-and-play encoder-decoder architecture with global context-aware hybrid attention .
label: ai

text: 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) has emerged as a leading approach for high-quality novel view synthesis . many variants extend its applicability to a broad spectrum of 3D and 4D scene reconstruction tasks . recent works have proposed to augment 3DGS with additional per-primitive capacity, such as per-splat textures, to enhance its expressiveness .
label: ai

text: reinforcement learning (RL) has attracted increasing attention, with growing efforts to reproduce and apply it . but training efficiency remains a critical challenge in mainstream RL frameworks . this approach reduces costs through resource consolidation, but its synchronous execution imposes a computational coupling that prevents concurrent inference and training . in practice, these works have achieved at least a threefold overall performance improvement in RL training on NPU platforms .
label: ai

text: we present a lightweight yet powerful open-source video generation model . the model achieves state-of-the-art visual quality and motion coherence with only 8.3 billion parameters . this achievement is built upon several key components, including meticulous data curation, an advanced DiT architecture featuring selective and sliding tile attention, enhanced bilingual understanding through glyph-aware text encoding, progressive pre-training and post-training .
label: ai

text: we propose a robust music aesthetic evaluation framework that combines multi-source multi-scale feature extraction to obtain complementary segment- and track-level representations . a hierarchical audio augmentation strategy to enrich training data, and a hybrid training objective that integrates regression and ranking losses for accurate scoring and reliable top-song identification . our approach consistently outperforms baseline methods across correlation and top-tier metrics .
label: ai

text: kernels are critical for reducing training and inference costs of large language models . but existing methods struggle with the vast optimization space due to insufficient hardware domain knowledge . KernelBand is a novel framework that formulates kernel optimization as a hierarchical multi-armed bandit problem, enabling LLM agents to strategically navigate the optimization space by treating kernel selection and optimization strategy application as sequential decision-making processes .
label: ai

text: the RISC-V software ecosystem has a significant demand for algorithm library migration and adaptation . existing intrinsic code benchmarks focus on mainstream SIMD intrinsics . there is currently no benchmark that comprehensively evaluates the intrinsic migration capabilities for the RVV extension . the results demonstrate that advanced Large Language Models (LLMs) achieve a similar effect as rule-based mapping approaches for RISc-V code migration .
label: ai

text: salient object detection (SOD) methods aim to improve performance in four key directions: semantic enhancement, boundary refinement, auxiliary task supervision, and multi-modal fusion . this complexity paradoxically introduces feature redundancy and cross-component interference that obscure salient cues, ultimately reaching performance bottlenecks . dualGazeNet consistently surpasses 25 state-of-the-art CNN- and Transformer-based methods .
label: ai

text: long chain-of-thought reasoning processes incur significant inference overhead . existing efforts have primarily focused on large language models (LLMs), while pruning LRMs remains unexplored . results suggest using self-generated reasoning data can substantially improve pruning performance . we propose a selective self-generated reasoning data construction strategy to provide effective calibration data for pruning .
label: ai

text: RCEG uses fine-tuned LLMs to generate content candidates . then, it uses a discriminator to select the best candidate . the quality of the generated content has been improved greatly . this paper proposes a new framework called Reading Comprehension Exercise Generation (RCEG) it can generate high-quality and personalized English reading comprehension exercises automatically .
label: ai

text: termed adapter (termed AdapterGNN) aims to 'augment' the pre-trained model by inserting a lightweight module to make the 'augmented' model better adapt to the downstream tasks . existing GNNs are often prone to graph noise and exhibit limited generalizability . how to enhance the robustness and generalization ability of the model remains an open problem .
label: ai

text: dataset distillation creates a small distilled set that enables efficient training by capturing key information from the full dataset . existing dataset distillation methods perform well on balanced datasets, but struggle under long-tailed distributions . we introduce three dedicated components that enable unbiased recovery of distilled images and soft relabeling: enhancing expert models and recalibrating BN statistics via a full forward pass with dynamically adjusted momentum .
label: ai

text: autoOdom is a novel proprioceptive odometry system that overcomes these challenges through an innovative two-stage training paradigm . stage 1 employs large-scale simulation data to learn complex nonlinear dynamics and rapidly changing contact states inherent in legged locomotion . Stage 2 introduces an autoregressive enhancement mechanism using limited real-world data to effectively bridge the sim-to-real gap .
label: ai

text: the goal of the project is to design a new model that predicts regions of interest in 360$circ$ videos . ROIs are used to predict view-ports, intelligently cut the videos for live streaming, etc so that less bandwidth is used . detecting view-Ports in advance helps reduce the movement of the head while streaming and watching a video via the head-mounted device .
label: ai

text: our system augments bisect traversal with structured chain of thought reasoning, enabling commit by commit analysis under noisy conditions . we adopt a weak supervision workflow to reduce annotation overhead, incorporating human in the loop corrections and self consistency filtering . Experiments across multiple open source projects show a 6.4 point absolute gain in success rate from 74.2 to 80.6 percent, leading to significantly fewer failed traversals .
label: ai

text: FanarGuard is a bilingual moderation filter that evaluates safety and cultural alignment in Arabic and English . we construct a dataset of over 468K prompt and response pairs, drawn from synthetic and public datasets, and use it to train two variants . results show that fanarguard achieves stronger agreement with human annotations than inter-annotator reliability . findings highlight the importance of integrating cultural awareness into moderation .
label: ai

text: online test-time adaptation addresses the train-test domain gap by adapting the model on unlabeled streaming test inputs before making the final prediction . however, online adaptation for 3D human pose estimation suffers from error accumulation when relying on self-supervision with imperfect predictions, leading to degraded performance over time . to mitigate this fundamental challenge, we propose a novel solution that highlights the use of motion discretization .
label: ai

text: despite progress in deep learning, genetic programming, and large language model, existing approaches still explore only a narrow region of the vast alpha search space . the cognitive Alpha Mining Framework (CogAlpha) combines code-level alpha representation with LLM-driven reasoning and evolutionary search . our framework iteratively refines, mutates, and recombines alpha candidates through multi-stage prompts and financial feedback .
label: ai

text: large language models (LLMs) are increasingly integrated into code editors to provide AI-powered code suggestions . but many of these suggestions are ignored, resulting in wasted computation, increased latency, and unnecessary interruptions . we introduce a lightweight pre-filtering model that predicts the likelihood of suggestion acceptance before invoking the LLM, using only real-time developer telemetry .
label: ai

text: text summarization is the task of condensing longer texts into shorter summaries while preserving the original meaning and key information . this is partly due to the inherent linguistic complexity of Czech and the lack of high-quality annotated datasets . we propose a translation-based approach that first translates Czech texts into English, summarizes them using an English-language model, and then translates them back into Czech .
label: ai

text: Personalized federated learning (PFL) possesses the unique capability of preserving data confidentiality among clients while tackling the data heterogeneity problem of non-independent and identically distributed (Non-IID) data . existing approaches mostly overlook the potential benefits of leveraging shared features across clients, where each client contains segmentation data of different organs .
label: ai

text: WaveTuner is a wavelet decomposition framework empowered by full-spectrum subband Tuning for time series forecasting . the wavelet domain has been designed to partition trend-seasonality components and high-low frequency components . most wavelet-based methods suffer from a persistent bias toward recursively decomposing only low-frequency components, severely underutilizing subtle yet informative high-frequency component .
label: ai

text: new research on enhancing language-guided navigation reasoning has shown promising prospects . but the reasoning of such methods is limited to the linguistic modality, lacking visual reasoning capabilities . a multimodal world model (MWM) takes visual features, language instructions, and navigational actions as inputs to jointly predict subsequent visual states . the first layer generates actions using current vision-and-language features; MWM then infers post-action visual states to guide the second layer's fine-grained decisions.
label: ai

text: focus group discussions generate rich qualitative data but their analysis traditionally relies on labor-intensive manual coding that limits scalability and reproducibility . BERTopic applied to ten focus groups exploring HPV vaccine perceptions in Tunisia (1,076 utterances), we conducted systematic evaluation across 27 hyperparameter configurations, assessed stability through bootstrap resampling with 30 replicates per configuration .
label: ai

text: large language models have transformed code auto-completion by generating context-aware suggestions . but deciding when to present these suggestions remains underexplored . we propose an adaptive timing mechanism that dynamically adjusts the delay before offering a suggestion based on real-time developer feedback . in a two-month deployment with professional developers, our system improved suggestion acceptance from 4.9% with no delay to 15.4% with static delays, and to 18.6% with adaptive timing-while reducing blind rejections (rejections without being
label: ai

text: Personalized Federated Learning (PFL) faces persistent challenges . federated learning often lacks personalization, as a single global model cannot capture client-specific characteristics, leading to biased predictions and poor generalization . to address these issues, we propose FedSTAR, a style-aware federation learning framework that disentangles clients-specific style factors from shared content representations .
label: ai

text: we introduce a novel multi-agent framework designed to automate slide adaptation based on high-level instructor specifications . the framework's output consistently achieved high scores in intent alignment, content coherence and factual accuracy . this work heralds a new paradigm where AI agents handle the logistical burdens of instructional design, liberating educators to focus on the creative and strategic aspects of teaching .
label: ai

text: initial architectural development failed to stabilize performance and calibration using MCD . this technical failure necessitated a rigorous architectural pivot to a high diversity, 9-member Deep Ensemble (DE) this resulting DE successfully stabilized performance and delivered superior reliability, achieving a State-of-the-art (SOTA) average Area under the Receiver operating characteristic curve (AUROC) of 0.8559 and an average F1 score of 0.3857 .
label: ai

text: textbfFVAR reframes the paradigm from emphnext-scale prediction to EmphNext-focus prediction, mimicking the natural process of camera focusing from blur to clarity . to further enhance detail generation, we introduce a high-frequency Residual Teacher that learns from both clean structure and alias residuals .
label: ai

text: HGNN(O) extends four architectures-across six canonical GNN operators . self-tuning mechanism based on Bayesian optimization with pruning and early stopping enables efficient adaptation over architectures and hyperparameters without manual configuration . results demonstrate that proposed autoML-GNN approach provides a robust and generalizable benchmark for outcome prediction in complex event-sequence data .
label: ai

text: ReFlow has been somehow overlooked although it has theoretical consistency with flow matching . this is due to its suboptimal performance in practical scenarios compared to consistency distillation and score distillation . in this work, we investigate this issue within the ReFlow framework and propose FlowSteer, a method unlocks the potential of ReFlow-based distillation by guiding the student along teacher's authentic generation trajectories .
label: ai

text: we introduce PrismAudio, the first framework to integrate Reinforcement Learning into V2A generation with specialized Chain-of-Thought (CoT) planning . our approach decomposes monolithic reasoning into four specialized CoT modules (Semantic, Temporal, Aesthetic, and Spatial CoT) each paired with targeted reward functions . this coT-reward correspondence enables multidimensional RL optimization .
label: ai

text: large language models face information overload when handling long contexts . this issue weakens reasoning accuracy but also increases computational overhead . we propose an unsupervised context compression framework that exploits Abstract Meaning Representation graphs to preserve semantically essential information while filtering out irrelevant text . by quantifying node-level entropy within AMR graphs, our method estimates the conceptual importance of each node .
label: ai

text: video data synthesis has improved data efficiency in the image domain . the primary source of inefficiency in video datasets is inter-sample redundancy . videoCompressa optimizes a differentiable keyframe selector-implemented as a lightweight ConvNet with Gumbel-Softmax sampling-to identify the most informative frames, and a pretrained, frozen Variational Autoencoder .
label: ai

text: existing deep learning models for Predictive Process Monitoring struggle with temporal irregularities, particularly stochastic event durations and overlapping timestamps . we propose a dual input neural network strategy that separates event and sequence attributes . this design is implemented across two baseline families: B-LSTM and B-GCN . all models incorporate self-tuned hypermodels for adaptive architecture selection .
label: ai

text: heart rate estimation from photoplethysmography (PPG) signals generated by wearable devices has significant implications for the health and well-being of individuals . in order to deploy these models, these models must also adhere to strict memory and latency constraints . we evaluate four distillation strategies through comprehensive sweeps of teacher and student model capacities . a characterization of the resulting scaling laws describing the relationship between model size and performance .
label: ai

text: we document how we were able to solve a previously unsolved research problem in robust mathematical statistics with crucial help from GPT-5 . our problem concerns robust density estimation, where the observations are perturbed by Wasserstein-bounded contaminations . starting in October 2025, making significant use of the . minimax optimal estimation error rate (reported in version 3 of the above arxiv preprint)
label: ai

text: the emergence of advanced artificial intelligence techniques has created new opportunities for detecting anxiety in a more consistent and automated manner . the results highlight the potential of combining metaheuristic optimization with deep learning to develop scalable, objective, and clinically meaningful solutions for assessing anxiety disorders . swarm intelligence techniques are incorporated to refine the feature space and optimize hyperparameters . deep learning components are tasked with deriving layered and discriminative representations from sequential, multi-source input .
label: ai

text: traditional knowledge distillation methods treat all teacher predictions equally, regardless of the teacher's confidence in those predictions . we introduce a peer-learning mechanism where two heterogeneous student architectures, specifically ResNet-18 and MobileNetV2, learn collaboratively from both the teacher network and each other . results on ImageNet-100 demonstrate that our approach achieves superior performance compared to baseline knowledge distillations methods .
label: ai

text: a new benchmark dataset and model for holistic and explainable evaluation of AI-generated video (AIGV) quality . the dataset contains near 10000 videos, each annotated with a scalar mean opinion score (MOS) and fine-grained attribution labels along three core dimensions: visual quality, dynamic quality, and text-video alignment . to leverage this data, we propose an evaluation model that jointly perform quality scoring and attribution-based explanation .
label: ai

text: children learn early object labels from co-occurrences of words and referents . but how aligned in time are children's visual and linguistic experiences during everyday learning? we evaluate the use of contrastive language-image pretraining models to automatically characterize vision-language alignment in egocentric videos taken from the infant perspective in home environments . we show that idealized alignment moments for learning are relatively rare compared to modern machine learning datasets, and highlight variability in alignment within and across children .
label: ai

text: videoPerceiver adopts a two-stage training framework . we construct "key-information-missing" videos by extracting event-action keywords from captions . video variants are fed into the model to generate descriptions . a novel relative reward ensures responses from complete videos outperform those from degraded inputs - explicitly training the model .
label: ai

text: latent Diffusion Models (LDMs) offer an efficient solution but suffer from potential information loss and non-end-to-end training . existing pixel space models bypass VAEs but are computationally prohibitive for high-resolution synthesis . a co-trained patch Detailer Head leverages contextual features to restore fine-grained local details . DiP achieves computational efficiency comparable to LDMs without relying on a VAE .
label: ai

text: a single neural network parameterizes both velocity and pressure fields . no boundary conditions are imposed on the pressure field aside from anchoring the pressure at a point to prevent its unbounded development . the technique is demonstrated for the canonical lid-driven cavity flow up to a Reynolds number of 7,500 and for laminar flow over a circular cylinder with inflow-outflow boundary conditions .
label: ai

text: the pipeline converts raw 3D scans into unambiguous, high-quality dialogue data at a fraction of the previous cost . the pipeline comprises four stages: meta-annotation collection harvesting object-, frame-, and scene-level captions, and discriminative object referring that generate exclusive and compact descriptions . our pipeline systematically mitigate inherent flaws in source datasets and produces the final Disc3D dataset, over 2 million samples in 25K hybrid 3D scenes .
label: ai

text: out-of-distribution detection aims to localize anomalous regions at the pixel level, advancing beyond traditional image-level OOD techniques to better suit real-world applications such as autonomous driving . a novel framework that effectively guides classifier-derived OOD scores by exploiting the geometrical structure of the underlying semantic space, particularly using Linear Intrinsic Dimensionality (LID)
label: ai

text: existing open-set 4D object detection methods typically make predictions on a frame-by-frame basis without modeling temporal consistency . DA4D is a large-scale 4D detection dataset containing over 280k sequences with high-quality b-box annotations collected under diverse conditions . it fuses multi-modal features from pre-trained foundational models and designs a geometry-aware spatiotemporal decoder to effectively capture both spatial and temporal dynamics .
label: ai

text: the proposed pTU measures the uncertainty in the interaction between the model and the inputs . it provides insights from the model perspective: if two samples interact with a model in a similar way, then they are considered identically distributed . failure to detect OOD input can lead to incorrect and unreliable predictions . to address this issue, we propose a significance test for OOD, providing a statistical framework .
label: ai

text: recent advances in VLMs have significantly improved HOI detection by leveraging rich cross-modal representations . but most existing VLM-based approaches rely heavily on additional training or prompt tuning, resulting in substantial computational overhead and limited scalability . in long-tailed scenarios where rare interactions are severely underrepresented, we propose the Adaptive Diversity Cache module (ADC) module .
label: ai

text: MergeVLA is a merging-oriented VLA architecture that preserves mergeability by design . it introduces sparsely activated LoRA adapters via task masks to retain consistent parameters and reduce irreconcilable conflicts in the VLM . if the task is unknown, it uses a test-time task router to adapt the appropriate task mask and expert head from the initial observation .
label: ai

text: Graph-based RAG enhances structural reasoning by introducing explicit relational organization that enables information propagation across semantically connected text units . however, these methods typically rely on Euclidean embeddings that capture semantic similarity but lack a geometric notion of hierarchical depth, limiting their ability to represent abstraction relationships inherent in complex knowledge graphs . hyperbolicRAG introduces three key designs: a depth-aware representation learner that embeds nodes within a shared Poincare man
label: ai

text: existing 3D reconstruction methods have adapted the NeRF model and its variants for internal CT reconstruction . but these approaches often neglect the significance of objects' anatomical priors for implicit learning, limiting both reconstruction precision and learning efficiency . to address these challenges, we propose a novel 3D CT reconstruction framework that employs a 'target prior' derived from the object's projection data to enhance implicit learning .
label: ai

text: STORE is a token-based ranking framework built on three core innovations . the framework improves prediction accuracy and training effeciency . a unified and scalable ranking framework is built on a core innovation . it's designed to improve predictive accuracy and improve predictive efficiency, reducing the number of feature tokens in the u.s. and canada .
label: ai

text: the method performs semantic segmentation on the mesh and then operates in a "part-wise" manner . it employs autoregression between parts to ensure global topology, while utilizing a discrete diffusion process within each semantic part to precisely reconstruct high-frequency geometric features . the method significantly outperforms state-of-the-art models in generating 3D meshes with rich detail .
label: ai

text: multi-period images are common in real-world applications . cities are re-scanned for mapping, construction sites are revisited for progress tracking, and natural regions are monitored for environmental change . reconstructing such scenes is an important yet underexplored problem . existing pipelines rely on incompatible assumptions: static and in-the-wild methods enforce a single geometry, while dynamic ones assume smooth motion .
label: ai

text: NEZHA integrates a nimble autoregressive draft head directly into the primary model, enabling efficient self-drafting . this design preserves the integrity of sequence-to-sequence generation . to tackle the critical problem of hallucination, a major source of performance degradation, we introduce a model-free verifier based on a hash set .
label: ai

text: models trained in one setup fail to generalize to new environments, hardware, or users . our study pretrains and evaluates models on over 1.3 million samples from 14 datasets . the results establish scaling trends on Wi-Fi CSI sensing . we conduct a series of cross-domain evaluations on human activity recognition, human gesture recognition and user identification tasks .
label: ai

text: RoguePrompt is an automated jailbreak attack that converts a disallowed user query into a self reconstructing prompt . our attack assumes only black box access to the model and to the associated moderation endpoint . the attack achieves 84.7 percent bypass, 80.2 percent reconstruction, and 71.5 percent full execution, substantially outperforming five automated jailbreaking baselines .
label: ai

text: our contribution is an efficient refitting procedure that computes the excess risk and provides high-probability upper bounds under the fixed-design setting . we then refit the black-box procedure twice to obtain two corresponding wild predictors . a key feature of our analysis is that it requires no prior knowledge of the complexity of the underlying function class .
label: ai

text: stereoDETR achieves real-time inference and is the first stereo-based method to surpass monocular approaches in speed . it also achieves competitive accuracy on the public KITTI benchmark . the code is available at https://github.com/shiyi-mu/StereoDETR-OPEN . if you have any questions, please contact us .
label: ai

text: vision-language Models (VLMs) perform well on multimodal benchmarks . but lag behind humans and specialized models on visual perception tasks . we examine how finetuning a VLM on one perception task affects its zero-shot performance on others . to quantify these effects, we introduce Perfection Gap Factor (PGF), a metric that captures the breadth and magnitude of transfer .
label: ai

text: we present STCDiT, a video super-resolution framework built on a pre-trained video diffusion model . the main challenges lie in maintaining temporal stability during reconstruction and preserving structural fidelity during generation . to address these challenges, we first develop a motion-aware VAE reconstruction method that performs segment-wise reconstruction, with each segment clip exhibiting uniform motion characteristic .

text: TF is a novel two-stage framework for unpaired 3D brain tumor synthesis . it leverages only healthy image scans along with a limited amount of real annotated data to synthesize large volumes of paired synthetic data for enriching downstream supervised segmentation training . the synthetic image-label pairs used as data enrichment can significantly improve performance on downstream tumor segmentation tasks in low-data regimes .

text: fully Homomorphic Encryption (CKKS) is a promising enabler for privacy-preserving MLaaS . but its practical deployment faces a prohibitive barrier: it heavily relies on domain expertise . experts are restricted to compilers that rely on fixed heuristics . the agentic framework automates this expert reasoning process .
label: ai

text: a systematic literature review (2019-2024) and a 12-week empirical validation study demonstrate measurable performance gains . the study adopts a mixed-method design science research (DSR) approach aligned with PRISMA 2020 guidelines . despite limitations related to sample size, single-case design, and study duration, the findings show that Lean 5.0 provides a transformative paradigm connecting human cognition with predictive control in construction management .
label: ai

text: digitized all 46 questions (22 common and 24 elective) within two hours of exam's public release . gpt-oss-20B achieved 95.7 points despite its relatively small size . problem-specific analysis revealed geometry as the weakest domain (77.7% average) with significant performance degradation on 4-point high-difficulty problems .
label: ai

text: the core algorithm uses a binary matrix of disorders and their symptom combinations . it filters through the rows and columns based on the patient's current symptoms to identify potential disorders . the system successfully identified plausible disorders from an initial symptom set and recommended further symptoms to refine the diagnosis . a fully-developed application of this recommender system may assist mental health professionals in identifying relevant disorders more efficiently and guiding symptom-specific follow-up investigations .
label: ai

text: KV cache is a dominant memory bottleneck for LLM inference . the main challenge is handling dynamic 4-bit channel boosts . Kitty provides a page-centric KV layout, triton-compatible page dequantization kernels and a lightweight runtime pipeline that preserves coalescing and avoids divergence . we close this gap via an algorithm-system co-design for mixed-precision KV caching: Kitty .
label: ai

text: neuroimaging is underrepresented in the public domain due to identifiable facial features within MRI and CT scans, fundamentally restricting model performance in clinical medicine . neuroVFM learns comprehensive representations of brain anatomy and pathology, achieving state-of-the-art performance across multiple clinical tasks, including radiologic diagnosis and report generation . the model generates radiology reports that surpass frontier models in accuracy, clinical triage, and expert preference .
label: ai

text: we propose a novel approach for the development, analysis, and verification of reductions between NP-complete problems . this method uses the URSA system, a SAT-based constraint solver and incorporates features that distinguish it from existing related systems .  Less than a quarter of a century ago, we had a problem with the system .
label: ai

text: bias mitigation techniques are applied across ten models from seven model families . we measure the impact of debiasing on model coherence and stereotypical preference . results consistently show that targeted mitigation can sometimes reduce bias in the intended dimension, but often leads to unintended and often negative consequences in others . findings underscore the critical need for robust, multi-dimensional evaluation tools when examining and developing bias mitigation strategies .
label: ai

text: ChroniUXMag is a framework for eliciting and analysing inclusivity requirements in mHealth design . the framework was developed through two stages of the InclusiveMag process . in the first stage, inclusivity facets were identified through a systematic literature review, focus groups, interviews, and a large-scale survey . facets capture the socio-technical complexity of mhealth use .
label: ai

text: a structuralist decision framework is developed for classifying implicit ontological commitments made in machine learning research on neural network representations . five influential papers are analysed through three hierarchical criteria derived from structuralist philosophy of science: entity elimination, source of structure, and mode of existence . results reveal a pronounced tendency toward structural idealism, where learned representations are treated as model-dependent constructions shaped by architec- ture, data priors, and training dynamics .
label: ai

text: MedChat is a locally deployable virtual physician framework that integrates an LLM-based medical chatbot with a diffusion-driven avatar for automated and structured anamnesis . the chatbot was fine-tuned using a hybrid corpus of real and synthetically generated medical dialogues . a secure database interface was implemented to ensure complete separation between patient data and the inference process .
label: ai

text: we introduce a time-aware graph-based benchmark that reconstructs annual co-occurrence graphs of 65,027 research sub-fields over the period 1827-2024 . edges denote the cooccurrence of two fields in a single publication and are timestamped with the publication year . we formulate the prediction of new field-pair linkages as a temporal link-prediction task .
label: ai

text: best-of-n (BoN) selects the output with the highest reward . with perfect rewards, it often achieves near-perfect accuracy . but with imperfect rewards, BoN fails to reliably find the correct answer . this suggests that the mode of this distribution can be more reliably correct than a sample from it . moB serves as a simple, yet strong alternative to BoN and self-consistency .
label: ai

text: a vision Transformer (ViT) classifier was created in-house and made available for the research community . the ViT demonstrated consistently strong performance, with accuracies ranging from 0.789 to 0.843 across datasets and diseases . glaucoma remained the most frequently misclassified disease, compared to retinopathy and age-related macular degeneration .
label: ai

text: a Discrete Choice Experiment (DCE) was conducted with 186 participants who have chronic diseases and use mHealth applications . participants were asked to select preferred adaptation designs from choices featuring six attributes with varying levels . maintaining usability while ensuring controllability over adaptations, infrequent adaptations and small-scale changes are key factors that facilitate the adoption .
label: ai

text: OpenGloss contains 537K senses across 150K lexemes, on par with WordNet 3.1 . contains 9.1M semantic edges, 1M usage examples, 3M collocations, and 60M words of encyclopedic content . created through a multi-agent procedural generation pipeline with schema-validated LLM outputs and automated quality assurance .
label: ai

text: using beam search and random walk algorithms, I systematically explore this space, evaluating candidates on development sets and pruning unpromising branches . beam search achieves development accuracy gains from 0.40 to 0.80 on reasoning tasks, though test set improvements are more modest (0.20 to 0.50), indicating overfitting to the develop-ment heuristic . prompt optimisation is a classical state-space search problem .
label: ai

text: paper headlines with sentiment analysis tell us what the news is about (e.g., politics, sports) and how the news makes us feel (positive, negative, neutral) this helps us quickly understand the emotional tone of the news . the proposed model BERT-CNN-BiLSTM significantly outperforms all baseline models in classification tasks, and achieve new state-of-the-art results for Bangla news headline classification and sentiment analysis .
label: ai

text: autoFocus-IL leverages vision-language models (VLMs) to automatically identify and track key objects in demonstrations, generating temporal saliency maps that highlight causal visual signals while suppressing distractors . these maps are then used to regularize behavior cloning policies, yielding stronger alignment between visual attention and task-relevant cues .
label: ai

text: we introduce a systematic, reproducible benchmark that evaluates the ability of LLMs to predict individuals' stances in a zero-shot setting using data from an online debate platform . the benchmark includes multiple informational conditions that isolate the contribution of demographic context and known prior beliefs to predictive success . despite the growing use of large language models across disciplines, how well these systems generalize across diverse belief domains remains unclear .
label: ai

text: label shift is a prevalent challenge in supervised learning . we propose a Bayesian framework for label shift estimation . the method is termed Full Maximum A Posterior Label Shift (MAPLS) and its online version, online-FMAPLS . a linear surrogate function (LSF) is used to replace gradient-based hyperparameter updates .
label: ai

text: LSTM demonstrates substantial superiority across all tested prediction horizons . standard KAN exhibits significantly higher error rates and limited practical applicability for time series forecasting . results confirm LS® dominance in accuracy-critical time series applications while identifying computational efficiency as KANs' primary advantage in resource-constrained scenarios where accuracy requirements are less stringent .
label: ai

text: split learning suffers from poor scalability, while parallel variants like parallel split learning and split federated learning often incur high server resource overhead due to model duplication and aggregation . cycleSL treats server-side training as an independent higher-level machine learning task, resampling client-extracted features (smashed data) to mitigate heterogeneity and drift . it performs cyclical updates, optimizing the server model first, followed by client updates using the updated server for gradient computation .
label: ai

text: prior studies primarily explore single-RIS deployments with static or semi-static reflection control . the second RIS (RIS$_2$) is dynamically configured to steer signals toward specific receivers or indoor zones . we develop a complete end-to-end system model, including multi-hop channel representation, RIS phase configuration mapping, and signal detection based on space shift keying (SSK).
label: ai

text: the Rubik's Cube is a cognitive model system existing at the intersection of puzzle solving, skill learning, expert knowledge, cultural transmission, and group theory . expert performance follows exponential progress curves whose parameters reflect the delayed acquisition of algorithms that shorten solution paths . blindfold solves form a distinct problem class from sighted solves and are constrained not only by expert knowledge but also by the skill improvements required to overcome short-term memory bottlenecks .
label: ai

text: bug bounty platforms leverage crowd-sourced vulnerability discovery to improve continuous coverage, reduce the cost of discovery, and serve as an integral complement to internal red teams . we collect a dataset of 9,942 disclosed bug bounty reports, including 1,400 invalid reports . to improve invalidity detection, we build a taxonomy of rejection reasons for Information Disclosure vulnerabilities and incorporate it into a retrieval-augmented generation framework .
label: ai

text: latent safety filters extend Hamilton-Jacobi reachability to operate on latent state representations and dynamics learned directly from high-dimensional observations . existing methods implement "least-restrictive" filtering that discretely switch between nominal and safety policies, potentially undermining the task performance that makes modern visuomotor policies valuable . latentCBF addresses both challenges through gradient penalties that lead to smooth margin functions without additional labeling .
label: ai

text: constraint classification for constraint-based search algorithms . we categorize constraints as conservative or aggressive and provide insights into their search behavior . findings synthesize in a decision flowchart, aiding users in selecting suitable constraints . a comprehensive exploration of the study, including raw data and map performance, is available in our public GitHub Repository: https://GitHub.com/hannahjmlee/constraint-mapf-analysis .
label: ai

text: RAF deforms a static neutral facial mesh into industry-standard FACS poses . we curated a dataset of facial meshes, with a subset meticulously rigged by professional artists to serve as accurate 3D ground truth for deformation supervision . this strategy increases data diversity and allows for scaled training, thereby enhancing the generalization ability of models trained on it .
label: ai

text: NeAR: a Coupled Neural asset-renderer Stack explores the potential of jointly designing the asset representation and renderer . we argue that coupling them can unlock an end-to-end learnable graphics stack with benefits in fidelity, consistency, and efficiency . a coupled stack surpasses state-of-the-art baselines in both quantitative metrics and perceptual quality .
label: ai

text: Large Language Models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive capabilities in natural language and code generation . they are increasingly deployed as automatic judges of model outputs and learning activities . but their behavior on structured tasks such as predicting the difficulty of competitive programming problems remains under-explored . a dataset of 1,825 LeetCode problems labeled Easy, Medium, or Hard, attains 86% accuracy .
label: ai

text: we present the first stage-specific, cross-sectional benchmarking of deep learning models for follow-up MRI using the Burdenko GBM Progression cohort (n = 180). we analyze different post-RT scans independently to test whether architecture performance depends on time-point . a unified, QC-driven pipeline with patient-level cross-validation was used .
label: ai

text: the narrow nature of mmWave beams requires precise alignments . this overhead can be reduced by incorporating position information with beam adjustments . proposed model is designed as a three-layer undercomplete network to exploit its dimensionality reduction capabilities and thereby mitigate the computational requirements of the trained model . the proposed model achieves a similar beam prediction accuracy to the baseline with an 83% complexity reduction .
label: ai

text: Graph Diffusion Models (GDMs) optimize for statistical likelihood, implicitly acting as textbffrequency filters that favor abundant substructures over spectrally critical ones . this leads to the catastrophic removal of rare bridges,'' edges that are structurally mandatory ($R_texteff approx 1$) but statistically scarce .
label: ai

text: generative framework based on visual autoregressive (VAR) modeling . it is guided by perceptual priors from the vision-language model (VLM) to provide informative conditioning cues for VAR models . we integrate dynamic and spatial-frequency-aware Rotary positional Encodings (SF-RoPE) into VAR to enhance its ability to model structures degraded by blur .
label: ai

text: we present a preliminary domain adaptation pipeline that trains on simulated TNG50 galaxies . we train three backbones with focal loss and effective-number class weighting . a combination of these losses with an OT-based "top_$k$ soft matching" loss can further enhance domain alignment . target accuracy (macro F1) rises from $sim$46% at no adaptation .
label: ai

text: organizations are rapidly adopting Large Language Models (LLMs) to transform their operations . but they lack clear guidance on key decisions for adoption and implementation . healthcare providers must protect patient data while leveraging LLMs for medical analysis, financial institutions need to balance automated customer service with regulatory compliance, and software companies seek to enhance development productivity while maintaining code security . this article presents a systematic six-step decision framework for LLM adoption, helping organizations navigate from initial application selection to final deployment .
label: ai

text: dependence introduced challenges existing statistical theory under DP-constraints . noisy Winsorized mean estimators can also be used under dependence for bounded and unbounded data . resulting guarantees for our item-level mean estimator extend to textituser-level mean estimation and transfer to the local model via a randomized response histogram .
label: ai
