text: existing studies predominantly address warm-start scenarios with abundant user-item interaction data . our method utilizes advanced reasoning capabilities of LLMs to effectively infer user preferences, particularly for newly introduced or rarely interacted items . we systematically evaluate supervised fine-tuning, reinforcement learning-based fine-touning and hybrid approaches that combine both methods to optimize recommendation performance .
label: ai

text: RB-DeepONet fuses reduced-basis numerical structure with branch-trunk architecture . trunk is fixed to a rigorously constructed RB space generated offline via Greedy selection . branch network predicts only RB coefficients and is trained label-free using a projected variational residual that targets the RB solution . all heavy lifting occurs offline, and online evaluation scales only with RB dimension rather than full mesh .
label: ai

text: discoVerse is a multi-agent co-scientist designed to support pharmaceutical research and development . the system implements semantic retrieval, cross-document linking, and auditable synthesis on a large historical corpus from Roche . to validate our approach at real-world scale, we selected a subset of 180 molecules from the Roche research repositories, covering over 0.87 billion BPE tokens .
label: ai

text: a hybrid agentic AI and multi agent framework for a Prescriptive Maintenance use case . the proposed framework adopts a layered architecture that consists of perception, preprocessing, analytics, and optimization layers . agents autonomously handle schema discovery, intelligent feature analysis, model selection, and prescriptive optimization . HITL interface ensures transparency and auditability of generated maintenance recommendations .
label: ai

text: we propose an approach that continuously adapts a pre-trained diffusion model to a video stream . we define the approach Sequence Adaptive Video Prediction with Diffusion Noise Optimization (SAVi-DNO) to validate our approach, we introduce a new evaluation setting on the Ego4D dataset, focusing on simultaneous adaptation and evaluation on long videos .
label: ai

text: recent methods achieve centimeter-level accuracy on popular autonomous vehicle datasets, but are typically only trained and evaluated on a single sensor . but prior work in LiDAR semantic segmentation and 3D object detection demonstrate that naively training on multiple datasets yields worse performance than single dataset models . we posit that low-level tasks such as motion estimation may be less sensitive to sensor configuration; indeed, models trained on fast-moving objects perform well .
label: ai

text: a recent breakthrough algorithm by [Fin24] takes $tildeO(m n8/9)$ randomized time on a graph with $m$ edges and $n$ vertices . the running time was subsequently improved to $Tilde'O (mn3/4 + m4/5 n)$ [HJQ26] .
label: ai

text: we study evolutionary dynamics on graphs in which each step consists of one birth and one death . in birth-death, a vertex is chosen uniformly to die, and then one of its neighbors is chosen, proportional to fitness, to place an offspring into the vacancy . we formalize and study a unified model, the $$-mixed Moran process .
label: ai

text: presently known secondary construction techniques for linear codes mainly include puncturing, shortening, and extending . the proposed method generates new families of linear codes but also provides a powerful approach for exploring the intrinsic combinatorial and geometric structures of existing codes . a new framework is developed to construct new linear codes from the set of codewords in a given code having a fixed Hamming weight .
label: ai

text: Metamorphic relations (MRs) serve as a foundational mechanism for generating semantically equivalent mutations . software engineering has advanced significantly in recent years with the advent of Large Language Models (LLMs) but the reliability of LLMs in software engineering is often compromised by ambiguities and inconsistencies due to improper user specification . to address this challenge, we present codeMetaAgent (CMA), a metamorphic relation-driven LLM agent that refines task specifications and generates semantically con
label: ai

text: trajectories of multiple interacting agents are a core challenge in sports analytics and other domains involving complex group dynamics . most existing models are evaluated solely on per-agent accuracy metrics (minADE, minFDE) but these metrics overlook whether the model learns which predicted predicted . a result, they may underperform on joint predictions and also fail to generate coherent, interpretable . scenarios in team sports .
label: ai

text: UCBVI-type algorithm characterizes the tail distribution of the regret $R_K$ over $K$ episodes, rather than its expectation or a single high-probability quantile . the proposed algorithm depends on a tuning parameter $$, which balances the expected regret and the range over which the regret exhibits a sub-Gaussian tail .
label: ai

text: AI4CHEM is an introductory data-driven chem-istry course created for students on the synthetic chemistry track with no prior programming background . the curricu-lum emphasizes chemical context over abstract algorithms, using an accessible web-based platform to ensure zero-install machine learning practice and in-class active learning . learning gains include increased confidence with Python, molecular property prediction, reaction optimization, and data mining .
label: ai

text: the world model treats the quadcopter as a free-body system . it predicts the net forces and moments acting on it . this is then passed through a 6-DOF Runge-Kutta integrator (RK4) . both models perform well on the training data, but fail to generalize to new trajectories, leading to rapid divergence in state rollouts .
label: ai

text: we introduce $textbfEgoVITA$, a reinforcement learning framework that enables MLLMs to reason through structured planning and verification . the model learns to make plans that are causally predictive of upcoming visual observations, leading to more coherent and visually grounded reasoning . egocentric videos capture scenes from an outside observer, introducing partial observability, limited field of view, and self-referenced motion.
label: ai

text: traditional linear methods provide structured and predictable behavior thanks to their linear formulation, but are limited in expressiveness . nonlinear model reduction, typically implemented with neural networks, offers richer representations and higher compression; however, without structural constraints, the learned mappings often fail to generalize beyond the training distribution, leading to unstable or implausible deformations . we present a symmetric, convex-inspired neural formulation that bridges the gap between linear and nonlineary model reduction .
label: ai

text: traditional Intrusion Detection Systems face significant limitations . poor adaptability to evolving and zero-day attacks, reliance on static signatures and labeled datasets, and inefficiency on resource-constrained edge gateways . most existing DRL-based IDS studies overlook sustainability factors such as energy efficiency and carbon impact . a carbon-aware, multi-objective reward function optimized for sustainable and real-time IDS operations in dynamic IoT networks .
label: ai

text: public health agencies face critical challenges in identifying high-risk neighborhoods for childhood lead exposure with limited resources for outreach and intervention programs . to address this, we develop a Priority Score integrating untested children proportions, elevated blood lead prevalence, and public health coverage patterns . we leverage these allocation tasks to evaluate whether large language models (LLMs) with agentic reasoning and deep research capabilities can effectively allocate public health resources .
label: ai

text: the resource-constrained shortest path problem (RCSPP) involves finding a path that minimizes a primary cost subject to a budget on a secondary resource . the challenge is particularly acute in domains like mission planning for unmanned ground vehicles (UGVs) which demand solutions on large-scale terrain graphs, making them impractical for time-critical planning . APULSE is a hybrid label-setting algorithm designed to efficiently solve the RCSPP on such challenging graphs .
label: ai

text: conventional anomaly detection schemes prioritize accuracy while overlooking computational efficiency and environmental impact . ecoDefender is supported by a theoretical foundation that establishes formal guarantees for its stability, convergence, robustness, and energy-complexity coupling . experiments on realistic IoT traffic confirm these theoretical insights, achieving up to 94% detection accuracy with an average CPU usage of only 22%, 27 ms inference latency, and 30% lower energy consumption compared to AE-only baselines .
label: ai

text: hyperdimensional computing (HDC) encodes information and data into high-dimensional distributed vectors that can be manipulated using simple bitwise operations and similarity searches . these properties are a natural fit for SQL database workloads dominated by predicate evaluation and scans, which demand low energy and low latency over large fact tables . HDC's noise-tolerance maps well onto emerging ferroelectric NAND memories, which provide ultra-high density and in-storage compute capability .
label: ai

text: conventional approaches like SENSE require both undersampled k-space data and pre-computed coil sensitivity maps . we propose an end-to-end deep learning framework that jointly estimates coils and reconstructs images from only undersampled measurements at 4x acceleration . our approach produces visually smoother reconstructions compared to conventional MRI output, achieving comparable visual quality despite lower PSNR/SSIM metrics.
label: ai

text: edge-centric Intrusion Detection System (IDS) framework integrates lightweight machine learning (ML) based IDS models with pre-trained large language models (LLMs) to improve detection accuracy, semantic interpretability, and operational efficiency at the network edge . the system transmits a compact and secure telemetry snapshot via low-bandwidth API calls to LLMs including GPT-4-turbo, DeepSeek V2, and LLaMA 3.5 .
label: ai

text: in this paper, we propose a novel approach for optimizing the linear layer used in symmetric cryptography . it is observed that these matrices often have circulant structure . our results outperform previous works for various linear layers of block ciphers . for Whirlwind M0, we obtain two implementations with 159 XOR counts (8% better than Yuan et al. at FSE 2025)
label: ai

text: quantum machine learning seeks to leverage quantum computers to improve on classical machine learning algorithms . recent work has introduced quantum conformal prediction, a framework that produces prediction sets that are guaranteed to contain the true outcome with user-specified probability . to address this challenge, we draw on Adaptive Conformal Inference, an algorithm which maintains validity over time via repeated recalibration .
label: ai

text: deep Reinforcement Learning-based IDS have shown promise due to their adaptive and generalization capabilities . however, recent studies reveal their vulnerability to adversarial attacks, including universal Adversarial Perturbations (UAPs), which can deceive models with a single, input-agnostic perturbation . to the best of our knowledge, there is no existing study that has explored a novel UAP attack against the DRL-based . IDS .
label: ai

text: this paper proposes SConvTransform, a Transform dialect extension . it lowers Linalg convolutions into tiled and packed generic operations . the process is guided by a Convolution Slicing Analysis that determines tile sizes and data layout strategies based on input and filter shapes . all packing and tiling operations are derived from a parametric set of affine equations .
label: ai

text: a research full paper presents an enhancement pipeline for large language models (LLMs) in assessing homework for an undergraduate circuit analysis course . aims to improve LLMs' capacity to provide personalized support to electrical engineering students . the correct response rate for GPT-4o increases from 74.71% to 97.70% after applying the enhanced prompting and augmented data on entry-level circuit analysis topics .
label: ai

text: a range of theories seek to explain why humans are so adept at iterated learning . many positing substantial evolutionary discontinuities in communication or cognition . could small differences in communication ability produce large differences in what a species can learn over generations? we investigate this question through a formal model based on information theory . we manipulate how much information individual learners can send each other .
label: ai

text: a vision-based, markerless, and training-free framework for soft robot shape reconstruction . this framework directly leverages the robot's natural surface appearance . the method achieves real-time shape tracking across diverse environments while maintaining robustness to occlusions and variations in camera viewpoints . these results highlight the potential of the proposed approach for reliable, low-cost deployment in dynamic real-world settings .
label: ai

text: deep neural networks have enabled breakthroughs in RL . but they often lack calibrated uncertainty estimates . GPPO maintains competitive performance with respect to Proximal Policy Optimization on standard . high-dimensional continuous control benchmarks while providing well-calibrated uncertainty estimates that can inform safer and more effective exploration . the scalable, model-free actor-critic algorithm leverages Deep Gaussian Processes to approximate both the policy and value function .
label: ai

text: surface electromyography (sEMG) is a non-invasive input modality for mapping muscle activity to keyboard inputs, targeting immersive typing in next-generation human-computer interaction (HCI) this is especially relevant for spatial computing and virtual reality (VR), where traditional keyboards are impractical . using attention-based architectures, we significantly outperform the existing convolutional baselines, reducing online generic CER from 24.98% -> 20.34% .
label: ai

text: 3D human motion generation is pivotal across film, animation, gaming, and embodied intelligence . traditional 3D motion synthesis relies on costly motion capture, while recent work shows that 2D videos provide rich, temporally coherent observations of human behavior . existing approaches either map high-level text descriptions to motion or rely solely on video conditioning . to bridge the distribution gap across modalities, we propose Dual-stream Unified Encoding and Transformation (DUET) and a Distribution-Aware Structural
label: ai

text: self-supervised learning (SSL) overcomes this by leveraging the growing availability of large-scale unlabeled brain metastases imaging datasets . a vision Transformer (ViT) was pre-trained via SSL on 10,167 multi-source T1CE MRI sub-volumes and then fine-tuned for RN classification using a two-channel input . multimodal integration further improved performance .
label: ai

text: the Hausdorff distance (HD) is a robust measure of set dissimilarity . but computing it on large, high-dimensional datasets is prohibitively expensive . proHD identifies a small subset of candidate "extreme" points . this approach guarantees an underestimate of the true HD with a bounded additive error and typically achieves results within a few percent of the exact value .
label: ai

text: the success of in vitro fertilization (IVF) at many clinics relies on the accurate morphological assessment of day 5 blastocysts . existing generative embryo models can mitigate these issues but face several limitations, such as poor image quality, small training datasets, non-robust evaluation, and lack of clinically relevant image generation for effective data augmentation .
label: ai

text: skill abstraction with symbolic predicates is a promising direction in building autonomous agents . skillWrapper learns abstract representations that enable solving unseen, long-horizon tasks in the real world with black-box skills . generative predicate invention has been proven to be efficient because of its compatibility with domain-independent planners . but it remains unclear which formal properties the learned representations must satisfy, and how they can be learned .
label: ai

text: infiniBench, a fully automated, customizable and user-friendly benchmark generator can synthesize a theoretically infinite variety of 3D scenes with parameterized control on scene complexity . a cluster-based layout optimizer that generates dense and cluttered scenes previously intractable for procedural methods, and a task-aware camera trajectory optimization method that renders scenes into videos with full object coverage .
label: ai

text: single models fit to all patients perform poorly, while individualized models improve performance but still overfit to patients with limited data . to address this, we introduce Latent Similarity Gaussian Processes (LSGPs) to capture patient heterogeneity, enabling those with little data to leverage similar patients' trends . even without kernel-design, we outperform all but one baseline while offering new understanding of patient similarity.
label: ai

text: SVD excels in extreme compression but sacrifices fidelity . results highlight Tucker decomposition's suitability for applications requiring preservation of structural and temporal relationships . singular value Decomposition preserves multi-dimensional relationships, achieving superior reconstruction fidelity and perceptual similarity . the results highlight the suitability of Tucker's applications .
label: ai

text: agent-as-a-Graph retrieval is a knowledge graph retrieval augmented generation approach that represents both tools and their parent agents as nodes and edges . agents and tool nodes are first retrieved through vector search, ii) parent agents are traversed in the knowledge graph for the final set of agents . wRRF optimizations have been improved over prior state-of-the-art retrievers .
label: ai

text: ARIAL (Agentic Reasoning for Interpretable Answer Localization) orchestrates specialized tools through an LLM-based planning agent to achieve both precise answer extraction and reliable spatial grounding . the modular architecture produces transparent reasoning traces, enabling tool-level auditability and independent component optimization . ARIAL achieves state-of-the-art results across all datasets: 88.7 ANLS and 50.1 mAP on DocVQA .
label: ai

text: large-scale Transformer-based models have achieved state-of-the-art performance in time-series forecasting but suffer from high computational costs . to address this challenge, we propose a general inference acceleration framework that adapts speculative decoding to autoregressive time series models . we demonstrate significant inference speedups while maintaining competitive accuracy .
label: ai

text: our empirical study of GitHub repositories revealed that 47% of release artifacts lacked traceability links, and 12% contained broken links . to address this gap, we first analyzed release notes to identify their What, Why, and How information and assessed how these align with PRs, commits, and issues . by combining the time proximity feature, the LLM-based approach achieved a high Precision@1 value of 0.73 for PR traceability recovery .
label: ai

text: a patient with a high risk may need to undergo an initial baseline and several annual follow-up examinations (e.g., CT scans) before receiving a definitive diagnosis, which can result in missing the optimal treatment . recently, artificial intelligence (AI) methods have been increasingly used for early diagnosis of lung cancer . but most existing algorithms focus on radiomic features extraction from single early-stage scans .
label: ai

text: TRAIL (Traversability with an Implicit Learned Representation) is an off-road navigation framework that leverages an implicit neural representation to continuously parameterize terrain properties . this representation yields spatial gradients that enable integration with a novel gradient-based trajectory optimization method that adapts the path geometry and speed profile based on terrain traversability . trail is a framework that allows robots to predict the terrain through a short look-ahead window .
label: ai

text: the Creative Intelligence Loop (CIL) is a novel socio-technical framework for responsible human-AI co-creation . it aims to guide the strategic integration of diverse AI teammates who function as collaborators while the human remains the final arbiter for ethical alignment and creative integrity . resulting graphic novellas analyze distinct socio-technology failures: 'the Steward' examines benevolent AI paternalism in smart cities, illustrating how algorithmic hubris can erode freedom .
label: ai

text: the first dedicated inner-loop actor-critic framework for continuous state and action spaces . the framework combines a multi-headed actor network, a centralised critic, and an objective preference-conditioning architecture . we outline a natural test suite for continuous MOMARL by combining a pre-existing multi-agent single-objective physics simulator .
label: ai

text: traditional approaches rely on models trained on data from a small number of engines . this can be insufficient in generalizing across an entire population of engines due to sensor biases and variations in input conditions . models that can adapt with minimal adjustments to accommodate engine-to-engine variability and sensor discrepancies often fail to generalize reliably across different engines and operating environments .
label: ai

text: new advances in Retrieval-Augmented Generation have enabled Large Language Models to answer financial questions using external knowledge bases . existing work lacks systematic comparison of vector-based and non-vector RAG architectures for financial documents . the empirical impact of advanced RAG techniques on retrieval accuracy, answer quality, latency, and cost remain unclear . we present the first systematic evaluation comparing vector based agentic RAG using hybrid search and metadata filtering against hierarchical node-based systems .
label: ai

text: the unified spherical frontend (USF) is a lens-agnostic framework that transforms images from any calibrated camera into a unit-sphere representation via ray-direction correspondences . it is modular: projection, location sampling, interpolation, and resolution control are fully decoupled . USF processes high-resolution images efficiently and maintains less than 1% performance drop under random test-time rotations, even without rotational augmentation .
label: ai

text: we train a video prediction model to condition future frame generation on explicit 3D body pose sequences . to achieve precise motion control, we introduce a novel pose representation that captures both global camera dynamics and articulated body movements . EgoControl generates temporally coherent and visually realistic future frames that align with the provided pose control, paving the way toward controllable embodied video simulation and understanding .
label: ai

text: a simulation-driven approach to DQM is proposed, enabling the study and development of data-quality methodologies in a controlled environment . a modified version of Delphes, a fast, multi-purpose detector simulation, leverages ML to identify detector anomalies and localize malfunctioning components responsible . this work represents an initial step toward a comprehensive ML-based ML framework .
label: ai

text: business process model and notation (BPMN) is widely used standard for modelling business processes . most implementations remain incomplete or limited in scope . project builds upon prior theoretical work to develop a functional pipeline that translates BPMN 2.0 diagrams into PDDL representations suitable for planning . aims to bridge the gap between theory and practical tooling, providing a foundation for further exploration of translating business processes into well-defined plans .
label: ai

text: the global planner integrates conformal prediction (CP) for uncertainty-aware trajectory generation . the local planner mitigates inaccuracies in obstacle trajectory predictions through adaptive CP . to further enhance trajectory feasibility, we introduce an adaptive quantile mechanism in the CP-based uncertainty quantification . we validate the proposed framework through numerical experiments conducted in dynamic and cluttered environments .
label: ai

text: Sparse Polyak proposes a novel adaptive step-size rule tailored to suitably estimate the problem's curvature in the high-dimensional setting . the algorithm's performance does not deteriorate when the ambient dimension increases . but convergence guarantees can only be obtained by sacrificing solution sparsity and statistical accuracy . in this work, we introduce a variant that retains its desirable scaling properties while obtaining sparser solutions .
label: ai

text: the use of Large Language Models (LLMs) for generating Automated Planning (AP) models has been widely explored . however, their application to HP is still far from reaching the level of sophistication observed in non-hierarchical architectures . we present two main contributions: first, we propose L2HP, an extension of L2P that support HP model generation .
label: ai

text: the nested unfolding network (NUN) is a unified framework for real-world COS . the design decouples restoration from segmentation while allowing mutual refinement . NUN employs image-quality assessment to select the best DeRUN outputs for subsequent stages, naturally introducing a self-consistency loss that enhances robustness .
label: ai

text: explainable AI has advanced significantly in standard computer vision tasks . but interpretability remains virtually unexplored despite its critical importance for understanding model behavior and guiding support set selection in data-scarce scenarios . our Affinity Explainer approach extracts attribution maps that highlight which pixels in support images contribute most to query segmentation predictions . we extend standard interpretability evaluation metrics to the FSS domain .
label: ai

text: previous work identified two types of attention heads that disentangle this information . these heads can be used to identify subspaces of model activations that exhibit coherent semantic structure in Llama-2-7b . token heads allow for transformations that reveal surface-level word information in hidden states, allowing for operations like "coding" - "code" + "dance" = "dancing"
label: ai

text: Masked diffusion models (MDMs) suffer from inherently much higher training variance . high variance leads to noisier gradient estimates and unstable optimization . even equally strong pretrained MDMs and ARMs that are competitive at initialization often diverge after task-specific training . there has been no theoretical explanation or systematic solution . we design six variance-reduction methods, including two core methods .
label: ai

text: localization systems often rely on fingerprinting, which requires extensive survey efforts to obtain location-tagged signal data . recent approaches that attempt to reduce this overhead suffer from low representation ability, mode collapse issues, or require the effort of collecting data at all target locations . to further improve our diffusion model performance, LocaGen augments seen location data based on domain-specific heuristics and strategically selects the seen and unseen locations using a novel density-based approach .
label: ai

text: sciPy's spatial$.$transform module is a rigorously tested Python implementation . but it historically only supported NumPy, limiting adoption in GPU-accelerated and autodiff-based workflows . the revised implementation preserves the established SciPy interface while enabling GPU/TPU execution, JIT compilation, vectorized batching, and differentiation via native Autodiff of the chosen backend .
label: ai

text: eBPF-PATROL is an extensible lightweight runtime security agent . it detects and prevents real-time boundary violations, such as reverse shells, privilege escalation, and container escape attempts . the underlying technologies (i.e., containerization and virtualization) have become foundational . but strict isolation and maintaining runtime safety in these environments has become increasingly challenging .
label: ai

text: snap-fit assemblies require timely engagement detection and rapid force attenuation to prevent overshoot-induced component damage or assembly failure . first, we introduce SnapNet, a lightweight neural network that detects snapfit engagement from joint-velocity transients in real-time . second, we present a dynamical-systems-based dual-arm coordination framework that integrates SnapNet driven detection with an event-triggered impedance modulation .
label: ai

text: existing DUNs suffer from: (1) textbfDegradation-specific dependency . unfoldLDM uses a multi-granularity degradation-aware (MGDA) module as the gradient descent step . a degradation-resistant LDM (DR-LDM) extracts compact degradation-invariant priors from the MGDA output .
label: ai

text: VLMs require complex, queryable intelligence that on-board CNNs cannot provide . naive cloud offloading fails under low-bandwidth networks common in disaster zones . we present a framework that enables VLM deployment through adaptive split computing . the framework includes a cognitive-inspired dual-stream split that separates the VLM into a high-frequency, low-resolution "context stream" for real-time awareness .
label: ai

text: our results position GNNs as a practical surrogate for combinatorial graph invariants, with implications for scalable graph optimization and mathematical discovery . compared 2,000 random graphs with up to 64 vertices, GNNs achieve markedly higher accuracy ($R2=0.987$, MAE $=0.372$) than CNNs . both models offer substantial speedups over exact solvers, with gNNs delivering more than $200times$ acceleration while retaining near
label: ai

text: study introduce geeSanBhava, a high-quality data set of sinhala song comments extracted from YouTube manually tagged using Russells Valence-Arousal model . the human annotators achieve a substantial inter-annotator agreement (Fleiss kappa = 84.96%) the study also addressed the challenges of comparing comment-based and song-based emotions .
label: ai

text: CAPIRE intervention lab is an agent-based simulation environment designed to complement predictive models with in silico experimentation on curriculum and teaching policies . the model is calibrated on 1,343 students from 15 cohorts in a six-year programme with 34 courses and 12 simulated semesters . a 2x2x2 factorial design with 100 replications per scenario yields over 80,000 simulated trajectories .
label: ai

text: quantile residual and grid-refined HDR methods achieve empirical coverage close to the nominal 90% level and produce substantially narrower regions than the coordinate-floor approximation . results indicate conformal prediction on the simplex can be both calibrated and efficient, providing practical uncertainty quantification for compositional prediction tasks . a comprehensive Monte Carlo study spanning homoscedastic and heteroscedastic designs shows that the quantile residue and . grid-reddhr methods achieve empiric coverage close
label: ai

text: we propose Observer Actor (ObAct), a novel framework for active vision imitation learning . the observer arm constructs a 3D Gaussian Splatting (3DGS) representation from three images . obAct significantly outperforms static-camera setups: trajectory transfer improves by 145% without occlusion . behavior cloning improved by 75% and 143% respectively .
label: ai

text: WaveletMamba achieves 81.72% +/- 0.53% classification accuracy at 64x64 resolution with only 3.54M parameters . the framework exhibits resolution multistability, where models trained on low-resolution data achieve consistent accuracy across different input scales . we show that mathematical rigor enables unprecedented efficiency and comprehensive bias correction in scientific AI, bridging computer vision and astrophysics .
label: ai

text: multimodal learning has shown significant superiority on various tasks . but interdependencies between modalities increase susceptibility to adversarial attacks . existing methods mainly focus on attacks on specific modality or indiscriminately attack . a targeted regularization term is proposed that penalizes the vulnerability of each modality, guiding robust learning while maintaining task accuracy .
label: ai

text: reliance on dynamic pricing models in public cloud environments presents new challenges for workload scheduling and reliability . this work contributes to the modeling and evaluation of such environments by extending the CloudSim Plus simulation framework to support realistic spot instance lifecycle management, including interruption, termination, hibernation, and reallocation . the enhanced simulator is validated using synthetic scenarios and large-scale simulations based on the Google Cluster Trace dataset .
label: ai

text: existing methods for label-deficient concealed object segmentation (LDCOS) either rely on consistency constraints or SAM-based pseudo-labeling . however, their performance remains limited due to the intrinsic concealment of targets and the scarcity of annotations . we present a unified collaborative framework toward LDCOS that jointly optimize a mean-teacher segmenter and a learnable SAM .
label: ai

text: new advances in multimodal foundation models have propelled instruction-driven image generation and editing into a genuinely cross-modal, cooperative regime . however, state-of-the-art editing pipelines remain costly: beyond training large diffusion/flow models, they require curating massive high-quality triplets of instruction, source image, edited image . fidelity of visual replacements hinges on how precisely the instruction references the target semantics .
label: ai

text: SFHand is the first streaming framework for language-guided 3D hand forecasting . the framework combines a streaming autoregressive architecture with an ROI-enhanced memory layer . to enable this research, we also introduce EgoHaFL, the first large-scale dataset featuring synchronized 3-D hand poses and language instructions . SFhand achieves new state-of-the-art results, outperforming prior work by a significant margin of up to 35.8% .
label: ai

text: MIDAS is an adaptive middleware layer that operates transparently between clients and metadata servers . it reduces average queue lengths by roughly 23% and mitigates worst-case hotspots by up to 80% when compared to round-robin scheduling . a stability-aware, middleware-based strategy can provide backend-agnostic improvements to metadata management .
label: ai

text: bias is not localized to a few coordinates but is instead distributed across a handful of linear subspaces . we propose a geometrically principled framework that identifies and removes the entire subspace of linearly decodable bias while reinserting a neutral mean component to preserve semantic fidelity . the method achieves more robust debiasing with an average improvement of $18.5%$ across four fairness metrics .
label: ai

text: multimodal large language models excel on benchmarks, but their processing paradigm differs from the human ability to integrate visual information . models tend to treat these elements in isolation, overlooking their semantic and causal dependencies, which yields non-diagnostic results and obscures performance bottlenecks . we present VCU-Bridge, a framework that operationalizes a human-like hierarchy of visual connotation understanding .
label: ai

text: MVS-TTA is an efficient test-time adaptation framework that enhances the adaptability of learning-based MVS methods by bridging these two paradigms . the framework is model-agnostic and can be applied to a wide range of MVS method with minimal architectural changes . this is the first attempt to integrate optimization-based test time adaptation into learning-basing MVS using meta-learning.
label: ai

text: zero-shot Anomaly Detection (ZSAD) aims to identify and localize anomalous regions in images of unseen object classes . current approaches suffer from a representational bottleneck and are prone to overfitting on auxiliary data . $mathttPromptMoE$ learns a pool of expert prompts, which serve as a basis set of composable semantic primitives .
label: ai

text: Muskie is a native multi-view vision backbone designed for 3D vision tasks . compared with frame-wise backbones such as DINO, the model achieves higher multiview correspondence accuracy . we demonstrate that using the model as a backbone consistently enhances performance on downstream 3D tasks, including camera pose estimation and pointmap reconstruction . codes are publicly available at https://leo-frank.github.io/Muskie/ .
label: ai

text: AI agents leverage LLMs as their "brain" to autonomously perform actions via connected tools . this capability introduces significant risks that go far beyond those of harmful text presented in a chatbot . a compromised agent can deliberately abuse powerful tools to perform malicious actions, in many cases irreversible, and limited solely by the guardrails on the tools themselves . we test these agents against a suite of novel attacks developed specifically for agentic threats .
label: ai

text: embodied agents can interpret multimodal instructions and perform complex tasks . existing VLAs are mostly confined to short-horizon, table-top manipulation . they lack the memory and reasoning capability required for long-horizon mobile manipulation, where agents must coordinate navigation and manipulation under changing spatial contexts . in this work, we present EchoVLA, a memory-aware VLA model . based on current observations, task history, and instructions, the two memories are individually stored, updated, and retrieved .
label: ai

text: a novel framework for active learning (AL) in PDE surrogate modeling reduces this cost . the approach strategically generates only the most important time steps with the numerical solver . this dramatically reduces the cost incurred by each trajectory and thus allows the active learning algorithm to try out a more diverse set of trajectories given the same budget . our method reduces average error but also the 99%, 95% and 50% quantiles of error .
label: ai

text: modern transformer architectures achieve remarkable performance across tasks and domains . we present a novel capability: AdaPerceiver, the first transformer architecture with unified adaptivity across depth, width, and tokens within a single model . a policy can maintain ImageNet1K accuracy ($pm0.1$ percentage points) while reducing FLOPs by $24-33$% .
label: ai

text: existing methods focus on image-level forgery detection . consolidated multimodal detection algorithm, named MM-Det++, is designed for detecting diffusion-generated videos . the spatio-temporal branch employs a novel frame-Centric Vision Transformer (FC-ViT) to aggregate spatio-temporal information . in parallel, the Multimodal (MM) branch uses a learnable reasoning paradigm to acquire Multimodal Forgery Representation (MFR)
label: ai

text: labeled Markov Chains (or LMCs for short) are useful mathematical objects to model complex probabilistic languages . they can be framed as a discounted sum of finite-horizon Total Variation distances, making it an instance of discounted linear distance, but arising from the natural Cantor topology . in this work, we analyze the properties of the CK distance along three dimensions: computational complexity and continuity properties .
label: ai

text: current text-to-video models (T2V) can generate high-quality, temporally coherent, and visually realistic videos . errors still often occur, and are more nuanced and local compared to previous generation of T2V models . we generate 600 videos using 200 diverse textual prompts and three state-of-the-art video generators (Veo 3, Seedance, and LTX-2)
label: ai

text: the proposed method was applied to a configuration change scenario in a wide-area campus network at Shinshu university . as a result, all expected configuration procedures were obtained and a network exhibiting the intended behavior was successfully constructed . this paper proposes a method for automatically generating configuration procedures consisting of network device configuration commands based on network configurations and their modification specifications .
label: ai

text: this paper presents an empirical investigation into the capabilities of Large Language Models (LLMs) to perform automated attribute-based Access Control (ABAC) policy mining . the results highlight both the promise and limitations of current LLM architectures for scalable policy mining in access control domains . future work will explore hybrid approaches that combine prompt optimization with classical rule mining algorithms to improve scalability and interpretability .
label: ai

text: a rotatable antenna is able to dynamically adjust its deflection angle . it is capable of achieving better physical layer security performance for wireless communications . in this paper, we investigate the average secrecy rate maximization problem . the optimal solution can be found by the bisection search . based on the closed-form near optimal solution, we obtain the system secrety outage probability at high signal-to-noise ratio (SNR)
label: ai

text: predictive control approaches based on deep reinforcement learning (DRL) have gained significant attention in microgrid energy optimization . however, existing research often overlooks the issue of uncertainty stemming from imperfect prediction models . a new error temporal difference algorithm for DRL is presented to address the uncertainty in predictions, aiming to improve the performance of microgrider operations .
label: ai

text: a structured, white-box approach based on Event-Chain Modeling addresses these timing challenges . the approach enables the derivation, modeling, and validation of end-to-end timing constraints at the architectural level . a detailed case study shows how this approach enhances regulatory compliance, optimizes system design, and supports model-based safety analysis techniques .
label: ai

text: perceptual image super-resolution (SR) methods restore degraded images and produce sharp outputs . in practice, those outputs are usually recompressed for storage and transmission . the downstream codec might add additional artifacts to restored images . however, the codecs are not differentiable and vary in configuration . first, we formulate compression as conditional text-to-image generation and use a pre-trained diffusion model to build a generalizable codec simulator .
label: ai

text: multi-modal survival analysis focuses on alignment and distinctiveness . preserving modality-specific structure is as vital as achieving semantic coherence . together stage minimizes semantic discrepancies by aligning embeddings via shared prototypes . extensive experiments on five TCGA benchmarks show that TTA consistently outperforms state-of-the-art methods .
label: ai

text: the framework integrates motor electrical dynamics, motor-winch dynamics, and continuum robot dynamics into a coherent system model . motor signals such as current and angular displacement are modeled to expose the electromechanical signatures of external interactions . the model captures and validates key physical behaviors of the real system including actuation hysteresis and self-contact at motion limits .
label: ai

text: swarms are a key advancement in autonomous systems, enabling coordinated missions through inter-UAV communication . but their reliance on wireless links makes them vulnerable to jamming, which can disrupt coordination and mission success . a unified optimization framework is proposed combining geneticalgorithms (GA), supervised learning (SL) and Reinforcement Learning (RL)
label: ai

text: VLA models leverage massive pretraining data to support diverse manipulation tasks . existing continual learning methods are also resource-intensive to scale to VLA model . TS-Stellar excels in complex action inference and in-depth analyses verify effective knowledge retention and discovery . we propose Stellar VLA, a knowledge-driven continuul learning framework with two variants: T-stellar, modeling task-centric knowledge space .
label: ai

text: we systematically evaluate four alignment strategies using more than 8,000 infertility treatment records . GRPO achieves the highest algorithmic accuracy across multiple decision layers . clinicians consistently prefer the SFT model, citing clearer reasoning processes and higher therapeutic feasibility . findings highlight the need for alignment strategies that prioritize clinically interpretable and practically feasible reasoning, rather than solely optimizing decision-level accuracy .
label: ai

text: EMFE pipeline is a transparent, reproducible, and low compute machine learning approach tailored explicitly for simple cell morphology . the study used the NIH Malaria Cell Images dataset, with two features extracted from each cell image . logistic Regression and Random Forest achieved a test accuracy of 94.80 percent with a file size of 1.2 kB and negligible inference latency (2.3 ms)
label: ai

text: ActDistill is a self-derived distillation framework that transfers the action prediction capability of any existing VLA model to a lightweight counterpart . the student model, derived from the graph-encapsulated teacher, is further equipped with a dynamic router that adaptively selects computation paths based on action prediction demands . a graph-structured encapsulation strategy is introduced to explicitly model the hierarchical evolution of action prediction .
label: ai

text: a pre-trained conditional latent diffusion surrogate model captures the stochastic dynamics of underwater acoustic communication channels . the model produces diverse and statistically realistic channel realizations, while supporting conditional generation from specific measurement samples . we propose a scalable, data-efficient, and physically consistent model for both system design and machine learning-driven underwater applications .
label: ai

text: research proposes an enhancement to the innovative portfolio optimization approach using the GIRL algorithm . the goal is to maximize portfolio value by a target date while minimizing the investor's periodic contributions . we improved the Sharpe Ratio from 0.42, as suggested by recent studies using the same approach, to a value of 0.483 a notable achievement in highly volatile markets with diversified portfolios .
label: ai

text: open-vocabulary aerial object detection (OVAD) leverages the zero-shot capabilities of visual-language models to generalize from base to novel categories . existing approaches typically utilize self-learning mechanisms with weak text supervision to generate region-level pseudo-labels to align detectors with semantic spaces . but text dependence induces semantic bias, restricting open expression to text-specified concepts .
label: ai

text: class imbalance (CI) remains a fundamental challenge in FL, where rare but critical classes are often severely underrepresented in individual client datasets . pFedBBN supports fully unsupervised local adaptation and introduces a class-aware model aggregation strategy that enables personalized inference without compromising privacy . it addresses both distribution shifts and class imbalance through balanced feature normalization, without requiring labeled or raw data from clients .
label: ai

text: AIS is a critical premalignant lesion whose accurate diagnosis is challenging . early detection is essential to prevent progression to invasive cervical adenocarcinoma . we developed a virtual pathology assistant capable of distinguishing AIS from normal cervical gland histology . all images underwent Macenko stain normalization and patch-based preprocessing to enhance morphological feature representation .
label: ai

text: waterstein-Fisher-Rao (FR) gradient flows have been proposed as a powerful sampling tool . existing algorithmic developments implicitly make use of operator splitting techniques to numerically approximate the WFR partial differential equation . this works investigates the impact of the order in which the W and FR operator are evaluated and aims to provide a quantitative analysis .
label: ai

text: the performance of deep learning models in remote sensing (RS) strongly depends on the availability of high-quality labeled data . however, collecting large-scale annotations is costly and time-consuming, while vast amounts of unlabeled imagery remain underutilized . the code will be released at https://github.com/zhu-xlab/RS-SSAL .
label: ai

text: traditional methods, including linkage approaches, face three major limitations . they always return a hierarchy, even if none exists, and are restricted to binary trees . in particular, the finest valid hierarchy is not constrained to binary structures and, when no hierarchical relationships exist, collapses to a star tree . we propose a simple two-step algorithm that first constructs a binary tree via a linkage method and then prunes it to enforce validity .
label: ai

text: text-driven image editing is characterized by simultaneously conditioning on both text and a source image . previous methods tend to solely focus on text-image alignment or have not well aligned with human perception . IE-Critic-R1, benefiting from Reinforcement Learning from Verifiable Rewards (RLVR), provides more comprehensive and explainable quality assessment .
label: ai

text: high-quality training data is fundamental to large language model (LLM) performance . but existing preprocessing pipelines often struggle to effectively remove noise and unstructured content from web-scale corpora . the pipeline processes CC WARC dumps, implementing advanced filtering and quality assessment mechanisms . results show Blu-WERP consistently achieved superior performance across all model scales .
label: ai

text: applying voltage pulses of alternating polarities across a resistive switching memory device induces a finite number of fixed-point attractors . dynamical attractors can be used to program analog values into the device state without supervision . the proposed energy minimization strategy is applied to the voltage threshold adaptive memristor model, known for its predictive capability and adaptability to fit a large number of resistance switching memory devices .
label: ai

text: online method proposes an online Sparse Kalman Identification (SKI) method . it integrates the Augmented Kalman Filter (AKF) and Automatic Relevance Determination (ARD) the method achieves accurate model structure selection with millisecond-level efficiency and higher identification accuracy, as demonstrated by extensive simulations and real-world experiments . the ARD method is a theoretically grounded Bayesian sparsification scheme that is seamlessly integrated into the AKF framework and adapted to sequentially collected data in online
label: ai

text: ultraFlux, a flux-based DiT trained natively at 4K on multiAspect-4K-1M, combines a 1M-image 4K corpus with controlled multi-AR coverage, bilingual captions, and rich VLM/IQA metadata . ultraflux consistently outperforms strong open-source baselines across fidelity, aesthetic, and alignment metrics, and-with a LLM prompt refiner-matches .
label: ai

text: mmWave networks have the potential to support high throughput and low-latency requirements of 5G-and-beyond communication standards . but transmissions in this band are highly vulnerable to attenuation and blockages from humans, buildings, and foliage . this work designs dynamic scheduling policies that minimize end-to-end packet delays while keeping packet transmission costs low .
label: ai

text: we introduce SPINRec (Stochastic Path Integration for Neural Recommender Explanations), a model-agnostic approach that adapts path-integration techniques to the sparse and implicit nature of recommendation data . the design captures the influence of both observed and unobserved interactions, yielding more stable and personalized explanations .
label: ai

text: despite proliferation of IoT security guidelines, a unified and quantitative approach to measuring trust remains absent . the framework employs a six-tier grading model (Grades A-F) enabling device profiling across consumer, industrial, and critical infrastructure domains . each test is assigned a criticality-based weight (1.0-2.0) and a performance rating (1-4)
label: ai

text: fine-tuned models preserve the geometric structure of their loss landscapes concerning harmful content . this suggests that safety behaviors are not erased but shifted to less influential regions of the parameter space . we propose a curvature-aware alignment restoration method that leverages influence functions and second-order optimization to selectively increase loss on harmful inputs while preserving task performance .
label: ai

text: MASTEST system combines LLM-based and programmed agents to form a complete tool chain that covers the whole workflow of API test starting from generating unit and system test scenarios . the system supports the incorporation of human testers in reviewing and correcting LLM generated test artefacts to ensure the quality of testing activities . both DeepSeek and deepSeek achieved a high overall performance .
label: ai

text: event frame hybrid sensors integrate an Active Pixel Sensor (APS) and an Event Vision Sensor (EVS) within a single chip . the complex circuit architecture introduces non-trivial noise patterns that remain poorly understood and unmodeled . in this work, we present the first unified, statistics-based imaging noise model that jointly describes the noise behavior of APS and EVS pixels .
label: ai

text: paper2SysArch is the first of its kind, designed to catalyze progress in automated scientific visualization . it consists of 3,000 research papers paired with their corresponding high-quality ground-truth diagrams . to validate its performance on complex cases, the system was evaluated on a manually curated subset of these papers, where it achieves a composite score of 69.0 .
label: ai

text: we combine a compartmental epidemic model with sequential Bayesian inference and reinforcement learning (RL) controllers that adaptively choose intervention levels to balance disease burden against socio economic costs . we construct a context specific cost function using empirical experiments and expert feedback . the framework is validated by fitting the epidemic model to publicly available ICU occupancy data from the COVID 19 pandemic in England .
label: ai

text: a selection-honest framework for hierarchical thresholding makes patient-level decisions reproducible and more defensible . the framework is model-agnostic, reconciles heterogeneous decision rules on a quantile scale, and yields monotone-invariant ensembles and reportable diagnostics (e.g. flip-rate, operating-point shift).
label: ai

text: image super-resolution (SR) is a critical technology for overcoming the inherent hardware limitations of sensors . existing approaches focus on directly enhancing the final resolution, often neglecting effective control over error propagation and accumulation during intermediate stages . compared to existing sequence models, we created a nonlinear state predictive control model textbfMambaX that maps consecutive spectral bands into a latent state space .
label: ai

text: a simple approach uses one error-correcting code per DNA strand . current technology can only synthesize strands 200--300 nucleotides long . at this block length, the inner code rate suffers a finite-length penalty, making its effective capacity hard to characterize . the idea is to combat deletion errors and show two more advantages of Geno-Weaving .
label: ai

text: correlated-sequence Differential Privacy (CSDP) is a framework specifically designed for preserving privacy in correlated sequential data . CSDP addresses two linked challenges: quantifying extra information an attacker gains from joint temporal links, adding just enough noise to hide that information while keeping the data useful . we build the Freshness-Regulated Adaptive Noise (FRAN) mechanism--combining data aging and correlation-aware sensitivity scaling .
label: ai

text: a method for extracting emphmonosemantic neurons from user and item embeddings in recommender systems . our approach employs a Sparse Autoencoder (SAE) to reveal semantic structure within pretrained representations . resulting neurons capture properties such as genre, popularity, and temporal trends, and support post hoc control operations including targeted filtering and content promotion .
label: ai

text: this work explores Liquid Time-Constant Networks and Closed-form Continuous-time Networks . both architectures achieved lower MAE, faster convergence, smaller model sizes, and favorable query times . their efficiency and adaptability make them well suited for scenarios with limited data and frequent retraining, such as edge deployments in vision prosthetics.
label: ai

text: a key indicator of retention is revisitation, i.e., when users return to view previously saved content, a behavior often sparked by personalized recommendations and user satisfaction . however, modeling and optimizing revisitation poses significant challenges . the scale and timing of revisitations introduce further complexity; users may revisit content days or even weeks after their initial interaction, requiring the system to maintain extensive historical records across millions of users .
label: ai

text: open-Vocabulary Object Detection (OVOD) aims to generalize object recognition to novel categories . WS-OVOD extends this by combining box-level annotations with image-level labels . existing semantic prototypes, even when enriched by LLMs, are static and limited, failing to capture intra-class visual variations induced by different object states .
label: ai

text: road markings and urban traffic systems are a typical example of fine-grained spatial elements under urban scenarios . this benchmark includes six tasks consisting of 9,121 strictly manually verified test cases . roadbench is a systematic benchmark that tests MLLMs' capabilities in recognition, joint understanding, and reasoning . in certain tasks, their performance even falls short of simple rule-based or random selection baselines .
label: ai

text: longitudinal medical imaging active learning (LMI-AL) is tailored to longitudinal medical imaging . it requires labeling across various time points, where new lesions can be minor, and subtle changes are easily missed . the code is publicly available at https://github.com/HelenMa9998/Longitududinal_AL .
label: ai

text: this paper presents the first theoretical framework to analyze private training through a feature learning perspective . using a two-layer CNN with polynomial ReLU activation, we theoretically characterize both feature signal learning and data noise memorization in private training via noisy gradient descent . our findings highlight the challenges of private learning and prove the benefit of feature enhancement to improve SNR .
label: ai

text: RAISECity is a promising foundation for applications in immersive media, embodied intelligence, and world models . existing methods face significant challenges regarding quality, fidelity, and scalability in 3D world generation . we introduce an agentic framework that leverages diverse multimodal foundation tools to acquire real-world knowledge, maintain robust intermediate representations, and construct complex 3D scenes .
label: ai

text: large language models (LLMs) have recently demonstrated strong potential for automated program repair (APR) but existing techniques rely on coarse-grained external feedback to guide iterative patch generation . this limitation often leads to inefficient refinement, error propagation, and suboptimal repair performance . tokenRepair integrates internal reflection for localizing potentially faulty tokens with external feedback .
label: ai

text: ContagionRL integrates a spatial SIRS+D epidemiological model with configurable environmental parameters . we evaluate five distinct reward designs, ranging from sparse survival bonuses to a novel potential field approach, across multiple RL algorithms . our comprehensive evaluation across varying infection rates, grid sizes, visibility constraints, and movement patterns reveals reward function choice dramatically impacts agent behavior and survival outcomes .
label: ai

text: prior theoretical work focused primarily on the prefix-sum workload . correlated noise, in particular via matrix factorizations, has been shown to improve accuracy . we propose a learning-rate-aware factorization that achieves improvements over prefix .sum factorization . our theoretical analysis yields memory-efficient constructions suitable for practical deployment, and experiments on CIFAR-10 and IMDB datasets confirm that schedule-a-ware factorizes improve accuracy in private training .
label: ai

text: a novel approach inspired by multi-stage image restoration is proposed . SD-PSFNet employs a sequential restoration architecture with three cascaded stages . the network uses components with learned PSF mechanisms to dynamically simulate rain streak optics, enabling effective rain-background separation while progressively enhancing outputs through novel PSF components at each stage . a model achieves state-of-the-art PSNR/SSIM metrics on Rain100H (33.12dB/0.9371), RealR
label: ai

text: the inconsistency issue in the VINS is a long-standing and fundamental challenge . these analyses are often based on simplified theoretical formulations that consider only prediction and SLAM correction . such formulations fail to cover the non-standard estimation steps, such as MSCKF correction and delayed initialization, which are critical for practical VINS estimators . current approaches often face a trade-off between estimator accuracy, consistency, and implementation complexity .
label: ai

text: existing benchmarks focus primarily on knowledge-based assessment and thus fall short of sufficiently reflecting social interactions and strategic dialogue capabilities . this work proposes a methodology to quantitatively evaluate the human emotional and behavioral imitation and strategic decision-making capabilities of LLMs by employing a Buy and Sell negotiation simulation . some models exhibit diminished performance in scenarios emphasizing emotional or social contexts, suggesting that the assigned persona can lead to significant variations in negotiation strategies and results .
label: ai

text: multi-domain graph pre-training has emerged as a pivotal technique in developing graph foundation models . its privacy risks under membership inference attacks (MIAs) remain largely unexplored . effectively conducting MIAs is a significant challenge due to: (i) Enhanced Generalization Capability: Multi-domain pre-train reduces the overfitting characteristics commonly exploited by MIA .
label: ai

text: this paper proposes a novel hybrid architecture, HyM-UNet, designed to synergize the local feature extraction capabilities of CNNs with the efficient global modeling capabilities of Mamba . Specifically, we design a Hierarchical Encoder that uses convolutional modules in the shallow stages to preserve high-frequency texture details . to bridge the semantic gap between the encoder and the decoder, we propose a Mamba-Guided Fusion Skip Connection (MGF-Skip)
label: ai

text: current methods for editing pre-trained models face significant challenges . task arithmetic has recently emerged as a promising solution . we introduce the notion of difference vector, a generalized form of task vectors derived from the historical movements during optimization . by using difference vectors as directed perturbations, we propose the difference vector-based anisotropic Scaling Iterative algorithm (DV-BASI) to enable a continuous optimization process without relying on additional modules or components .
label: ai

text: plan-X explicitly enforces high-level semantic planning to instruct video generation process . a semantic planner is a learnable multimodal language model that reasons over the user's intent from both text prompts and visual context . the framework effectively integrates the strength of language models in multimodal in-context reasoning and planning, together with the strongest diffusion models in photorealistic video synthesis .
label: ai

text: ART-based topological clustering algorithm adjusts its recalculation interval and vigilance threshold through a diversity-driven adaptation mechanism . this mechanism enables hyperparameter-free learning that maintains cluster stability and continuity in dynamic environments . the proposed algorithm outperforms state-of-the-art methods in both clustering performance and continual learning capability .
label: ai

text: Graph Foundation Models (GFMs) are pre-trained on diverse source domains . they are adapted to unseen targets, enabling broad generalization for graph machine learning . a compromised GFM can introduce backdoor behaviors into downstream applications, posing serious security risks . but launching backdoor attacks against GFMs is non-trivial due to three key challenges .
label: ai

text: we revisit the reconstruction behavior of diffusion models during denoising . we propose FeRA, a frequency driven fine tuning framework that aligns parameter updates with the intrinsic frequency energy progression of diffusion . FeRA provides a simple, stable, and compatible paradigm for effective and robust diffusion model adaptation . the underlying frequency energy mechanism governing this process is based on a reconstructed model model .
label: ai

text: existing forecasting techniques are limited by lack of combined robust anomaly mitigation solutions and data privacy preservation . proposed framework integrates three key innovations: LSTM autoencoder-based distributed anomaly detection deployed at each federated client, interpolation-based anomalous data mitigation to preserve temporal continuity . the proposed framework enables enhanced EV infrastructure planning, privacy-preserving collaborative forecasting, and rapid recovery from malicious threats across distributed charging networks .
label: ai

text: the state of practice is to have _natural language_ specifications, from which test cases are derived manually . _Formal_ specifications are well-suited for automated test generation, but are tedious to write and maintain . in this work, we propose a two-stage pipeline that uses large language models (LLMs) to bridge the gap: 1. it produces an _inspectable specification_ that preserves traceability to the original text; 2. the generation of actual test cases _no longer requires an LLM_
label: ai

text: the measured relative entropy and measured Rényi relative etropy are quantifiers of the distinguishability of two quantum states $$ and $ $ . they have interpretations in terms of asymptotic quantum hypothesis testing . in this paper, we establish foundational properties of these objective functions by analyzing their matrix gradients and Hessian superoperators .

text: realistic image super-resolution (SR) focuses on transforming real-world low resolution images into high resolution (HR) ones . this is critical for applications like surveillance, medical imaging, and consumer electronics . current methods struggle with limited real LR-HR data, impacting the learning of basic image features . in this paper, we introduce a novel approach, dual-domain Adaptation Networks, which is able to efficiently adapt pre-trained image SR models from simulated to real .
label: ai

text: we present a distortion-aware BEV segmentation framework that directly processes multi-camera high-resolution fisheye images using calibrated geometric unprojection and per-pixel depth distribution estimation . each image pixel is lifted into 3D space via Gaussian parameterization, predicting spatial means and anisotropic covariances to explicitly model geometric uncertainty . Extensive experiments demonstrate strong segmentation performance on complex parking and urban driving scenarios .
label: ai

text: SPECTRE is a fully transformer-based foundation model for volumetric computed tomography (CT) the framework optimizes a local transformer for high-resolution volumetric feature extraction and a global transformer for whole-scan context modeling . the framework combines DINO-style self-distillation with SigLIP-based vision-language alignment using paired radiology reports .
label: ai

text: neo-Davidsonian event semantics proposes an event-centric alternative that represents conversational history as short, event-like propositions . our design aims to preserve information in a non-compressive form and make it more accessible, rather than more lossy . we build two simple retrieval-based variants that use dense similarity search and LLM filtering .
label: ai

text: SING3R-SLAM is a globally consistent and compact Gaussian-based dense RGB SLAM framework . the key idea is to combine locally consistent 3D reconstructions with a unified global representation that refines scene geometry and camera poses . this global map, in turn, provides feedback to correct local drift and enhance the robustness of tracking, resulting in over 12% improvement in tracking and producing finer, detailed geometry .
label: ai

text: existing layer pruning methods struggle to simultaneously address key practical deployment challenges . namespace introduces two key innovations: a differentiable mask optimization method using a Gumbel-TopK sampler . the method achieves 96% accuracy, a mere 0.8% drop from the original model (96.8%) on MATH-500 when pruning 25% layers of Qwen3-32B .
label: ai

text: the Segment Anything Model (SAM) offers strong zero-shot priors and has been widely fine-tuned across downstream tasks . this paper demonstrates that the SAM paradigm is highly promising once its computational efficiency and performance can be balanced . we then propose Continual alignment for SAM (CA-SAM), a continual learning strategy that automatically adapts the appropriate Alignment Layer to mitigate catastrophic forgetting .
label: ai

text: surface electromyography (sEMG) provides vital insights into muscle function . but it can be noisy and challenging to acquire . a deep learning approach was developed to map the IMU data to the signal . the model successfully predicts the timing and general shape of muscle activations . it is possible to use this method in applications such as prosthetics and rehabilitation biofeedback .
label: ai

text: a general VLA model with 4D awareness for spatiotemporally coherent robotic manipulation is proposed . the model is guided by two key designs: 1) 4D-aware visual representation . we extract visual features, embed 1D time into 3D positions for 4D embeddings, and fuse them into a unified visual representation via a cross-attention mechanism .
label: ai

text: HTAM moves beyond emulating social roles, instead structuring multi-agent systems into a logical hierarchy that mirrors the intrinsic task-dependency graph of a given domain . this task-centric architecture thus enforces procedural correctness and decomposes complex problems into sequential layers . to evaluate such complex planning capabilities, we build geoplan-bench, a comprehensive benchmark of realistic, multi-step planning tasks .
label: ai

text: noise modeling methods can fit noise distributions to generate synthetic HSIs to train denoising networks . this decoupling reduces the complexity of noise and enhances the learnability of hsi denoising methods when applied to real paired data . a multi-stage learning strategy, comprising separate pre-training and joint fine-tuning, is employed to optimize the entire framework .
label: ai

text: we identify a high-gain region in the residual stream where small, well-aligned perturbations are causally amplified along the autoregressive trajectory . we exploit this as an attack surface via Sensitivity-Scaled Steering (SSS) across multiple open-weight models and four behavioral axes, SSS induces large shifts in evil, hallucination, sycophancy, and sentiment .
label: ai

text: every $n$-vertex $K_t,t$-free graph of average degree $d$ contains an independent set of size $(n log d / d)$ . the largest class of graphs for which this was previously known was established by Alon, Krivelevich, and Sudakov in 1999 . we prove the conjecture for all 3-colorable graphs $F$, i.e., subgraphs of $k_1,t,
label: ai

text: textbfAutoLink is an autonomous agent framework that reformulates schema linking as an iterative, agent-driven process . autoLink dynamically explores and expands the linked schema subset, progressively identifying necessary components without inputting the full database schema . existing methods incur prohibitive costs, struggle to trade off recall and noise, and scale poorly to large databases .
label: ai

text: post-capture editing methods suffer from suboptimal camera motion injection strategies . a query-shared cross-attention module can extract underlying motion cues . postCam outperforms state-of-the-art methods by over 20% in camera control precision and view consistency, while achieving the highest video generation quality . our project webpage is publicly available at: https://cccqaq.github.io/PostCam.gr/ .
label: ai

text: traditional methods typically rely on statistical features like term frequencies or TF-IDF values, which are effective at capturing word-level importance but often fail to reflect contextual meaning . modern deep learning approaches utilize semantic features to understand word usage within context, yet they may overlook simple, high-impact statistical indicators . the model demonstrates superior performance compared to both traditional statistical models and purely semantic deep learning models .
label: ai

text: INTSD is a large-scale dataset of street-level night-time images of traffic signboards collected across diverse regions of India . the dataset spans 41 traffic signs class captured under varying lighting and weather conditions, providing a comprehensive benchmark for both detection and classification tasks . we propose an adaptive image enhancement detector for joint illumination correction and sign localization, followed by a structured multimodal CLIP-GCNN classifier .
label: ai

text: this article uses a calibrated agent-based model to examine how alternative progression regimes reconfigure dropout, time-to-degree, equity and students' psychological experience in a long, tightly sequenced engineering programme . the model is empirically calibrated to reproduce the observed dropout curve under Scenario A and then used to explore counterfactuals . results show that direct promotion creates a "promotion wall"
label: ai

text: self-supervised representations excel at many vision and speech tasks . but their potential for audio-visual deepfake detection remains underexplored . we systematically evaluate them across modalities (audio, video, multimodal) and domains (lip movements, generic visual content) . a lack of detection effectiveness, interpretability of encoded information, and cross-modal complementarity remains elusive .
label: ai

text: the cumulative environmental footprint generated during large-scale service operations has received comparatively less attention . to bridge this gap this study conducts a scoping review of methodologies and research trends in AI carbon footprint assessment . we identify how multidimensional factors such as model size, prompt complexity, serving environments, and system boundary definition shape the resulting carbon footprint . the paper provides a baseline guideline for researchers seeking to understand the environmental implications of AI across technical, social, and operational dimensions .
label: ai

text: black-box optimization suffers from low sampling efficiency and takes considerable sampling iterations to obtain good solutions . this method enables more efficient exploration of design solutions and discuss its characteristics and limitations . in this study, we propose a method to enhance the efficiency of robot body design by utilizing large language models (LLMs), which are provided with problem settings and extensive feedback .
label: ai

text: deterministic models such as FuXi, GraphCast, and SFNO have achieved competitive forecast skill relative to numerical weather prediction . but their ability to represent uncertainty and capture extremes is still limited . results show that flow dependent perturbations produce the most realistic ensemble spread and highest probabilistic skill, narrowing but not closing the performance gap with numerical weather forecast ensembles .
label: ai

text: $textbfFireScope-Bench$ is a large-scale dataset and benchmark that couples Sentinel-2 imagery and climate data with expert-defined risk rasters across the u.s. and real wildfire events in Europe for cross-continental evaluation . the framework combines reinforcement learning and visual supervision to predict risks with complementary reasoning traces .
label: ai

text: aspect-Based Causal Abstention (ABCA) enables early abstention by analysing the internal diversity of LLM knowledge through causal inference . ABCA estimates causal effects conditioned on these aspects to assess the reliability of knowledge relevant to a given query . experiments on standard benchmark benchmarks demonstrate that ABCA improves reliability and achieves state-of-the-art performance .
label: ai

text: our approach advances the existing literature in two important respects . first, we consider the problem under privacy constraints . second, we are interested in determining whether certain pairwise associations between the components do not exceed a given threshold in absolute value . the formulation of the null hypothesis as a composite hypothesis makes the problem of constructing tests already non-standard in the non-private setting .
label: ai

text: reflective reflections of active markers in the environment are common source of ambiguity in onboard visual relative localization . it operates without prior knowledge of robot size or predefined marker configurations and remains independent of surface properties . the approach is an essential feature for heterogeneous micro-aerial swarms cooperating in unknown environments . a particular focus is on dynamic water surfaces, particularly relevant for marine deployments .
label: ai

text: intrinsic reward methods have demonstrated effectiveness in single-agent rein-forcement learning scenarios . the primary difficulties stem from two fac-tors: (1) the exponential sparsity of joint action trajectories that lead to rewards as the exploration space expands .
