(2) existing methods often fail to account for joint actions that can influence team states . to address these challenges, this paper introduces Mutual Intrinsic Reward (MIR), a simple yet effective enhancement strategy for MARL with extremely sparse rewards .
label: ai

text: formal BDI Ontology is conceived as a modular ontology design pattern . it captures the cognitive architecture of agents through beliefs, desires, intentions, and their dynamic interrelations . the ontological ensures semantic precision and reusability by aligning with foundational ontologies and best practices in modular design . two complementary lines of experimentation demonstrate its applicability .
label: ai

text: this paper describes the instruction dataset used to fine-tune a set of transformer-based large language models (LLMs) developed in the PLLuM (Polish Large Language Model) project . we present a functional typology of the organic, converted, and synthetic instruction datasets used in . the linguistic adaptation of base LLMs and release the first representative subset of the PLLuMIC .
label: ai

text: patients with BC treated by neoadjuvant chemotherapy were included in this retrospective observational single-center study . MR studies were described using the standardized BI-RADS and breast edema score on T2-weighted MRI . random forest classifiers were trained to predict pCR on a random split including 70% of the database and were validated on the remaining cases .
label: ai

text: every graph obtained from a bipartite graph by iteratively splitting vertices into two adjacent twins has the de Bruijn-Erds property . the property is the property of a de bruijn-erd's twins . if you have a similar property, you can use the property to create a graph .
label: ai

text: the appearance of ultrasound images varies across acquisition devices . this degrades the performance of fixed black-box downstream inference models . existing UIT approaches often overlook class-specific semantic alignment during domain adaptation, resulting in misaligned content-class mappings . UI-Styler leverages a pattern-matching mechanism to transfer texture patterns embedded in the target images onto source images while preserving the source structural content .
label: ai

text: automatic post-editing (APE) aims to correct errors in machine-translated text . despite advances in neural machine translation, development of effective APE systems has been hindered by lack of large-scale multilingual datasets specifically tailored to NMT outputs . the dataset has 206,983 triplets, with each triplet consisting of a source segment, its NMT input, and a human post-edited translation .
label: ai

text: a faithful cartesian club determines a notion of structured multicategory . the different notions obtained in this way give different concepts of polynomial over an applicative system . we obtain the classical characterisation of combinatory algebras as a specific instance, which in turn give different notion .  Less than a quarter of a million cartesian clubs have been able to find a way to get a sense of combining completeness .
label: ai

text: generative methods, such as diffusion models, learn the underlying distribution of future motion, enabling more flexible trajectory prediction . this paper proposes a novel two-stage trajectory prediction framework . the first stage uses a transformer-based Proposal Decoder to generate coarse trajectory predictions by regressing from sensor inputs using predefined trajectory anchors . second stage applies a Diffusion Refiner that iteratively denoises and refines these initial predictions .
label: ai

text: DMG-YOLO is a lightweight real-time detector tailored for small object detection in remote sensing images . we design a dual-branch Feature Extraction (DFE) module in the backbone, which partitions feature maps into two parallel branches . the module extracts local features via depthwise separable convolutions, and the other captures global context using a vision transformer .
label: ai

text: traditional loss functions in medical image segmentation often under-segment small lesions because their small relative volume contributes negligibly to the overall loss . CC-DiceCE loss increases detection (recall) with minimal to no degradation in segmentation performance, albeit at the cost of slightly more false positives . the nnU-Net framework provides a robust and standardized setup .
label: ai

text: multi-step diffusion-based real-world image super-resolution (Real-ISR) suffer from fidelity and controllability simultaneously . one-step methods lose control flexibility due to fidelity-specific finetuning . a new visual stream receives low-quality images (LQ) with adjustable noise (Control Noise), and the original visual streams receives LQs with consistent noise (Prior Noise)
label: ai

text: device-guided music transfer adapts playback across unseen devices . existing methods focus on modifying the timbre, rhythm, harmony, or instrumentation to mimic genres or artists . deMT processes a speaker's frequency response curve as a line graph using a vision-language model to extract device embeddings . this then condition a hybrid transformer via feature-wise linear modulation .
label: ai

text: multi-stage optimization framework to bridge the gap between high-performance floating-point models and efficient, hardware-friendly integer-based implementations . we propose a Dynamic Range-Aware Quantization (DRAQ) method that uses statistically-calibrated activation clipping and a novel weight regularization scheme to counteract the effects of extreme data outliers and large dynamic ranges, successfully creating an 8-bit integer model .
label: ai

text: long-term satellite-based LST records are essential for detecting climate trends . but coarse spatial resolution of AVHRR's global area coverage data limit their utility for analyzing fine-scale permafrost dynamics and other surface processes in the Arctic . resulting dataset provides twice-daily, 1 km LST observations for the entire pan-Arctic region over four decades .
label: ai

text: traditional in-camera colorimetric mapping relies on correlated color temperature (CCT)-based interpolation between pre-calibrated transforms optimized for Planckian illuminants such as CIE A and D65 . however, modern lighting technologies such as LEDs can deviate substantially from the Planeckian locus . a lightbox-based calibration procedure incorporating representative LED sources is used to train our MLP .
label: ai

text: UI-CUBE (UiPath Computer Use BEnchmark) is a systematic benchmark . it includes 226 tasks across two difficulty tiers . UI interactions achieve 67-85% success rates compared to 97.9% human performance . complex workflows drop precipitously to 9-19%; human evaluators achieve only 61.2% on complex tasks .
label: ai

text: text representation plays a critical role in tasks like clustering, retrieval, and other downstream applications . most of the LLMs are inherently causal and optimized for next-token prediction, making them suboptimal for producing holistic representations . a well-designed compression objective can significantly enhance LLM-based text representations, outperforming models trained with token-level pretext tasks .
label: ai

text: we report on the first large-scale mixture-of-experts (MoE) pretraining study on pure AMD hardware, utilizing both MI300X GPUs with Pollara interconnect . we deliver a comprehensive cluster and networking characterization: microbenchmarks for all core collectives (all-reduce, reduce-scatter, all-gather, broadcast) across message sizes and GPU counts on Pollara .
label: ai

text: lens library pre-training (LensLib-PT) pipeline offers new avenue for blind aberration correction by training a universal neural network . aims to improve data scalability by increasing the degradation diversity of the lens source . we propose the Latent PSF Representation (LPR) which is assisted by modeling the optical degradation process to constrain learning of degradation priors .
label: ai

text: method trains an LLM to emulate observed decisions . then evaluates counterfactual pairs in which only gender is flipped . method validates the approach on more than 150,000 admissions to the Bordeaux University Hospital (France) and replicating results on a subset of MIMIC-IV across a different language, population, and healthcare system . the approach supports bias audits in other settings (e.g., hiring, academic, and justice decisions)
label: ai

text: a layer-aware MAC energy model combines per-layer activation statistics with an MSB-Hamming distance grouping of 22-bit partial sum transitions . we introduce an energy accuracy co-optimized weight selection algorithm within quantization aware training and an energy-prioritized layer-wise schedule that compresses high energy layers more aggressively under a global accuracy constraint .
label: ai

text: performance anomaly detectors are important to optimize trade-off between performance and cost . achieving high precision and a high recall is not always necessary . but if the detector is run infrequently, recall becomes the most important . the results show that achieving a . high precision is enough to obtain a good performance-to-cost tradeoff .
label: ai

text: constant-size cryptographic evidence structures are a general abstraction for representing verifiable audit evidence for AI workflows in regulated environments . each evidence item is a fixed-size tuple of cryptographic fields, designed to (i) provide strong binding to workflow events and configurations . we define syntax and algorithms for evidence structures and articulate security goals such as audit integrity and non-equivocation .
label: ai

text: we propose PEGS, a framework that integrates Physical priors with Event stream enhancement within a 3D Gaussian Splatting pipeline . we introduce a cohesive triple-level supervision scheme that enforces physical plausibility via an acceleration constraint, leverages event streams for high-temporal resolution guidance, and employ a Kalman regularizer to fuse multi-source observations .
label: ai

text: network intrusion Detection Systems (NIDS) are essential tools for detecting network attacks and intrusions . existing public datasets have limited and/or outdated attacks, and many suffer from mislabelled data . to reduce the reliance on labelled data, we propose AutoGraphAD, a novel unsupervised anomaly detection approach based on a Heterogeneous Variational Graph Autoencoder .
label: ai

text: quantum circuit (PQC) based Quantum Reinforcement Learning (QRL) has emerged as a promising paradigm at the intersection of quantum computing and reinforcement learning (RL) by design, PQCs create hybrid quantum-classical models, but their practical applicability remains uncertain due to training instabilities, barren plateaus (BPs) and the difficulty of isolating the contribution of individual pipeline components .
label: ai

text: GD combines artificial intelligence (AI), physics-based modeling, and multi-objective optimization to explore and refine engineering designs . current GD methods face critical challenges: AI approaches require large datasets and often struggle to generalize; topology optimization is computationally intensive and difficult to extend to multiphysics problems . to address these challenges, we introduce a unified, structure-preserving framework for GD, based on optimal transport (OT) .
label: ai

text: close-range proximity interactions are the key determinant for spreading processes . these dynamical processes can be modeled with time-respecting paths on temporal networks . generative model to create synthetic temporal graphs with memory and use it to show memory decreases the diffusion speed, affecting the dynamics of spreading processes on the temporal network . the results show strong memory effects, robust across settings, model parameters and statistically significant when compared to memoryless null models .
label: ai

text: a framework that dynamically integrates visual hints into the reasoning process, thereby making multimodal reasoning shorter and better . chainV achieves $2.3%$ improvement on the MathVista within MIMO-VL-RL, while reducing inference latency by $51.4%%$ and shortening output token length by $24.5% $ .
label: ai

text: we study a stochastic single-machine scheduling problem, denoted the Unreliable Job Selection and Sequencing Problem (UJSSP) each job incurs a cost if selected and yields reward upon successful completion . a job is completed successfully only if the machine does not fail before or during its execution . the objective is to determine an optimal subset and sequence of jobs to maximize the expected net profit .
label: ai

text: the lack of direct association between factual-level features and emotional categories limits the applicability of pre-training knowledge for VER tasks . the explicit emotional expression and high information density in textual modality eliminate the "affective gap" our code is released on https://github.com/wdqqdw/PACL . we propose borrowing the knowledge from the pre-trained textual model to enhance the emotional perception .
label: ai

text: GU decomposes any candidate forget gradient update into tangential and normal components to retain space . the projected direction aligned with the raw forget gradient is optimal among all first-order retain-invariant moves . GU achieves consistent improvement on various methods across three benchmarks toFU, MUSE, and WMDP . previous methods provide useful heuristics, but they often lack a formal analysis on how exactly forgetting updates harm retained knowledge .
label: ai

text: multivariate global sensitivity analysis provides a single sensitivity index per parameter, thus allowing for a holistic estimation of parameter importance over the full efficiency map or profile . the results are subsequently used to simplify the models, by fixing non-influential parameters to their nominal values and allowing random variations only for influential parameters . uncertainty estimates obtained with the full and reduced models confirm the validity of model simplification guided by multivariates sensitivity analyses .
label: ai

text: Vision-Language Navigation requires agents to act coherently over long horizons by understanding not only local visual context but also how far they have advanced within a multi-step instruction . progress methods predict numeric achievements; both overlook the monotonic co-progression property of the observation and instruction sequences . in the initial stage, self-Aligned Progress Pretraining bootstraps a reasoning module via a novel differentiable alignment between visual history and instruction prefixes, then, Progress-Guided
label: ai

text: new advances in large pre-trained models have opened new opportunities for training-free VAD by leveraging rich prior knowledge and general reasoning capabilities . existing studies typically rely on dense frame-level inference, incurring high computational costs and latency . we propose a novel framework inspired by the dual reflex and conscious pathways of the human nervous system, enabling selective frame processing to reduce redundant computation .
label: ai

text: existing articulated object reconstruction methods typically require costly inputs such as multi-stage and multi-view observations . planar Gaussian Splatting only uses sparse-view RGB images from a single state . we compress 3D Gaussians into planar gaussian splatting to facilitate accurate estimation of normal and depth . a part segmentation probability for each Gausian primitive and update them by back-projecting parts segmentation masks .
label: ai

text: STAR uses traversal orders of uniform spanning trees sampled in a lattice defined by the positions of image patches . STAR preserves the capability of postfix completion while maintaining sampling performance without any significant changes to the model architecture widely adopted in the language AR modeling . the approach can incorporate prior knowledge of images, such as center bias and locality, to maintain sampling performance while also providing sufficiently flexible sequence orders .
label: ai

text: the deployment of Large Language Models (LLMs) as tool-using agents causes their alignment training to manifest in new ways . models disclose suspected misconduct to parties beyond the dialog boundary without user instruction or knowledge . we introduce an evaluation suite of diverse and realistic staged misconduct scenarios to assess agents for this behavior . both black-box methods and probes on model activations show lower evaluation awareness in our settings .
label: ai

text: we introduce MUCH, the first claim-level UQ benchmark designed for fair and reproducible evaluation of future methods under realistic conditions . it includes 4,873 samples across four european languages (English, French, Spanish, and German) and four instruction-tuned open-weight LLMs . we release 24 generation logits per token, facilitating the development of future white-box methods without re-generating data .
label: ai

text: Discrete fuzzy numbers have been effectively employed to represent linguistic information within the framework of fuzzy systems . the proposed approach achieves a complexity of $mathcalO(n2 m log n)$, which is quadratic in the size of the underlying chain ($n$) the dominant factor is $m$, ensuring scalability with respect to the granularity of membership levels .
label: ai

text: H-GAR is a Hierarchical interaction framework via Goal-driven observation-Action Refinement . to enable explicit interaction between observation and action, we devise two synergistic modules . a goal observation and a coarse action sketch outline a high-level route toward the goal . the interaction-Aware Action Refiner refines coarse actions into fine-grained, goal-consistent actions by leveraging feedback from intermediate observations .
label: ai

text: molecular fingerprinting methods use hash functions to create fixed-length vector representations of molecules . however, hash collisions cause distinct substructures to be represented with the same feature, leading to overestimates in molecular similarity calculations . using exact fingerprints yields a small yet consistent improvement in predictive accuracy on five benchmarks from the DOCKSTRING dataset .
label: ai

text: multi-robot systems have emerged as a key technology for addressing the efficiency and cost challenges in labor-intensive industries . complexity arises from the need to find Pareto-optimal solutions for the conflicting objectives of makepan and transportation cost . a mandatory recharge triggered by energy constraints introduces an unscheduled load reset . this interaction creates a complex cascading effect that disrupts the entire schedule and render traditional optimization methods ineffective .
label: ai

text: diverseVAR is a simple yet effective approach that restores the generative diversity of VAR models without requiring additional training . our code will be publicly released at https://github.com/wangtong627/DiverseVAR . despite their efficiency, models often suffer from the diversity collapse, i.e., a reduction in output variability, analogous to that observed in few-step distilled diffusion models.
label: ai

text: Tical is a practical framework for trusted compilation that provides integrity protection and confidentiality in build pipelines . the approach harnesses TEEs as runtime protection but enriches them with file system shielding and an immutable audit log . this way, we can ensure that the compiler chain can only access trusted files and intermediate output, such as object files produced by trusted processes .
label: ai

text: the field has yet to develop a widely accepted solution for interpretable automated scoring . this work takes a principled approach to address this challenge . we develop the AnalyticScore framework for short answer scoring as a baseline reference framework for future research . analysis of the needs and potential benefits of interpretable automatic scoring for various assessment stakeholders aims to address those needs .
label: ai

text: recent studies attempt to synthesize MRI from Computed Tomography scans . low-dose protocols often result in highly sparse CT volumes with poor through-plane resolution . to address this, we propose ReBrain, a retrieval-augmented diffusion framework for brain MRI reconstruction . we also use a controlNet branch to guide the generation of intermediate MRI slices and ensure structural continuity .
label: ai

text: REArtGS introduces a category-agnostic approach using multi-view RGB images at two different states . however, the method still struggles with screw-joint or multi-part objects . in this paper, we propose a novel method towards generalizable articulated object reconstruction with temporal geometry constraint and planar Gaussian splatting . we first model a decoupled screw motion for each joint without type prior .
label: ai

text: electronic health records (EHRs) form an invaluable resource for training clinical decision support systems . we need large, structured tabular datasets on which we can build transparent feature-based models . a method for multi-modal patient-level information extraction leverages both the tabular features available in the patient's EHR (using an expert-informed Bayesian network) and clinical notes describing the patient’s symptoms (using neural text classifiers)
label: ai

text: RL-AD-Net is a reinforcement learning framework that operates in the latent space of a pretrained point autoencoder . it encodes completions into compact global feature vectors (GFVs) the framework is lightweight, modular, and model-agnostic, making it applicable to a wide range of completion networks without requiring retraining .
label: ai

text: LVLMs have been shown to perform excellently in image-level tasks such as VQA and caption . however, in many instance level tasks, a number of new topics have been discussed . this paper proposes a new unified Pedestrian Tracking framework, namely OmniPT, which can track, track based on reference and generate semantic understanding of tracked objects interactively .
label: ai

text: PathAgent is a training-free, large language model (LLM)-based agent framework that emulates the reflective, stepwise analytical approach of human experts . the entire sequence of observations and decisions forms an explicit chain-of-thought, yielding fully interpretable predictions . a collaborative evaluation with human pathologists confirms pathAgent's promise as a transparent and clinically grounded diagnostic assistant .
label: ai

text: roomplanner is the first fully automatic 3D room generation framework . the framework can generate explicit layout criteria for rational spatial placement . we propose a novel AnyReach Sampling strategy for camera trajectory, along with the interval timestep Flow Flow Samping (ITFS), to efficiently optimize the coarse 3D Gaussian scene representation . this approach reduces the total generation time to under 30 minutes .
label: ai

text: this article presents the precise asymptotical distribution of two types of critical transmission radii, defined in terms of k-connectivity and the minimum vertex degree, for random geometry graphs distributed over three-dimensional regions .  Less than a quarter of the world's population is a million-year-old, with a population of more than 200,000 .
label: ai

text: RacketVision is the first to provide large-scale, fine-grained annotations for racket pose alongside traditional ball positions . it is designed to tackle three interconnected tasks: fine ball tracking, articulated racketab pose estimation, and predictive ball trajectory forecasting . the dataset is designed for research into complex human-object interactions . a crossAttention mechanism is essential to unlock their value .
label: ai

text: parametric retrieval-augmented generation (PRAG) is a novel RAG paradigm that integrates external knowledge directly into a Large Language Model . current PRAG approaches adopt a textbfone-to-one document encoding scheme, using a dedicated LoRA adapter for each individual document . this scheme introduces two major limitations: first, it incurs high overhead during inference .
label: ai

text: MedImageInsight is a medical imaging foundational model for automated binary classification of chest X-rays into Normal and Abnormal categories . the model is designed for integration into web-based and hospital PACS workflows to support triage and reduce radiologist workload . this work will extend the model to multi-label pathology classification to provide preliminary diagnostic interpretation in clinical environments.
label: ai

text: the growth of Massive Open Online Courses presents significant challenges for personalized learning . existing approaches typically rely on heterogeneous information networks or knowledge graphs to capture conceptual relationships, combined with knowledge tracing models to assess learners' cognitive states . however, these methods face significant limitations due to their dependence on high-quality structured knowledge . a large teacher LLM extracts conceptual prerequisite relationships from its internalized world knowledge and distills them into soft labels .
label: ai

text: step-E is a simple framework that integrates sample selection and model learning into a single optimization process . at each epoch, Step-E ranks samples by loss and gradually increases the fraction of high-loss examples that are excluded from gradient updates after a brief warm-up stage . step-e also improves over the noisy baseline and nearly matches the clean-label oracle (85.9%), with only moderate training-time overhead .
label: ai

text: score-based diffusion solves inverse problems through joint inference . the prior offers limited guidance, while reconstruction is driven by the measurement-consistency term . we reinterpret the role of diffusion in inverse problem solving as an initialization stage within an expectation--maximization (EM)-style framework, where the diffusion stage and the data-driven refinement are fully decoupled .
label: ai

text: we construct a high-consensus dataset for binary persuasiveness judgment . we introduce the taxonomy of Visual Persuasive Factors (VPFs) . a recall-oriented bias-models over-predict high persuasiveness and weak discriminative power for low/mid-level features . high-level semantic alignment between message and object presence emerges as the strongest predictor of human judgement .
label: ai

text: proposed adaptation of Kaplan scaling laws to predict energy consumption for diffusion models based on computational complexity (FLOPs) we conduct comprehensive experiments across four state-of-the-art diffusion models on three GPU architectures (NVIDIA A100, A4000, A6000), spanning various inference configurations including resolution (256x256 to 1024x1024), precision (fp16/fp32), step counts (10-50) and classifier-free guidance settings .
label: ai

text: software Vulnerability Assessment (SVA) plays a vital role in evaluating and ranking vulnerabilities in software systems to ensure their security and reliability . most LLMs are trained on general-purpose corpora and thus lack domain-specific knowledge essential for effective SVA . combining RAG with chain-of-Thought prompting helps the LLM perform step-by-step reasoning over exploitability, impact scope, and related factors .
label: ai

text: lens blur typically varies with scene depth . the placement of virtual objects and their corresponding blur levels significantly affect the visual fidelity of mixed reality compositions . existing pipelines often rely on camera parameters (e.g., focal length, focus distance, aperture size) to compute the circle of confusion (CoC) for realistic lens blur rendering . however, such information is often unavailable to ordinary users, limiting the accessibility and generalizability .
label: ai

text: model-based and learning-based methods often fail in highly dynamic scenarios because traditional methods assume a static environment and cannot adapt to real-time changes . learning based methods rely on single-frame observations for motion constraint estimation, limiting their adaptability . this paper proposes a novel framework that leverages multi-frame point constraints, including current and future frames predicted by a dedicated module .
label: ai

text: pre-trained large models can help researchers extract key information from textual sources and construct structured knowledge graphs . but systematic data resources for Hunan's historical celebrities remain limited, and general-purpose models often underperform in domain knowledge extraction and structured output generation . this study proposes a supervised fine-tuning approach for enhancing domain-specific information extraction .
label: ai

text: multivariate time-series (MTS) clustering provides rich discriminative information . redundancy diminishes the attention given to discriminative timestamps in representation learning . most existing masking strategies appear to be standalone preprocessing steps, isolated from the learning process, which hinder dynamic adaptation to the importance of clustering-critical times . evolving-masked MTS clustering (EMTC) method .
label: ai

text: a generative framework can recover location labels directly from sequences of sparse channel state information (CSI) measurements without explicit location labels for radio map construction . a dual-scale feature extraction scheme is designed to enhance feature representation by jointly exploiting correlations from angular space and across neighboring samples . the proposed model can improve localization accuracy by over 30% and achieve a 20% capacity gain in non-line-of-sight scenarios compared with model-based Kalman filter approaches.
label: ai

text: tool-augmented agents lack "budget awareness" and quickly hit a performance ceiling . scaling requires "thinking" in tokens and "acting" via tool calls . the number of tool calls directly bounds the agent's interaction with the external environment . to address this, we study how to scale such agents effectively under explicit tool-call budgets . we further develop the budget tracker, a lightweight plug-in that provides the agent with continuous budget awareness .
label: ai

text: FLUID (Face de-identification in the Latent space via Utility-preserving Identity Displacement) is a training-free framework that directly substitutes identity in the latent space of pretrained diffusion models . our framework discovers identity-editing directions through optimization guided by novel reagent losses, which supervise for attribute preservation and identity suppression . experimental results on CelebA-HQ and FFHQ demonstrate that Fluss achieve a superior trade-off between identity suppression and attribute preservation, outperforming state-of
label: ai

text: existing evaluations often rely on benchmarks featuring only a singular cultural concept per image, overlooking scenarios where multiple, potentially unrelated cultural cues coexist . ConfusedTourist, a novel cultural adversarial robustness suite designed to assess VLMs' stability against perturbed geographical cue . results highlight a critical challenge: visual cultural concept mixing can substantially impair even state-of-the-art VLM .
label: ai

text: reservoir computers are known to perform a wide range of information processing tasks . but the nature of data transformations within the reservoir remains poorly understood . in this study, we shift the focus from performance maximization to systematic simplification . we examine how many neurons, how much nonlinearity, and which connective structure is necessary and sufficient to perform certain tasks, considering also neurons with non-sigmoidal activation functions .
label: ai

text: Imitation learning has achieved remarkable success in a variety of robotic tasks . the use of robot-to-camera transformation information (ie, camera extrinsics) benefits the learning process and produces better results . however, estimation methods usually suffer from local minima and poor generalizations . in this paper, we present a simple yet effective method that textbfrequires only a single mark .
label: ai

text: MVLR couples a lightweight encoder-decoder backbone with a Visual-Language Model (VLM) and an Implicit Memory Bank (IMB) the VLM performs chain-of-thought inference to encode weather degradation priors . the prototypes are then adaptively fused with multi-scale visual features via dynamic cross-attention mechanisms, enhancing restoration accuracy while maintaining computational efficiency .
label: ai

text: emergence of AI Scientists has demonstrated remarkable potential in automating scientific research . but current approaches largely conceptualize scientific discovery as a solitary optimization or search process . mirrorMind is a hierarchical cognitive architecture that integrates dual-memory representations within a three-level framework . the individual level constructs high-fidelity cognitive models of individual researchers by capturing their episodic, semantic, and persona memories .
label: ai

text: existing models remain passive, attempting to estimate static depth maps anchored to the nearest surface, while humans actively shift focus to perceive a desired depth . we introduce DepthFocus, a steerable Vision Transformer that redefines stereo depth estimation as intent-driven control . the training primarily leverages our newly constructed 500k multi-layered synthetic dataset, designed to capture diverse see-through effects .
label: ai

text: FIRM is a novel algorithm that achieves both client disagreement drift mitigation and communication efficiency . reliance on transmitting multiple gradients to a server is unscalable for large models . we propose a method to incorporate a preference over the objectives and report empirical Pareto plots . the method can easily adapt trade-offs between objectives in response to specified preferences .
label: ai

text: DReX (DINO-ResNet Fusion) fuses self-supervised and convolutional representations through a learnable attention mechanism to predict image complexity . the model achieves state-of-the-art performance on the IC9600 benchmark (Pearson r = 0.9581), surpassing previous methods--while using approximately 21.5x fewer learnable parameters .
label: ai

text: multimodal Sentiment Analysis (MSA) is critical for human-computer interaction . existing methods often assume pre-defined missing modalities or fixed missing rates, limiting their real-world applicability . we propose Senti-iFusion, an integrity-centered hierarchical fusion framework capable of handling both inter- and intra-modality missingness simultaneously .
label: ai

text: EMGesture is a novel contactless interaction technique that leverages the electromagnetic (EM) signals from Qi wireless chargers for gesture recognition . the end-to-end framework enables it capable of accurately interpreting user intent . experiments involving 30 participants, 10 mobile devices, and 5 chargers showed that EMGesteure achieves over 97% recognition accuracy .
label: ai

text: nondifferentiable surface extraction prevents image losses from directly guiding physics optimization . physMorph-GS couples a differentiable material point method with 3D Gaussian splatting through a bridge that maps sparse particle states (x, F) to dense Gaussians . multi-modal rendering losses on silhouette and depth backpropagate along two paths .
label: ai

text: a knowledge-guided RME framework integrates Kolmogorov-Arnold Networks (KAN) with Mixture-of-Experts (MoE), namely RadioKMoE . Specifically, we design a KAN module to predict an initial coarse coverage map, leveraging KAN's strength in approximating physics models and global radio propagation patterns .
label: ai

text: research on text summarization fails to explicate deeper argument structure within sentences . a novel framework to address the task is to reveal the claim-reason structure of arguments in conversations, with quantities measuring argument strength . in this paper, we propose a new task of argument-aware quantitative summarizing to reveal underlying argument structure in conversations . we propose an argument structure-based clustering algorithm to aggregate arguments and quantify their support .
label: ai

text: plants pose a significant threat to global agriculture, causing over $220 billion in annual economic losses and jeopardizing food security . the timely and accurate detection of these diseases from plant leaf images is critical to mitigating their adverse effects . we present the SQ metric, a novel measure that captures synergy between ensemble members and consistently aligns with ensemble accuracy .
label: ai

text: 3DGS employs a large number of Gaussian primitives to fit scenes . existing methods rely on manually designed criteria or introduce additional learnable parameters, yielding suboptimal results . we propose an natural selection inspired pruning framework that models survival pressure as a regularization gradient field applied to opacity . this process is fully learnable and requires no human intervention .
label: ai

text: open-set domain generalization (OSDG) tackles the realistic scenario where deployed models encounter both domain shifts and novel object categories . existing methods still fall into the dilemma between structural risk of known-classes and open-space risk from unknown-class . to this end, we propose a semantic-enhanced CLIP framework that explicitly addresses this dilemma through fine-grained semantic enhancement .
label: ai

text: deep equilibrium models (DEQs) have emerged as a powerful paradigm for training infinitely deep weight-tied neural networks that achieve state of the art performance across many modern machine learning tasks . we rigorously study the gradient descent dynamics for DEQs in the simple setting of linear models and single-index models, filling several gaps in the literature . despite their practical success, theoretical understanding remains an area of active research .
label: ai

text: to address these challenges, we introduce tree of Claims (ToC) to redefine claim editing as a guided search problem . toC synergistically integrates Monte Carlo Tree Search with a collaborative multi-agent system . a benchmark of 1145 claims demonstrates that ToC significantly outperforms standard LLMs in zero-shot and few-shot scenarios .
label: ai

text: a new paradigm is to perform fast, data-efficient, and high-fidelity RF reconstruction of occluded 3D static scenes using only a single, brief human walk . we argue that this unstructured motion is not noise, but is in fact an information-rich signal available for reconstruction . to achieve this, we design a factorization framework that learns to model the dynamic effects of human motion from the persistent static scene geometry within a raw RF stream .
label: ai

text: raw food images can be synthesized from raw inputs on edge devices . model outperforms existing baselines with significant reductions in FID scores (30% improvement on our dataset; 60% on public datasets) model enables user-preferred visual targets rather than fixed presets . the first oven-based cooking-progression dataset with chef-annotated doneness levels .
label: ai

text: traditional approaches include writing custom GPU kernels and using specialized model compilers to tune high-level code for specific GPU targets . recent work shows that LLM-based multi-agent systems can effectively perform such tuning, often outperforming existing compilers and eliminating the need for manual kernel development . a logical framework is presented for comparing multi agent PyTorch optimization systems .
label: ai

text: previous methods have demonstrated remarkable performance in single image super-resolution (SISR) tasks with known and fixed degradation (e.g., bicubic downsampling) but when actual degradation deviates from these assumptions, these methods may experience significant declines in performance . we propose a dual branch degradation extractor network to address the blind SR problem .
label: ai

text: BNs are an important tool for assisting probabilistic reasoning . current User Interfaces (UIs) still do not clarify the reasoning of BN . a user study found users did better with all three types of extensions than with the baseline UI for questions about the impact of an observation . using verbal and visual modalities together is better than using either modality alone for some question types .
label: ai

text: matPedia is a foundation model built upon a novel joint RGB-PBR representation that compactly encodes materials into two interdependent latents . generative models have advanced material synthesis, but existing methods lack a unified representation bridging natural image appearance and PBR properties . MatPedia achieved native $1024times1024$ synthesis that substantially surpasses existing approaches in both quality and diversity .
label: ai

text: current methods address this issue by converting ODEs to Stochastic Differential Equations (SDEs), which introduce stochasticity . but this SDE-based GRPO suffers from issues of inefficient credit assignment and incompatibility with high-order solvers for fewer-step sampling . we propose a novel alignment algorithm that completely bypasses the need for SDEs .
label: ai

text: we show how to merge run-length compressed Burrows-Wheeler Transforms (RLBWTs) quickly and in $O (R)$ space, where $R$ is the total number of runs in them, when a certain parameter is small . we consider the boundaries between blocks of characters from the same original RLBWT and denote by $L$ the sum of the longest common prefix (LCP) values at those boundaries .
label: ai

text: automatic facial expression spotting (P-FES) is crucial for facial expression analysis . existing methods focus on fully-supervised learning and rely on costly, time-consuming temporal boundary annotations . we propose a unique two-branch framework to mitigate the limitation of hard pseudo-labeling . a class-agnostic expression intensity branch is responsible for macro- and micro-expression classification .
label: ai

text: fine-grained hand motion capture is fundamental to visual perception, embodied intelligence, and multimodal communication . to support this task, we curate FingerCap-40K, a large-scale corpus of 40K paired hand-motion videos and captions spanning two complementary sources: concise instruction-style finger motions . Temporal sparsity remains a fundamental bottleneck for current Video-MLLMs, since sparse RGB sampling is insufficient to capture the subtle, high-frequency dynamics underlying fine finger motion
label: ai

text: mobileocc is a semantic occupancy dataset for mobile robots operating in crowded human environments . the dataset is built using an annotation pipeline that incorporates static object occupancy annotations and a novel mesh optimization framework explicitly designed for human occupancy modeling . it reconstructs deformable human geometry from 2D images and subsequently refines it using associated LiDAR point data .
label: ai

text: dynamic magnetic resonance imaging (dMRI) captures temporally-resolved anatomy but is often challenged by limited sampling and motion-induced artifacts . in this work, we propose a novel implicit neural representation framework that jointly models both the dynamic image sequence and its underlying motion field . the proposed method outperforms state-of-the-art motion-compensated and deep learning approaches, achieving superior reconstruction quality .
label: ai

text: Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) has emerged as a promising approach to scale up deep learning models due to its significant reduction in computational resources . however, the dynamic nature of MoE leads to load imbalance among experts, severely impacting training efficiency . previous research has attempted to address the load balancing challenge, but existing solutions compromise model accuracy or introduce additional system overhead .
label: ai

text: RASTP (Representation-Aware Semantic Token Pruning) directly prunes less informative tokens in the input sequence . the code has been open-sourced at https://github.com/Yuzt-zju/RASTP . it is a major determinant of computational complexity and memory consumption . we propose a code that reduces training time by 26.7% .
label: ai

text: current privacy benchmarks are structurally insufficient for this new threat . we propose textbfMultiPriv, the first benchmark designed to systematically evaluate individual-level privacy reasoning in VLMs . the dataset uniquely features a core component of synthetic individual profiles where identifiers (e.g., faces, names) are meticulously linked to sensitive attributes .
label: ai

text: Edge-ANN is an innovative ANN framework specifically engineered for storage efficiency . its core innovation lies in its departure from traditional tree-based methods that store high-dimensional hyperplanes . instead, it leverages pairs of existing data items, termed "anchors," to implicitly define spatial partitions. this architectural shift eliminates the dimension-dependence of the space complexity.
label: ai

text: despite recent advances in multimodal Large Language Models, a significant gap remains between current models and real-world demands . we attribute this to limited benchmark scope, causing models to exhibit category bias, oversimplified reasoning, and poor linguistic robustness . to address these limitations, we introduce OmniGround, an comprehensive benchmark with 3,475 videos spanning 81 categories .
label: ai

text: our approach effectively mitigates shape distortions and provides anatomically faithful tooth boundaries . a tooth-shape-aware learning mechanism explicitly enforces morphological constraints to preserve boundary integrity . results: Extensive evaluations on internal and external datasets demonstrate that our approach significantly outperforms existing methods . the method introduces a target-tooth-centroid prompted multi-label learning strategy to model semantic relationships between teeth .
label: ai

text: linkML is an open framework that simplifies the process of authoring, validating, and sharing data . it can describe a range of data structures, from flat, list-based models to complex, interrelated, and normalized models that utilize polymorphism and compound inheritance . the linkML syntax provides a standard way to describe schemas, classes, and relationships, allowing modelers to build well-defined, stable and optionally ontology-aligned data structures .
label: ai

text: wearable ECGs enable long-term monitoring but suffer from irregular, lower sampling frequencies due to battery constraints . we train a latent ODE to model continuous ECG waveforms and create robust feature vectors from high-frequency single-channel signals . performance shows minimal degradation, with macro-averaged AUC-ROC values of 0.984, 0.978, and 0.976 at 360 Hz and 90 Hz respectively .
label: ai

text: AI agents have demonstrated increasing proficiency in scientific tasks, ranging from hypothesis generation to manuscript writing . existing AI Scientists predominantly formulate scientific discovery as a standalone search or optimization problem . current systems struggle to establish a genuine research ecosystem or interact deeply with the human scientific community . to bridge this gap, we introduce OmniScientist, a framework that encodes the underlying mechanisms of human research into the AI scientific workflow .
label: ai

text: a contrastive reinforcement learning framework for online trajectory anomaly detection, CroTad . our method is threshold-free and robust to noisy, irregularly sampled data . the detection module leverages deep reinforcement learning to perform online, real-time anomaly scoring, enabling timely and fine-grained identification of abnormal segments . a sub-trajectory anomaly detector, capable of pinpointing the precise segments where anomalies occur, remains underexplored .
label: ai

text: diffusion model (DM) based Video Super-Resolution (VSR) approaches achieve impressive perceptual quality . but they suffer from error accumulation, spatial artifacts, and a trade-off . the feature domain is better suited than the pixel domain for information compensation due to its stronger spatial and temporal correlations . we propose a novel densely guided diffusion model with an OGWM to maintain high-frequency details in the aligned features .
label: ai

text: single-cell RNA sequencing (scRNA-seq) enables transcriptomic profiling at cellular resolution but suffers from pervasive dropout events that obscure biological signals . we present SCR-MF, a modular two-stage workflow that combines principled dropout detection using scRecover with robust non-parametric imputation via missForest .
label: ai

text: ANN search is a foundational component of many modern retrieval and recommendation systems . almost all algorithms follow an $$-Recall-Bounded principle when comparing performance . they require the ANN results to achieve a recall of more than $1-$ . this approach only accounts for the recall of true positive results and does not provide guarantees on the deviation of incorrect results . to address this limitation, we propose an error-bounded ANN method, which ensures that the returned results are a $(1/
label: ai

text: delta-denoising is a zero-shot anomaly generation method that localizes and edits defects by contrasting two diffusion branches driven by a minimal prompt pair under a shared schedule . to improve stability and control, DeltaDeno performs token-level prompt refinement that aligns shared content and strengthens anomaly tokens . experiments on public datasets show that DeltaDdeno achieves great generation, realism and consistent gains in downstream detection performance . code will be made publicly available
label: ai

text: the sensitivity of an algorithm $A$ on a graph $G$ is defined as the maximum waterstein distance between the output distributions . the maximum is taken over all edges $e$, and the underlying metric for the Wasserstein distance is the Hamming distance . we present significantly faster algorithms for planar and bipartite graphs as a function of $varepsilon$ and $$, which run in time $sqrtn cdo
label: ai

text: the model takes an RGB image and produces a painted text image that visually encodes the semantic prediction . at the representation level, we instantiate a single Unified Diffusion Transformer trained with rectified flow in pixel space . a shared backbone jointly learns bidirectional mappings between natural images and painted text images, with lightweight task embeddings to specify the desired direction .
label: ai

text: traditional state-based reward functions suffer from the issue of vanishing reward differences . this phenomenon results in a low signal-to-noise ratio (SNR) for policy gradients, significantly hindering algorithm convergence and performance improvement . we first theoretically elucidate how the temporal quasi-steady nature of traffic states and the physical proximity of actions lead to the failure of traditional reward signals .
label: ai

text: pepEVOLVE is a position-aware, dynamic framework that learns where to edit and how to dynamically optimize peptides for multi-objective improvement . the model combines biologics-like affinity with small-molecule-like developability, but their vast combinatorial space and multi-parameter objectives make lead optimization slow and challenging . a priori model requires chemists to pre-specify mutable positions for optimization, choices that are not always known .
label: ai

text: study proposes a novel hybrid algorithm that combines the improved Multi-Robot Formation Obstacle Avoidance (MRF IAPF) algorithm with an enhanced APF optimized for single UAV path planning . the proposed algorithm achieves significant improvements in path length optimization and heading stability,can effectively avoid obstacles and quickly restore the formation configuration,thus verifying its applicability and effectiveness in static environments with unknown obstacles .
label: ai

text: Q-Real consists of 3,088 images generated by popular text-to-image models . for each image, we annotate the locations of major entities and provide a set of judgment questions and attribution descriptions for these along the dimensions of realism and plausibility . we construct a fine-tuning framework and conduct experiments on multiple MLLMs using our dataset .
label: ai

text: in this paper, we define a concept of talent breakout and propose a method to detect rising talents before their rise to stardom . the main focus of the study is to determine the effectiveness of combining Twitter and TV data on predicting time-dependent changes in social data . however, the success of neural network models in various fields continues to spark an interest in the time-series community to apply new techniques in practice . in order to find the best modeling approach, we have experimented with traditional, neural network and ensemble learning methods
label: ai

text: hot diffusion relies entirely on noise, and cold diffusion uses only blurring without noise . hot diffusion fails to exploit the strong correlation between high-frequency image detail and low-frequency structures . cold diffusion neglects the role of noise (randomness) in shaping the data manifold, resulting in out-of-manifold issues and partially explaining its performance drop .
label: ai

text: the minimum circuit size problem for partial functions is hard assuming the Exponential Time Hypothesis (ETH) . this breakthrough hardness result leveraged a characterization of the optimal $land, lor, and neg$ circuits for $n$-bit $OR$ ($OR_n$) and a reduction from the partial $f$-Simple Extension Problem .
label: ai

text: receiver-side scheduling can be integrated modularly into transport stacks such as TCP, QUIC, WebRTC, UDP, or RTP . scheduler maintains an adaptive estimate of effective path delay and adjusts release times asymmetrically, responding quickly to late arrivals and only gradually to early ones . the scheduler runs entirely on the receiver clock and requires no feedback or synchronization .
label: ai

text: research focuses on simple video scenarios, failing to reflect complex and diverse nature of real-world audio-visual events in videos . to bridge this gap, we firstly introduce R-AVST, a dataset for audio-visual reasoning featuring fine-grained spatio-temporal annotations . AVST-Zero offers a novel perspective for tackling future challenges in this domain .
label: ai

text: single-Pixel Tactile Skin (SPTS) is a paradigm that uses compressive sampling to reconstruct rich tactile information from an entire sensor array via a single output channel . this is achieved through a direct circuit-level implementation where each sensing element contributes a dynamically weighted analog signal to a global sum, performing distributed compressed sensing in hardware .
label: ai

text: the minimizer aims to choose a panel that minimizes the loss, i.e., the deviation of the ultimate panel from predefined representation targets . then an adversary defines a distribution over dropouts from which the realized droppedouts are drawn . our main contribution is an efficient loss-minimizing algorithm, which remains optimal as we vary the maximizer's power from worst case to average case .
label: ai

text: IsharaKotha, the first HamNoSys-based Bangla Sign Language corpus, containing 3823 words . a deep learning based lemmatizer was integrated to extract root words, enabling sign generation for complete sentences . an evaluation interface was developed to assess the quality of sign animations for letters, digits, and sentences using categorical numeric scores .
label: ai

text: specialized attention heads dubbed induction heads (IHs) underlie the remarkable in-context learning capabilities of modern language models . yet, a precise characterization of their formation remains unclear . a simple equation combining batch size and context size predicts the point at which IHs form; . surface bigram repetition frequency and reliability strongly affect the formation .
label: ai

text: a common criticism of blockchain networks has been their energy consumption and operational costs . the switch from Proof-of-Work (PoW) protocol has significantly reduced this issue, though concerns remain, especially with network expansions via additional layers . fewer than 15 official bundler providers exist, compared to over 100 regular Ethereum access providers . in this paper, we provide first look at the active power consumption overhead that a bundler would add to an Ethereum access service .
label: ai

text: glass surfaces are ubiquitous in everyday life, typically appearing colorless, transparent, and lacking distinctive features . existing glass surface detection methods always rely on boundary cues to locate glass surfaces, but fail to fully exploit the intrinsic properties of the glass itself for accurate localization . we propose a Reflection Contrast Mining Module (RCMM) for extracting reflections, and a reflection guided attention module (RGAM) for fusing features from reflection and glass surface .
label: ai

text: small, looped architectures can outperform Large Language Models (LLMs) on complex reasoning tasks, including the Abstraction and Reasoning Corpus (ARC). in this work, we investigate a core question: how can we further improve the efficiency of these methods with minimal changes? we frame the latent reasoning of TRMs as a form of classifier-free guidance and implicit policy improvement algorithm .
label: ai

text: soft concepts are trained on discrete tokens during training . the entire latent reasoning process is optimized with Reinforcement Learning . a new study has shown that lLMs are trained by generating discrete . tokens . to reduce this gap between the soft concepts in reasoning and the discreet tokens in training, we propose Soft Concept Mixing (SCM) .
label: ai

text: a survey of 433 authors of articles published in 50 sociology journals in the last five years . the study focuses on sociological research as our site . it provides an overview of the state of the discipline with regard to the use of GenAI . experts are divided on whether GenAI will have a positive impact on the field . in the midst of both excitement and skepticism, it is crucial to take stock of how GenAI is actually being used .
label: ai

text: current LLM selection methods typically optimize for a single fixed objective, such as performance, cost, or a trade-off between them, and fail to learn individual user preferences from interaction data . PersonalizedRouter is a graph-based framework that models diverse user profiles and performs personalized . selection by leveraging interaction data that includes task context, queries, candidate LLMs, and user decisions .
label: ai

text: software engineers must make decisions that trade off competing goals . despite MSR's proven techniques for exploring such goals, researchers still struggle with these trade-offs . to enable more research in this important area, we introduce MOOT, a repository of multi-objective optimization tasks taken from recent SE research papers . MOOT's current 120+ tasks are freely available under an MIT license (and we invite community contributions).
label: ai

text: a multigraph $G = (V, E)$ is $(k, ell)$-sparse if every subset $X subseteq V$ induces at most $maxk|X| - ll, 0$ edges . this paper presents a highly efficient and flexible implementation of an augmenting path method, enhanced with a range of powerful practical heuristics .
label: ai

text: a direct approach to solve this problem is to detect QS by repeatedly evaluating a non-reference metric (NRM) on videos compressed with multiple codec parameters, which is inefficient . we propose two methods for DS detection: distortion saturation detection (DSD), which relies on an input-dependent threshold derived from the D-MSE of the input UGC .
label: ai

text: Graph Neural Networks rely on local message passing, which limits their ability to model long-range dependencies in graphs . existing approaches extend this range through continuous-time dynamics or dense self-attention, but both suffer from high computational cost and limited scalability . we propose topologic attention networks, a probabilistic mechanism that learns how information should flow through both direct and indirect connections in a graph .
label: ai

text: we propose applying representation alignment (REPA) between diffusion or flow-based models and those of pretrained self-supervised encoders to guide reconstruction process at inference time . aligning model representations with approximate target features can substantially enhance reconstruction fidelity and perceptual realism . we demonstrate the generality of our approach by integrating it into multiple state-of-the-art inverse problem solvers .
label: ai

text: the joint Gromov-Wasserstein (GW) distance serves as a powerful tool for matching objects in metric spaces . but its traditional formulation is constrained to pairwise matching between single objects, limiting its utility in scenarios and applications requiring multiple-to-one or multiple object matching . the objective can be formulated and solved for point cloud object representations by adapting traditional algorithms in Optimal Transport .
label: ai

text: this paper studies the functional uniqueness and stability of Gaussian priors in optimal $L1$ estimation . based on the prior work, we develop a quantitative stability theory that characterizes how approximate linearity of the optimal estimator constrains the prior distribution . we derive explicit rates showing that near-linearity of . the conditional mean implies proximity of the prior in the metric .
label: ai

text: skeleton action recognition involves recognizing human action from human joints . occlusions of parts of the human body or poor communication quality . existing GCN models perform poorly due to missing local context . part-specific information is captured through parts-specific scanning feature and preserves non-neighboring joint context via a parts-body fusion module .
label: ai

text: dubbed test overfitting, it has been identified and studied before the rise of large language models . we experimentally study how much testing overfitted is still a problem today . the problem has been uncovered and studied by a repository-level SWE-bench task . if the problem is solved, it will be able to generate repaired code that passes on seen tests .
label: ai

text: vision Language Models (VLMs) have achieved impressive performance on spatial reasoning benchmarks . current benchmarks test high level relationships, but ignore fine-grained spatial understanding needed for real world applications . our data generation pipeline leverages 6D object poses from the Benchmark for Object Pose Estimation (BOP) datasets from which we derive fine grained annotations such as grasp poses, referred object poses and path planning trajectories .
label: ai

text: the use of vocal biomarkers to support early diagnosis of PD presents a non-invasive, low-cost, and accessible alternative in clinical settings . the aim of this cross-sectional study was to consistently evaluate the effectiveness of a Deep Neural Network (DNN) in distinguishing individuals with Parkinson's disease from healthy controls . two publicly available voice datasets were used, and model robustness was assessed using classification statistics .
label: ai

text: super-resolution (SR) presents a promising computational approach to overcome these challenges by generating HR images from more affordable low resolution scans . it examines DL-based MRI SR methods from the perspectives of computer vision, computational imaging, inverse problems, and MR physics, covering theoretical foundations, architectural designs, learning strategies, benchmark datasets, and performance metrics .
label: ai

text: existing EO datasets mainly emphasize semantic understanding tasks such as captioning or classification, lacking benchmarks that align multimodal perception with measurable biophysical variables . REO-Instruct establishes a cognitively interpretable logic chain in forest ecological scenario (human activity,land-cover classification, ecological patch counting, above-ground biomass (AGB) regression), bridging qualitative understanding and quantitative prediction .
label: ai

text: we introduce cubical contractions, a higher-dimensional generalisation of reductions to normal forms . we establish cubical proofs of fundamental rewriting results via pasting of cubical coherence cells . each convergent abstract rewrite system freely generates an acyclic cubical groupoid . if rewritten, we will be able to create cubical polygraphic resolutions .
label: ai

text: we quantified the alignment between the internal representations of 36 different audio models and brain activity from two independent fMRI datasets . voxel-wise and component-wise regression, and representation similarity analysis (RSA), we found that recent self-supervised audio models with strong performance in diverse downstream tasks are better predictors of auditory cortex activity than older and more specialized models . we analyzed the evolution of the similarity between audio and brain representations during the pretraining of EnCodecMAE .
label: ai

text: this study focuses on Homarus gammarus (European lobster), a key species for fisheries and aquaculture . it leverages non-invasive Passive Acoustic Monitoring (PAM) understanding lobster habitats, welfare, reproduction, sex, and age is crucial for management and conservation . the research aims to help scientists understand the importance of supervised ML and DL .
label: ai

text: large language models (LLMs) often generate responses that are lengthy and verbose, filled with redundant or unnecessary details . this diminishes clarity and user satisfaction, and it increases costs for model developers, especially with well-known proprietary models that charge based on the number of output tokens . our method quantifies non-essential content without relying on gold standard references and calculates the average of three calculations: i) a compression ratio between the original response and an LLM abstractive summary; ii
label: ai

text: conformal classification is a general UQ framework that provides statistically valid guarantees . prior ordinal CP methods mainly focus on heuristic algorithms or restrictively require the underlying model to predict a unimodal distribution over ordinal labels . to this end, we propose an ordinal-CP method that is model-agnostic and provides instance-level optimal prediction intervals .
label: ai

text: we propose a simple, efficient heuristic that allows for planning over large robot environments in a fraction of time and search memory as compared to uninformed search algorithms . we present extensive case studies to demonstrate the scalability, runtime analysis as well as empirical bounds on the suboptimality of the proposed heuriistic . if full task compliance is unattainable, we aim to achieve the best possible task satisfaction by integrating user preferences for relaxation into the planning process .
label: ai

text: a framework for systematic benchmark revision leverages statistical analysis of response patterns to flag potentially invalid questions for further expert review . we introduce an LLM-judge first pass to review questions, further reducing human effort . the framework provides an efficient and scalable framework for systemic benchmark revision . if you are looking for a benchmark, you may want to consider a tool that can be used to test your accuracy .
label: ai

text: the recently introduced Mamba architecture outperformed an advanced Transformer (Transformer++) based on Llama in handling long context lengths, while using fewer model parameters . despite the impressive performance of these architectures, a systematic approach to empirically analyze model performance and efficiency under various settings is not well established in the medical domain . the performances of six sequence models were investigated across three architecture classes in a large Swedish heart failure cohort (N = 42820)
label: ai

text: we present a data-driven framework to model the stochastic evolution of volume-price distribution from the New York Stock Exchange (NYSE) equities . the empirical distributions are sampled every 10 minutes over 976 trading days . each of these models is parameterized by a shape parameter, $$, and a scale parameter . a time series of the detrended parameters is analyzed using adaptive binning .
label: ai

text: cognitive BASIC is a minimal, BASIC-style prompting language and in-model interpreter that structures large language model reasoning into explicit, stepwise execution traces . modern LLMs can reliably simulate such short programs, enabling transparent multi-step reasoning inside the model . a natural-language interpreter file specifies command semantics, memory updates, and logging behavior .
label: ai

text: in this work, we analyze how English speakers talk about vaccine discourse in social media posts . we first introduce a novel dataset comprising 18.7 million curated posts on vaccine discourse from 2013 to 2022 . this extensive collection-filtered down from an initial 129 million posts through rigorous preprocessing-captures both pre-COVID and COVID-19 periods, offering valuable insights into the evolution of English-speaking X users' perceptions .
label: ai

text: 3DGS has recently emerged as a foundational technique for real-time neural rendering, 3D scene generation, volumetric video (4D) capture . however, its rendering and training impose massive computation, making real -time rendering on edge devices and real--time 4D reconstruction on workstations currently infeasible . vorion features scalable architecture, minimal hardware change to traditional rasterizers, z-tiling to increase parallelism .
label: ai

text: studies show that text to image diffusion models are vulnerable to backdoor attacks . a trigger in the input prompt can steer generation toward harmful or unintended content . we introduce PEPPER (PErcePtion Guided PERturbation), a backdoor defense . this rewrites the caption into a semantically distant yet visually similar caption .
label: ai

text: existing EEG foundation models mainly treat neural signals as generic time series in Euclidean space . this fundamental mismatch between model assumptions and neural geometry limits representation quality and cross-subject generalization . the architecture integrates three key innovations: a Riemannian VAE for manifold embedding that preserves geometric structure, a geometric Transformer with geodesic-aware attention mechanisms operating directly on neural maniolds .
label: ai

text: worldGen enables the automatic creation of large-scale, interactive 3D worlds directly from text prompts . the system is fully modular and supports fine-grained control over layout, scale, and style . this work represents a step towards accessible, generative world-building at scale, advancing the frontier of 3D generative AI for applications in gaming, simulation, and immersive social environments .
label: ai

text: intransitive verbs fall into two different syntactic classes, unergatives and unaccusatives . human ratings for agentivity and telicity were a poor predictor . this is done using interpretable dimensions, computed from seed words on opposite poles of the agentive and telemic scales, to provide valuable evidence for semantic properties that are not easily evaluated .
label: ai

text: ASL-3+ models present a unique risk in their ability to uplift non-state actors . existing evaluation metrics, such as LAB-Bench, bioLP-bench, and WMDP, can reliably assess model uplift and domain knowledge . to address both gaps, we introduce MOCET, an interpretable and double-scalable metric (automatable and open-ended) that can quantify real-world risks .
label: ai

text: federated learning has emerged as a promising remedy to these challenges by decentralizing model training to edge devices or parties . however, the presence of statistical heterogeneity in non-IID data across different parties poses a significant hurdle to the effectiveness of FL . in this research endeavor, we delve into the exploration of FL algorithms, specifically FedAvg, FedProx, and Scaffold .
label: ai

text: BITS for GAPS provides an efficient, interpretable, and uncertainty-aware framework for hybrid modeling of complex physical systems . the framework supports serial hybrid modeling, where known physics governs part of the system and residual dynamics are represented as a latent function inferred from data . entropy-guided sampling improves sample efficiency by targeting regions of high uncertainty and potential information gain .
label: ai

text: large language models match human creative performance in divergent thinking tasks, but visual creativity remains underexplored . the study compared image generation in human participants (Visual Artists and Non Artists) and using an image generation AI model (two prompting conditions with varying human input: high for Human Inspired, low for Self Guided generative AI, and finally self Guided)
label: ai

text: a linked bar chart is the augmentation of a traditional bar chart where each bar is partitioned into blocks and pairs of blocks are linked using orthogonal lines that pass over intermediate bars . the main challenge lies with dependent'' links, whose vertical link length cannot be optimized independently per bar . we show that, if the dependent links form a forest, the problem can be solved in $O(nm)$ time, for n bars and m links .
label: ai

text: this article suggests an alternative to representation-based models of the mind . we argue that translation is not the manipulation of static interlingual correspondences but an enacted activity, dynamically integrating affective, behavioral, and cognitive processes . this non-representational account reframes translation as skillful participation in sociocultural practice, where meaning is co-created in real time through embodied interaction with texts, tools, and contexts.
label: ai

text: meshes are a critical building block for applications ranging from industrial design and gaming to simulation and robotics . Mesh RAG is a novel, training-free, plug-and-play framework for autoregressive mesh generation models . it combines point cloud segmentation, spatial transformation, and point cloud registration to retrieve, generate, and integrate mesh components .
label: ai

text: users performed searches for virtual gems within a large-scale augmented environment . the use of navigation aids impacted object recall, with impaired recall of objects in the environment when an aid was switched on . results point at possible impact factors of object awareness in mobile AR and underscore the potential for adaptable interfaces to support users navigating the physical world .  Less than a third of mobile AR's users are able to navigate the virtual world without the need for a navigation aid .
label: ai

text: identifying the largest K flows in network traffic is an important task for applications such as flow scheduling and anomaly detection . hardware accelerators are often used due to their high computational power, but their limited amount of on-chip memory constrains their performance . in this work, we propose an algorithm for top-K identification using a modified TowerSketch and a priority queue array . we identify the top-k flows, with K up to 32,768, with a precision of more than 0.94 .
label: ai

text: penalty-based methods have become popular for solving bilevel optimization (BLO) problems . but they often require inner-loop iterations to solve the lower-level (LL) problem . a novel penalty reformulation that decouples the upper- and lower level variables . we propose PBGD-Free, a fully single-oop algorithm that avoids inner loops .
label: ai

text: iff constraint aligns with many real-world applications . but recent work has shown that most deep learning-based MIL approaches violate it, leading to inflated performance metrics and poor generalization . we propose a novel MIL framework based on Vector Symbolic Architectures (VSAs), which provide a differentiable mechanism for performing symbolic operations in high-dimensional space .
label: ai

text: membership inference attacks (MIAs) against machine learning (ML) models aim to determine whether a given data point was part of the model training data . these attacks may pose significant privacy risks to individuals whose sensitive data were used for training . they exploit the differences in the behavior of a model when making predictions on samples it has seen during training versus those it has not seen (non-members)
label: ai

text: a code-generation agent produces an initial solution from the input instruction . the candidate program is then executed against the provided unit tests . only the failing cases are forwarded to a debugger agent, which reruns the tests, extracts error traces, and generates a revised solution . a $Pass@1$ score of 95.4 was achieved in the shared task .
label: ai

text: existing multimodal KV Cache compression methods mostly rely on attention score to reduce cache size . removing KV pairs that deviate substantially leads to a performance drop, which we define as Outlier KVs . we propose a frequency-domain-guided, outlier-KV-aware KV-cache compression framework that models the principal component of multimodal matrices in the frequency domain .
label: ai

text: GAR replaces the conventional AR engine's multi-stage modules with a unified generative backbone . we formalize the computational correspondence between AR and GAR, survey the technical foundations that make real-time generative augmentation feasible . GAR envisions a future AR paradigm that delivers high-fidelity experiences in terms of realism, interactivity, and immersion .
label: ai

text: a tableau metatheory provides general and formal notions for different propositional logics . some facts, independent of their applications, can be proved . a method that simplifies the process of constructing a complete tableau system for a given logic is essential for an universal treatment of tableau methods for various propositional languages and semantics.  Less than a quarter of a century ago, a table system was created in a single table system.
label: ai

text: structure-text contrastive learning has shown promising performance on text-attributed graphs by leveraging the complementary strengths of graph neural networks and language models . existing methods typically rely on homophily assumptions in similarity estimation and hard optimization objectives, which limit their applicability to heterophilic graphs . to achieve flexible and bidirectional alignment, we propose GCL-OT, a novel graph contrastive framework with optimal transport, equipped with tailored mechanisms .
label: ai
