text: study explores the dynamics of trust in artificial intelligence agents . the concept of "deferred trust" is a cognitive mechanism where distrust in human agents redirects reliance toward AI perceived as more neutral or competent . study focuses on 30 decision-making scenarios (factual, emotional, moral) and voice assistants, peers, adults, or priests as guides .
label: ai

text: large language models (LLMs) have excelled at understanding natural language and integrating cross-modal signals . recent work has explored this by either designing template-based graph templates or using graph neural networks (GNNs) to encode structural information . our systematic experiments reveal that different strategies for encoding graph structure affect LLM performance on text-attributed graphs . we show that explicit structural priors are often unnecessary and, in some cases, counterproductive when powerful language models are involved .
label: ai

text: Scalable Vector Graphics (SVGs) are central to modern design workflows . they offer scaling without distortion and precise editability . however, generating multi-view consistent SVGs from a single-view input remains underexplored . this work bridges generative modeling and structured vector representation, providing a scalable route to single input, object level multi-visit SVG generation and supporting applications .
label: ai

text: kinetic vulnerabilities in cyber-physical systems (CPS) can precipitate hazardous physical consequences . the periodic execution of control code in CPS applications creates a combinatorial explosion of execution paths that must be analyzed over time . this paper introduces RampoNN, a novel framework that systematically identifies kinetic vulnerability given the control code . it uses deep Bernstein neural networks, which are equipped with customized reachability algorithms .
label: ai

text: existing audio-language models excel at retrieval tasks with limited adoption as general-purpose encoders . we identify three key barriers: limited large-scale audio-text corpora, insufficient caption diversity, and lack of systematic exploration and evaluation . to this end, we introduce CaptionStew, a 10.7M caption dataset aggregating diverse open-source audio . text and audio representation learning across multiple domains and captioning styles .
label: ai

text: UL-MIMO enables the transmission of two data streams on one frequency band in strong RF conditions, theoretically doubling throughput and efficiency . ul-CA allows for simultaneous upload on greater channel widths, allowing more resources to be assigned to a single UE for higher throughput . in the united states, a mobile network operator (MNO) has deployed network-wide 5G Standalone (SA) along with UL . on time division duplex (TDD) band n41 and
label: ai

text: in recent work arXiv:2503.12582, we proposed a modular control architecture for a generate-when-request type network . this control architecture enables quantum network applications to be executed on end nodes running a modern operating system such as QNodeOS . in that work, we performed an evaluation of our architecture based on a proof-of-concept implementation .
label: ai

text: we propose a proximity-aware approach to redirect unsafe concepts to their semantically closest safe alternatives to minimize representational change . SaFeR-CLIP successfully reconciles safety and performance, recovering up to 8.0% in zero-shot accuracy over prior methods while maintaining robust safety . respecting the geometry of pretrained representations is key to achieving safety without sacrificing performance .
label: ai

text: free theories obtained by a generalization of the central limit Theorem to Grassmann variables . this enables the realization of the free Dirac spinor at infinite width and a four fermion interaction at finite width . a large class of interacting supersymmetric quantum mechanics and field theory models are introduced by super-affine transformations on the input that realize a superspace formalism .
label: ai

text: in this Perspective article, we propose several properties that scalable quantum computational science methods should possess . we further discuss how block-encodings and polynomial transformations can serve as a unified framework with the desired properties . scalability of QSP methods on parallel and distributed quantum architectures are presented . this perspective article is a gentle introduction of state-of-the-art quantum algorithms to the computational science community .
label: ai

text: Segment Anything Model (SAM) 3 is a unified model that detects, segments, and tracks objects in images and videos based on concept prompts . the model consists of an image-level detector and a memory-based video tracker that share a single backbone . SAM 3 doubles the accuracy of existing systems in both image and video PCS, and improves previous capabilities on visual segmentation tasks .
label: ai

text: noise removal techniques that preserve image fidelity are important for analyzing and interpreting images of a neutron source . recent advances in synthetic data production have opened opportunities to investigate new denoising procedures using both supervised and unsupervised machine learning methods . the network successfully denoises neutron imaging data and demonstrates lower reconstruction error and superior edge preservation metrics when benchmarked with data generated by a forward model and compared to non-ML-based filtering mechanisms .
label: ai

text: passwords remain the primary defense against unauthorized access, but users often tend to use passwords that are easy to remember . this behavior significantly increases security risks, also due to the fact that traditional password strength evaluation methods are often inadequate . in this discussion paper, we present SODA ADVANCE, a data reconstruction tool aimed at evaluating password strength by leveraging publicly available data from multiple sources .
label: ai

text: dataset distillation offers a promising alternative by synthesizing compact datasets that preserve the learning behavior of full data . but extending dataset distillation to time-series forecasting is non-trivial due to two fundamental challenges: 1.temporal bias from strong autocorrelation . 2.insufficient diversity among synthetic samples, arising from the absence of explicit categorical priors to regularize trajectory variety .
label: ai

text: high-energy physics is a big data science that utilizes large-scale facilities, detectors, high-performance computing . the experimental workflow consumes a significant amount of computing resources, and its annual cost will continue to grow exponentially at future colliders . three types of quantum computing technologies, i.e., quantum gates, quantum annealing, and quantum-inspired, are actively investigated for high energy physics applications .

text: the PairHuman dataset contains more than 100K images that capture a variety of scenes, attire, and dual-person interactions . the dataset contains rich metadata including detailed image descriptions, person localization, human keypoints, and attribute tags . we also introduce DHumanDiff, which is a baseline specifically crafted for double-person portrait generation that features enhanced facial consistency and simultaneously balance in personalized person generation .
label: ai

text: macaque monkeys are widely studied in systems neuroscience and evolutionary research . we propose a method to generate their facial expressions using a style-based generative image model (i.e., StyleGAN2) to address data limitations, we implemented: data augmentation by synthesizing new facial expression images using motion transfer to animate still images with computer graphics . the proposed method outperforms models trained solely on original still images .
label: ai

text: existing methods often rely on manually crafted triggers and static data pipelines, which are rigid, labor-intensive, and inadequate for systematically evaluating modern defense robustness . in this work, we introduce textscAutoBackdoor, a general framework for automating backdoor injection, encompassing trigger generation, poisoned data construction and model fine-tuning via an autonomous agent-driven pipeline .
label: ai

text: codex-Verify is a multi-agent system that uses four specialized agents to detect different types of bugs . combining agents with different detection patterns finds more bugs than any single agent when the agents look for different problems . multiple vulnerabilities in the same code create exponentially more risk than previously thought . testing on 99 code samples with verified labels shows our system catches 76.1% of bugs, matching the best existing method while running faster and without test execution .
label: ai

text: copyright-aware benchmark of 108 Creative Commons-licensed systematic reviews . supplying structured PRISMA 2020 checklists yielded 78.7-79.7% accuracy versus 45.21% for manuscript-only input (p less than 0.0001) in a development cohort, accuracy ranged from 70.6-82.8% with distinct sensitivity-specificity trade-offs .

text: mereogeometry relies on mereology, the Lesniewski's theory of parts and wholes that is further extended with geometrical primitives and appropriate definitions . however, most approaches (i) depart from the original Lesnewsky's mereology which does not assume usual sets as a basis, (ii) restrict the logical power of mereology to a mere theory of part-whole relations . a seminal paper of Tarki shows up unclear foundations and we
label: ai

text: a production system manages 240,000 employee records over six months . the system operates in two integrated stages: a multi-stage cleaning pipeline that performs translation normalization, spelling correction, and entity deduplication during periodic synchronization from Microsoft SQL Server to PostgreSQL . retrieval-augmented generation framework powered by GPT-4o translates natural-language questions in Turkish, Russian, and English into validated SQL queries .

text: we test detection and steering across Phi-3-mini-4k (3.8B), Qwen2.5-7B (safety-trained) and Dolphin-Llama-3.1-8B (uncensored). Detection: all models show AUROC 0.996-1.00 at optimal layers . a cross-model probe agreement is limited, revealing architecture-specific implementations .

text: SNOMED CT is a biomedical ontology with a hierarchical representation of large-scale concepts . this problem is exacerbated when the queries are out-of-vocabulary . the approach is generalisable and can be extended to other ontologies . we release code, tools, and evaluation datasets at https://github.com/jonathondilworth/HR-OOV.

text: persistent homology (PH), a method from topological data analysis, provides objective and interpretable insights on artistic styles . we show how PH can, with statistical certainty, differentiate between artists, both from different artistic currents and from an AI-generated image in the artist's style .  Less than a quarter of a century ago, the artist was able to find a way of identifying artistic styles through a more structured lens .

text: multilingual LLMs demonstrate strong performance across diverse languages . but there has been limited systematic analysis of how language information is structured within their internal representation space and how it emerges across layers . results show language information becomes sharply separated in the first transformer block (+76.4$pm$8.2 percentage points from Layer 0 to 1) and remains almost fully linearly separable throughout model depth .
label: ai

text: test-time training on Nearest Neighbors for Large Language Models (Hardt and Sun, 2024) proposes adapting a language model at inference time by fine-tuning on retrieved nearest-neighbor sequences . we apply one gradient update per neighbor across GPT-2 (117M, 774M), GPT-Neo (1.3B), and R1-Distilled-Qwen2.5-1.5B .

text: if a human-authored article is slightly polished by AI, a shift will occur in the borderline decision of these AI detection models . the best 8 models were chosen to act as detectors for our primary concern, which is whether they would consider slightly polished human text as AI-generated . in English, some efforts were made to meet this challenge, but not in Arabic .

text: the rise of social networks has not only facilitated communication but also allowed the spread of harmful content . the exploration of concept-based explanations in toxicity detection remains limited . disproportionate attribution of concepts towards the target class often results in classification errors . we propose the curation of Targeted Lexicon Set, which captures toxic words that contribute to misclassification .

text: large language models are increasingly used in applications where alignment with human values is critical . this technique is static and does not lend itself to everyday situations involving dynamic values and preferences . in this paper, we present a practical, reproducible, and model-agnostic procedure to evaluate whether a prompt candidate can effectively steer generated text toward specific human values . we apply our method to a variant of the Wizard-Vicuna language model, using Schwartz's theory of basic human values and a structured evaluation through a
label: ai

text: adaptive decision boundary methods have shown great potential by eliminating manual threshold tuning . existing approaches assume isotropic distributions of known classes, restricting boundaries to balls and overlooking distributional variance along different directions . to address this limitation, we propose EliDecide, a novel method that learns ellipsoid decision boundaries with varying scales along different feature directions.

text: the ability of industrial-scale LLMs to comprehend low-resource languages is often overlooked . this neglect risks excluding millions of Tunisians from fully interacting with AI in their own language, pushing them toward French or English . such a shift threatens the preservation of the Tunisian dialect but may also create challenges for literacy and influence younger generations to favor foreign languages .

text: Benchmarking Local LLM Inference from 360° allows users to define their own custom tasks . Bench360 automatically benchmarks selected LLMs, inference engines, and quantization levels across different usage scenarios . there is no single best setup for local inference, which strongly motivates the need for a framework such as Bench360 . the results reveal several interesting trade-offs between task performance and system-level efficiency .

text: existing vector database (VecDB) retrieval pipelines rely on flat or single-resolution indexing structures . this limitation leads to suboptimal trade-offs between retrieval speed and contextual relevance . textbfSemantic pyramid indexing (SPI) introduces query-adaptive resolution control for RAG in VecDBs .

text: despite rapid advances in multilingual natural language processing, the Bantu language Shona remains under-served in terms of morphological analysis and language-aware tools . the system combines a curated JSON lexicon with linguistically grounded rules to model noun-class prefixes (Mupanda 1-18), verbal subject concords and tense-aspect markers .

text: in this paper we present a method to solve initial value problems for fractional growth models . a discretization of the Caputo derivative we propose a fractional artificial neural network, which is implemented in the statistical software R . we show examples where the analytical solutions and the approximation of the artificial neural networks are compared . this paper is based on an analysis of the fractional neural network .

text: pepBridge is a novel framework for the joint design of protein surface and structure that seamlessly integrates receptor surface geometry and biochemical properties . it uses denoising diffusion bridge models (DDBMs) to map receptor surfaces to ligand surfaces . a multi-model diffusion model predicts the corresponding structure . this integrated approach facilitates surface complementarity, conformational stability, and chemical feasibility .

text: existing distillation methods focus on synthesizing datasets that enable training randomly initialized models . in contrast, state-of-the-art vision approaches are increasingly building on large, pre-trained self-supervised models rather than training from scratch . we introduce a method of dataset distillation that optimizes the synthetic images such that, when passed through a feature extractor, they induce gradients in the linear classifier .

text: noPo-Avatar reconstructs avatars solely from images, without any pose input . pose-dependent reconstruction degrades results significantly if pose estimates are noisy . thuman2.0, XHuman, and HuGe100K data show that nopo-avatar outperforms existing baselines in practical settings (without ground-truth poses)

text: our code and models are available at https://github.com/mbzuai-oryx/EvoLMM . the framework instantiates two cooperative agents from a single backbone model . this dynamic feedback encourages both the generation of informative queries and the refinement of structured reasoning without relying on ground-truth or human judgments .

text: thinking-while-generating (TwiG) is the first interleaved framework that enables co-evolving textual reasoning throughout the visual generation process . this dynamic interplay produces more context-aware and semantically rich visual outputs . code will be released at: https://github.com/ZiyuGuo99/Thinking-whiles-Generating .

text: existing reasoning-oriented visual language models (RLs) mainly pursue lengthy, detailed reasoning chains, which often lead to excessive computational costs . the approach consists of two stages: in the first stage, we label data as either requiring fast thinking or slow thinking based on the model output length . despite its simplicity, our model significantly outperforms the base model and achieves performance on par with state-of-the-art visual reasoning models .

text: video is a new answer modality for Next-Event Prediction (NEP) . the established task takes a video with a procedural or predictive question as input to predict the next event in text . this shift from telling to showing unlocks more intuitive and customized answers for procedural learning and creative exploration . to address this, we introduce VANS, a model that leverages reinforcement learning to align a Vision-Language Model (VLM) and a Video Diffusion Model for VNEP
label: ai

text: V-ReasonBench is a benchmark designed to assess video reasoning across four key dimensions: structured problem-solving, spatial cognition, pattern-based inference, and physical dynamics . the benchmark is built from both synthetic and real-world image sequences and provides a diverse set of answer-verifiable tasks that are reproducible, scalable, and unambiguous .

text: despite recent progress, existing methods often suffer from limited controllability and degraded quality, falling short of comprehensive multi-object 9-DoF pose control . to support training, we construct a new dataset, ObjectPose9D, which aggregates images from diverse sources along with 9D pose annotations . the second stage fine-tunes the model using a reward-based objective on rebalanced data .

text: the emergence of Large Language Models (LLMs) with strong reasoning capabilities marks a significant milestone, unlocking new frontiers in complex problem-solving . however, training these reasoning models encounters critical efficiency bottlenecks: response generation during RL training exhibits a persistent long-tail distribution . a few very long responses dominate execution time, wasting resources and inflating costs . to address this, we propose TLT, a system that accelerates reasoning training losslessly by integrating adaptive specul

text: new work on model compression through pruning and knowledge distillation has reduced this cost . however, this process still incurs hundreds of billions of tokens worth of training cost per compressed model . each of these submodels shares weights with the parent model and can be extracted zero-shot during deployment without additional training or fine-tuning . in this paper, we present Nemotron Elastic, a framework for building reasoning-oriented LLMs .

text: TriDiff-4D enables skeleton-driven 4D generation that excels in temporal consistency, motion accuracy, computational efficiency, and visual fidelity . existing methods exhibit fundamental limitations that impede their broader applicability, including temporal and geometric inconsistencies, perceptual artifacts, motion irregularities, high computational costs, and limited control over dynamics . to address these challenges, we propose a novel 4D generative pipeline that employs diffusion-based triplane re-posing to produce

text: learning multi-fingered robot policies from humans performing daily tasks in natural environments has long been a grand goal in the robotics community . despite substantial efforts, progress has been bottle-necked by the embodiment gap between humans and robots, as well as by difficulties in extracting relevant contextual and motion cues . we claim that with simple yet sufficiently powerful hardware for obtaining human data, we are now one significant step closer to achieving this dream .

text: we synthesize cognitive science research into a taxonomy of 28 cognitive elements spanning reasoning invariants, meta-cognitive controls, representations for organizing reasoning & knowledge, and transformation operations . we introduce a fine-grained evaluation framework and conduct the first large-scale empirical analysis of 192K traces from 18 models across text, vision, and audio .

text: UV unwrapping combines high-level semantic part decomposition with novel geometric heuristics in a top-down recursive framework . it ensures each chart's distortion remains below a user-specified threshold while minimizing the total number of charts . the pipeline integrates and extends parameterization and packing algorithms, incorporates dedicated handling of non-manifold and degenerate meshes .

text: this paper presents the implementation of an advanced artificial intelligence-based trading system specifically designed for the EUR-USD pair . the methodological approach centers on integrating a holistic set of input features: key fundamental macroeconomic variables (for example, Gross Domestic Product and Unemployment Rate) collected from both the Euro Zone and the United States, alongside a comprehensive suite of technical variables (including indicators, oscillators, Fibonacci levels, and price divergences) the performance of the resulting algorithm is evaluated using standard machine learning metrics to quantify predictive

text: Cambrian-S aims to take the first steps towards improving video world models with spatial supersensing by introducing two benchmarks . we introduce a simple baseline, NoSense, which discards almost all temporal structure and uses only a bag-of-words SigLIP model . this shows benchmarks like VSR can be nearly solved without spatial cognition or world modeling . sanity check on the VSC-Repeat: we concatenate each video with itself 1-5

text: teacher-guided pruning framework tightly integrates Knowledge Distillation (KD) with importance score estimation . method leverages gradient signals informed by the teacher during importance score calculation to identify and retain parameters most critical for task performance and knowledge transfer . we employ sparsity-aware retraining with and without KD to recover accuracy without reactivating pruned connections . the proposed framework offers a computationally efficient alternative to iterative pruning schemes like COLT .

text: ES is a set of powerful blackbox optimisation methods that can handle non-differentiable or noisy objectives with excellent scaling potential through parallelisation . text: previous 3DHS methods have overlooked following two challenges: multi-label learning with a parameter-sharing model can lead to multi-hierarchy conflicts . to address these issues, we propose a novel framework with primary 3dHS branch and an auxiliary discrimination branch . the late-decoupled architecture can mitigate the underfitting and overfitting conflicts among multiple hierarchies and can constrain the class imbalance problem in each individual hierarchy .

text: recent advances in 3D models suffer from time-intensive denoising and post-denoising processing due to the massive number of Gaussian primitives . text: codec2Vec is the first speech representation learning framework that relies exclusively on discrete audio codec units . this approach offers several advantages, including improved data storage and transmission efficiency, faster training, and enhanced data privacy . it achieves competitive performance compared to continuous-input models while reducing storage requirements by up to 16.5x and training time by 2.3x .

(2023) but it relies on encoding lexicographic orders with big integers, which quickly becomes infeasible for large symmetries .

text: SurvAgent is the first hierarchical chain-of-thought multi-agent system for multimodal survival prediction . the system consists of two stages: WSI-Gene CoT-Enhanced Case Bank Construction, . a cross-Modal Similarity-Aware Patch Mining, and Confidence - aware patch mining . both generate structured reports with CoT reasoning, storing complete analytical processes for experiential learning .

text: policy gradient methods offer an effective and efficient framework for reinforcement learning problems . but their performances can often be unsatisfactory, suffering from unreliable reward improvements and slow convergence . in this paper, we propose a universal reward profiling framework that can be seamlessly integrated with any policy gradient algorithm . we selectively update the policy based on high-confidence performance estimations .

text: MedBayes-Lite embeds uncertainty quantification directly into existing transformer pipelines without any retraining or architectural rewiring . the framework integrates three components: (i) Bayesian Embedding Calibration using Monte Carlo dropout for epistemic uncertainty, (ii) Uncertainty-Weighted Attention that marginalizes over token reliability .

text: SAM 3D excels in natural images, where occlusion and scene clutter are common . human- and model-in-the-loop pipeline provides visually grounded 3D reconstruction data . we obtain significant gains over recent work, with at least a 5:1 win rate in human preference tests on real-world objects and scenes . a new challenge benchmark for 3D object reconstruction will be released in the wild .

text: Adaptive guided upsampling (AGU) is an efficient method for upscaling low-light images . it transfers image characteristics from a guidance image to the target image . the method can render high-quality images in real time using low-quality input . our experiments demonstrate that it is superior to state-of-the-art methods .

text: the real-world food datasets tend to be long-tailed distributed . some dishes of different categories exhibit subtle variations that are difficult to distinguish visually . in this paper, we present a framework empowered with large language models (LLMs) to address these challenges in food recognition . we first leverage LLMs to parse food images to generate food titles and ingredients .
label: ai

text: we introduce LIARS' BENCH, a testbed consisting of 72,863 examples of lies and honest responses generated by four open-weight models across seven datasets . the model's reason for lying and the object of belief targeted by the lie vary along two dimensions . existing techniques fail to identify certain types of lies, especially in settings where it's not possible to determine whether the model lied from the transcript alone .
label: ai

text: the rapid growth of quantum computing poses a threat to the cryptographic foundations of digital systems . we introduce a post-quantum-secure evoting architecture that integrates Falcon lattice-based digital signatures, biometric authentication via mobileNetV3 and AdaFace . the system demonstrates low latency and robust spoof detection, monitored through Prometheus and Grafana for real-time auditing .
label: ai

text: advances in plant phenotyping have driven widespread adoption of multi sensor platforms for collecting crop canopy reflectance data . this includes the collection of heterogeneous data across multiple platforms, with unmanned aerial vehicles seeing significant usage due to their high performance in crop monitoring, forecasting, and prediction tasks . such missions are bound to the limitation of spatial resolution, which hinders their effectiveness for modern farming systems focused on micro-plot management .
label: ai

text: CuriGS is a curriculum-guided framework for sparse-view 3D reconstruction using 3DGS . the framework is designed to provide a high-fidelity representation for real-time scene reconstruction and rendering . curiGS uses pseudo-views sampled around ground-truth poses . each sampled student is regularized via depth-correlation and co-regularization .
label: ai

text: existing approaches to measuring AI exposure in the workforce predominantly rely on concurrent market conditions, offering limited predictive capacity for anticipating future disruptions . we employ four distinct analytical approaches to identify the domains and timeframes in which public discourse serves as a leading signal for employment changes . findings suggest monitoring online discourse can provide actionable intelligence for workers making reskilling decisions and organizations anticipating skill requirements .
label: ai

text: HGCN2SP is a novel model with a hierarchical graph designed for 2SP problems . the model is trained in a reinforcement learning paradigm to utilize the feedback of the solver . it provides high-quality decisions in short computational time . however, current approaches typically rely on clustering or Monte Carlo sampling, failing to integrate scenario information deeply and overlooking the significant impact .
label: ai

text: proposed method involves training a convolutional neural network (CNN) on a dataset of laser speckle patterns to recognize distinct material types for safe and efficient cutting . previous methods for material classification using speckle sensing may face issues when the color of the laser used to produce the speckle pattern is changed . the proposed method achieved an accuracy of 98.30 % on the training set and 96.88% on the validation set .
label: ai

text: deterministic fractional and randomized integral online matchings achieve the same competitive ratio of $1-frac1e$ . surprisingly, these ratios are not the same . it was already known that for fractional matching, a $0.75$ competitive ratio algorithm is optimal by giving a matching lower-bound . this yields a separation between the two problems, showing that it is impossible to obtain a perfect rounding scheme .
label: ai

text: sparsely-gated Mixture-of-Experts (MoE) architectures rely on fine-tuning pre-trained diffusion models through low-Rank Adaptation module to reconstruct high-resolution images . however, these dense Real-ISR models are limited in their ability to adaptively capture the heterogeneous characteristics of complex real-world degraded samples .
label: ai

text: the real time throughput maximization problem is a generalization of real time scheduling problem . we assume that jobs are announced before or at their release time . the goal is to maximize the value of the sum of the processing times of jobs that finish before their deadline . a $fract2t+1$-competitive algorithm is optimal for all algorithms with $t$-advance-notice .
label: ai

text: a sequence-level optimization framework is introduced to generate natural, printable adversarial textures for shirts, trousers, and hats . a physically based human-garment pipeline is then employed to simulate motion, multi-angle camera viewpoints, cloth dynamics, and illumination variation . Extensive experiments demonstrate strong and stable concealment, high robustness to viewpoint changes, and superior cross-model transferability .
label: ai

text: SpellForger is a game where players create custom spells by writing natural language prompts . the system uses a supervisedtrained BERT model to interpret player prompts, aiming to provide a unique experience of personalization and creativity . we expect to deliver a functional prototype that demonstrates the generation of spells in real time, applied to an engaging gameplay loop .
label: ai

text: large language models (LLMs) have demonstrated impressive capabilities across a range of reasoning and generation tasks . however, research studies have shown that LLMs lack the ability to identify causal relationships, a fundamental cornerstone of human intelligence . we first conduct an exploratory investigation of LLM's behavior when asked to perform a causal-discovery task and find that they mostly rely on the semantic meaning of variable names, ignoring the observation data .
label: ai

text: detecting out-of-distribution (OOD) data is essential for safe deployment of deep neural networks (DNNs) this problem becomes particularly challenging in the presence of long-tailed data, often leading to high false positive rates (FPR) and low tail-class ID classification accuracy . we use the feature space of a pre-trained model to initialize our graph structure .
label: ai

text: existing frameworks for museum information systems struggle to integrate heterogeneous metadata, unstructured documents, and multimodal artefacts into a coherent and queryable form . MuseKG constructs a typed property graph linking objects, people, organisations, and visual or textual labels . evaluations on real museum collections demonstrate robust performance across queries over attributes, relations, and related entities .
label: ai

text: high-resolution mapping of fine particulate matter (PM2.5) is a cornerstone of sustainable urbanism but remains critically hindered by the spatial sparsity of ground monitoring networks . traditional data-driven methods attempt to bridge this gap using satellite Aerosol Optical Depth (AOD), they often suffer from severe non-random data missingness (e.g., due to cloud cover or nighttime) and inversion biases .
label: ai

text: the rapid expansion of latency-sensitive applications has sparked renewed interest in deploying edge computing capabilities aboard satellite constellations . the dynamic nature of satellite orbits necessitates effective service migration strategies to maintain service continuity and quality as the coverage areas of satellites evolve . to solve this problem, we propose a Graph-Aware Temporal Encoder that jointly models spatial correlations and temporal dynamics .
label: ai

text: some quantum frameworks for analyzing adaptive reprogramming were given by unruh (CRYPTO 2014, EUROCRYPT 2015), Grilo-Hövelmanns-Hülsing-Majenz and Pan-Zeng (PKC 2024). these adaptive results follow from the emphnonadaptive one-way to hiding theorem of Ambainis .
label: ai

text: we propose a novel framework that synergistically integrates two complementary approaches: Sub-treatment Group Alignment (SGA) and Random Temporal Masking (RTM) to address these challenges, we propose an alternative approach to identifying fine-grained sub-treatment groups . we theoretically demonstrate that SGA optimizes a tighter upper bound on counterfactual risk, thus leading to more effective deconfounding .
label: ai

text: INFCODE-C++ is the first C++-aware autonomous system for end-to-end issue resolution . the system combines two complementary retrieval mechanisms to construct accurate, language-based context for repair . it achieves a resolution rate of 25.58%, outperforming the strongest prior agent by 10.85 percentage points and more than doubling the performance of MSWE-agent .
label: ai

text: infCode is an adversarial multi-agent framework for automated repository-level issue resolution . the framework runs inside a containerized environment that supports realistic repository inspection, modification, and validation . it achieves 79.4% performance on SWE-bench Verified, establishing a new state-of-the-art . we have released InfCode as an open-source project at https://github.com/Tokfinity/InfCode .
label: ai

text: we introduce a novel command & control architecture leveraging the Model Context Protocol (MCP) to coordinate distributed, adaptive reconnaissance agents covertly across networks . we find that our architecture improves goal-directed behavior of the system as whole, but also eliminates key host and network artifacts that can be used to detect and prevent commands . asynchronous, parallel operations and real-time intelligence sharing without periodic beaconing show drastic reduction in manual effort and detection footprint .
label: ai

text: sensorium arc (AI reflects on climate) is a real-time multimodal interactive AI agent system that personifies the ocean as a poetic speaker . it enables natural spoken conversations with AI agents that embodies the ocean's perspective . the system dynamically triggers data visualizations and audiovisual playback based on time, location, and thematic cues drawn from the dialogue .
label: ai

text: QueryGym provides a unified framework for implementing, executing, and comparing llm-based reformulation methods . the toolkit offers: (1) a Python API for applying diverse LLM-based methods, (2) a retrieval-agnostic interface supporting integration with backends such as Pyserini and PyTerrier .
label: ai

text: existing work often assumes a set of predefined pushing modes and fixed-shape objects . this work tackles the general problem of controlling a robotic fleet to push collaboratively numerous arbitrary objects to respective destinations . it incorporates several characteristic challenges for multi-robot systems such as online task coordination under large uncertainties of cost and duration, and for contact-rich tasks such as hybrid switching among different contact modes .
label: ai

text: retrieval-augmented generation (RAG) can constrain outputs, but safe deployment requires assessing reasoning as rigorously as retrieval . this gap is especially concerning in clinical settings, where outputs must align with structured protocols . in evaluating model responses to curated clinician-vetted questions, we find errors persist even when authoritative passages are provided . to address this gap, we propose an evaluation framework that measures accuracy, consistency, and fidelity of reasoning .
label: ai

text: large Language Models (LLMs) can be backdoored to exhibit malicious behavior . the phenomenon known as "sleeper agents" persists through safety training, yet no practical detection methods exist . our approach uses Sentence-BERT embeddings to measure semantic deviation from safe baselines . we present a novel dual-method detection system combining semantic drift analysis with canary baseline comparison .
label: ai

text: digital agriculture is transforming the way we grow food by utilizing technology to address global food challenges . but farmers are hesitant to share it due to privacy concerns . the platform enables farmers to collaborate on analyzing farm data without exposing private information . we employ specialized techniques such as differential privacy, and data analysis methods to safeguard the data while maintaining its utility for research purposes .
label: ai

text: large-scale neuromorphic architectures consist of computing tiles that communicate spikes using a shared interconnect . these characteristics require optimized interconnects to handle high-activity bursts while consuming minimal power during idle periods . the dynamic segmented bus has gained attention due to its structural simplicity, scalability, and energy efficiency . in this paper, we present a design methodology for a scenario-aware control plane that can scale efficiently with the network .
label: ai

text: multimodal large language models (MLLMs) have shown strong potential for medical image reasoning, yet fairness remains a major concern . existing methods often rely on large labeled datasets or fine-tuning, which are impractical for foundation-scale models . to address this, we propose fairness-aware demonstration selection (FADS), which builds demographically balanced demonstrations via clustering-based sampling .
label: ai

text: detection-guided generative framework predicts hierarchical category and attribute tokens . for each detected object, we extract refined ROI-level features and employ a BART-based generator to produce semantic tokens in a coarse-to-fine sequence covering category hierarchies and property-value pairs . the approach significantly outperforms existing similarity-based pipelines and multi-stage classification systems, achieving stronger fine-grained recognition .
label: ai

text: machine unlearning algorithms aim to remove the impact of selected training data from a model without the computational expenses of retraining from scratch . the stochastic version of D2D is widely implemented as the finetuning" unlearning baseline, despite lacking theoretical backing on nonconvex functions . in this work, we prove $(, )$ certified unlearning guarantees .
label: ai

text: the lack of epidemiological data in wireless sensor networks (WSNs) is a fundamental difficulty in constructing robust models to forecast and mitigate threats such as viruses and worms . many studies have examined different epidemic models for WSNs, focusing on how malware infections spread given the network's specific properties, including energy limits and node mobility . in this study, an agent-based implementation of the susceptible-exposed-infected-recovered-vaccinated (SEIRV) mathematical model was employed for machine learning
label: ai

text: large-scale genomic workflows used in precision medicine can process datasets spanning tens to hundreds of gigabytes per sample . simple static resource allocation methods struggle to handle variability in per-chromosome RAM demands, resulting in poor resource utilization and long runtimes . in this work, we propose multiple mechanisms for adaptive, RAM-efficient parallelization .
label: ai

text: to address this gap, we propose TOD-ProcBench, a challenging benchmark featuring complex process instructions with intricate, fine-grained constraints . we design three tasks to comprehensively benchmark LLMs' complex instruction-following capabilities in multi-turn TODs . task 1 evaluates how LLM's retrieve the most relevant statement from a complex instruction and predict the next action .
label: ai

text: KRAL (Knowledge and Reasoning Augmented Learning) is a low-cost, scalable, privacy-preserving paradigm that leverages teacher-model reasoning to automatically distill knowledge and reasoning trajectories via answer-to-question reverse generation . heuristic learning for semi-supervised data augmentation reduces assessment costs, while modular interface design facilitates seamless system updates .
label: ai

text: GLNWOA integrates a log-normal distribution model into WOA to improve convergence dynamics and search diversity . deploying 25 nodes in a 60 m $times$60 m area achieved a 99.0013% coverage rate, outperforming AROA, WOA, HHO, ROA, and WOABAT by up to 15.5% .
label: ai

text: quantitative machine learning (QML) is a computational paradigm that seeks to apply quantum-mechanical resources to solve learning problems . the goal of this framework is to leverage quantum processors to tackle optimization, supervised, unsupervised and reinforcement learning, and generative modeling-among other tasks-more efficiently than classical models . we outline the field's tensions between practicality and guarantees, access models and speedups .
label: ai

text: multi-task learning can suffer from destructive task interference . jointly trained models underperform single-task baselines and limit generalization . consistency regularization approach is composed of differentiable BI-RADS-inspired morphological features . proposed approach achieves state-of-the-art segmentation performance under rigorous external validation on the uDIAT dataset .
label: ai

text: the strong generalization ability of CLIP has facilitated open-vocabulary semantic segmentation, which labels pixels using arbitrary text . existing methods that fine-tune CLIP for segmentation often lead to overfitting and degrade the pretrained vision-language alignment . InfoCLIP leverages an information-theoretic perspective to transfer alignment knowledge from pretrained CLIP to the segmentation task .
label: ai

text: a self-supervised representation was pretrained with the large MIR spectral library and the Variational Autoencoder algorithm to obtain a compressed latent space . at this stage, only unlabeled data were used, allowing us to leverage the full-spectral database and the availability of scan repeats for augmented training . we also leveraged and froze the trained MIR decoder for a spectrum conversion task by plugging it into a NIR encoder to learn the mapping between N
label: ai

text: binary options trading is often marketed as a field where predictive models can generate consistent profits . however, the inherent randomness and stochastic nature of binary options make price movements highly unpredictable . results reinforce the notion that binary options lack predictable patterns, making them unsuitable for machine learning-based forecasting . despite these exhaustive efforts, none of the models surpassed the ZeroR baseline accuracy .
label: ai

text: small language models have shown promise on various reasoning tasks . previous work on LLM-as-a-judge frameworks typically relies on comparing candidate answers against ground-truth labels . but this approach is inherently indirect and difficult to fully automate . in this work, we propose JudgeBoard, a novel evaluation pipeline that directly queries models to assess the correctness of candidate answers without requiring extra answer comparison .
label: ai

text: conventional asynchronous Byzantine agreement protocols require every party to broadcast its requests (e.g., transactions), and at the end of the protocol, parties agree on one party's request . the protocol becomes expensive if parties agree . we propose Slim-HBBFT, an atomic broadcast protocol that considers requests from a fraction of $n$ parties and improves communication complexity by a factor of $O(n)$ .
label: ai

text: sound offers a powerful channel for interaction, encompassing both operational noises and intentionally designed auditory cues . results show that consequential and functional sounds of the Kinova Gen3 manipulator did not negatively affect perceptions, spatial localization is highly accurate for lateral cue . spatial sounds can simultaneously convey task-relevant information while promoting warmth and reducing discomfort . findings highlight potential of functional and transformative auditory design to enhance human-robot collaboration .
label: ai

text: the system delivers 115 peta-ops at 4-bit integer precision and 3.7 PB/s of memory bandwidth across 18 2U servers . the system can run 3 simultaneous instances of the 8-billion-parameter open-source granite-3.3-8b-instruct model at 2,048 context length with 28 simultaneous users and a per-user inter-token latency of 2.8 ms .
label: ai

text: Click2Graph is the first interactive framework for Panoptic Video Scene Graph Generation (VSGG) that unifies visual prompting with spatial, temporal, and semantic understanding . the framework introduces two key components: a Dynamic Interaction Discovery Module that generates subject-conditioned object prompts, and a Semantic Classification Head that performs joint entity and predicate reasoning .
label: ai

text: 3D echocardiography is a developing modality that offers adequate image quality for clinical use . a series of 2D videos show individual cardiac structures . the results were validated using a deep learning view classifier and downstream heuristics based on anatomical landmarks . it was validated by three cardiologists in blinded evaluation (96% accuracy in 1,600 videos)
label: ai

text: cyclic diagram monoids have representation gaps of exponential growth . we classify their simple representations and compute their dimensions in terms of the underlying diagram algebra . they quantify their resistance as platforms against linear attacks on cryptographic protocols that exploit small dimensional representations .  Less than a quarter of a billion cryptographic prototypers have been able to rely on a similar algorithm to be used in cryptography .
label: ai

text: contrastive learning framework designed to improve multi-label and cross-granularity alignment . MGLL leverages structured multilabel supervision and integrates textual descriptions across granularities . the code is available at hrefhttps://github.com/HUANGLIZI/MGLL . in downstream tasks, the code can be downloaded from github .
label: ai

text: iLTM unifies tree-derived embeddings, dimensionality-agnostic representations, meta-trained hypernetwork, multilayer perceptrons (MLPs) and retrieval within a single architecture . despite rapid progress, advances in deep learning have not fully carried over to the tabular domain, where gradient-boosted decision trees remain a default choice in practice .
label: ai

text: Lifefin is a generic and self-stabilizing protocol designed to integrate seamlessly with existing DAG-based BFT protocols . it enables zero-message ordering and implicit view changes . lifefin imposes (almost) zero overhead in typical cases while effectively eliminating liveness vulnerabilities . this work presents a fundamental liveness vulnerability: an adversary can trigger mempool explosions to prevent transaction commitment .
label: ai

text: this article provides a review of techniques developed in the past two decades to approximate and account for these model errors . we then survey major approaches: the Bayesian approximation error framework for implicit error quantification, embedded internal error models for structural uncertainty, model discrepancy modeling in bayesian calibration and its recent extensions . the review is written for practitioners of large-scale computational physics and engineering simulation, emphasizing how these methods can be integrated into PDE solvers .
label: ai

text: masked diffusion language models have emerged as a promising alternative to autoregressive generation . but their reliance on Transformer backbones limits inference efficiency due to quadratic attention and KV-cache overhead . in this work, we introduce DiffuApriel-H, a hybrid variant that interleaves attention and mamba layers, offering up to 2.6x throughput improvement .
label: ai

text: vision language models (VLMs) are becoming increasingly integral to multimedia understanding . but they often struggle with domain-specific video classification tasks . this stems from a critical textitrationale gap, where sparse domain data is insufficient to bridge the semantic distance between complex spatio-temporal content and abstract classification labels . we propose a two-stage self-improvement paradigm to bridge this gap without new annotations .
label: ai

text: a self correcting framework for large language models (LLMs) develops a framework that detects and mitigates hallucinations during multi-step reasoning . we design a composite reward function that penalizes unjustified high confidence and entropy spikes, while encouraging stable and accurate reasoning trajectories . our method improves both final answer accuracy and reasoning calibration, with ablations validating the individual contribution of each signal .
label: ai

text: AccelOpt is a self-improving large language model (LLM) agentic system that autonomously optimizes kernels for emerging AI acclerators . we build NKIBench, a new benchmark suite of AWS Trainium accelerator kernels with varying complexity extracted from real-world LLM workloads . Accelopt's capability improves over time, boosting the average peak throughput from $49%$ to $61%%$ on Trainium 1 and from $45
label: ai

text: a robot must align its actions with human goals, even as they change mid-task . prior approaches often assume fixed goals, reducing goal prediction to a one-time inference . but in real-world scenarios, humans frequently shift goals . we propose a method for detecting goal changes by tracking multiple candidate action sequences and verifying their plausibility against a policy bank .
label: ai

text: this paper presents the design of a gimballed rotor mechanism . a class of quadrotors achieves full actuation, enabling independent motion in all six degrees of freedom . the proposed system maintains a lightweight and easy-to-integrate design by incorporating servo motors . to accommodate this unconventional design, we develop a new control allocation scheme in PX4 Autopilot and present successful flight tests .
label: ai

text: the proposed system advances haptic-enabled multiphysics simulation by unifying fluid, soft-body, and rigid-body dynamics into a single platform suitable for immersive educational applications . the system integrates Smoothed Particle Hydrodynamics with two-way force coupling and feedback smoothing to maintain stability . this enables users to manipulate objects immersed in fluid and feel reaction forces consistent with fluid-structure behavior .
label: ai

text: FuncBind is a framework based on computer vision to generate target-conditioned, all-atom molecules across atomic systems . the framework uses neural fields to represent molecules as continuous atomic densities and employs score-based generative models with modern architectures adapted from the computer vision literature . it achieves competitive in silico performance in generating small molecules, macrocyclic peptides, and antibody complementarity-determining region loops .
label: ai

text: an advanced emotion classification model was developed using a CNN-Transformer architecture for emotion recognition from EEG brain wave signals . the model achieved a testing accuracy of 91%, outperforming traditional models such as SVM, DNN, and Logistic Regression . it allows for the reduction of the requirements of the EEG apparatus, by leveraging only 5 electrodes of the 62 . this reduction demonstrates the feasibility of deploying a more affordable consumer-grade EEG headset .
label: ai

text: speculative sampling reduces latency of autoregressive decoding for target model LLMs without sacrificing inference quality . recent work has explored the multi-draft extension, where at each step $n$ draft tokens are generated . the verification criterion is a distribution conditioned on these . finding the OT is difficult, as it is the solution of a linear program (OTLP) in over $Vn$ variables, with $V$ being the vocabulary size .
label: ai

text: activation steering significantly improves language models' Theory of Mind (ToM) but the mechanisms of what changes occur internally that leads to different outputs remains unclear . we propose decomposing ToM in LLMs by comparing steered versus baseline LLM activations using linear probes trained on 45 cognitive actions . results suggest successful ToM abilities are mediated by emotional understanding, not analytical reasoning .
label: ai

text: motion2Mind focuses on false-belief tasks and reasoning with asymmetric information . it includes 222 types of nonverbal cues and 397 mind states . current AI systems struggle significantly with NVC interpretation, exhibiting not only a substantial performance gap in Detection, but patterns of over-interpretation in Explanation compared to human annotators .
label: ai
